d

da 1.1

letter. (gram) letter d; 26th letter of the alphabet; dental consonant ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter d; 26th letter of the alphabet; dental consonant
Sanskrit da

18. do dhassa ca.

bālāvatāra sarasandhi

sare pare dhassa kvaci do hoti.

bālāvatāra sarasandhi
da 2.1

adj. giving; offering; bestowing [√dā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dadāti
Meaning giving; offering; bestowing
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)
Construction √dā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit da
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

kiṃdado balado hoti,
kiṃdado hoti vaṇṇado,
kiṃdado sukhado hoti,
kiṃdado hoti cakkhudo,
ko ca sabbadado hoti,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ
daka

nt. water [√ud + aka] ✓

Grammar nt, abbrev of udaka
Meaning water
Root Family √ud
Root √ud･2 ṃa (be wet)
Construction √ud + aka
(u)duka > daka
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change ud > d (contraction)
Synonym ambu, jala, ka, oda, odaka, oka, salila, toya, uda, udaka, vāri
Sanskrit daka
Sanskrit Root √und √ud 6, 7 (wet)

sukkan'ti dasa sukkāni, nīlaṃ pītakaṃ lohitakaṃ odātaṃ takkavaṇṇaṃ dakavaṇṇaṃ telavaṇṇaṃ khīravaṇṇaṃ dadhivaṇṇaṃ sappivaṇṇaṃ.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
dakavaṇṇa

adj. water-coloured; transparent [daka + vaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning water-coloured; transparent
Construction daka + vaṇṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (daka + vaṇṇa)
Sanskrit daka + varṇa

sukkan'ti dasa sukkāni, nīlaṃ pītakaṃ lohitakaṃ odātaṃ takkavaṇṇaṃ dakavaṇṇaṃ telavaṇṇaṃ khīravaṇṇaṃ dadhivaṇṇaṃ sappivaṇṇaṃ.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
dakābhisecana

nt. ritual bathing with water; ablution with water; ritual water purification [daka + abhisecana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning ritual bathing with water; ablution with water; ritual water purification
Construction daka + abhisecana
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dakena + abhisecana)
Commentary (THIa) dak'ābhisecanā sinānena tato pāpakammā
Sanskrit daka + abhiṣeka

kummaggapaṭipannaṃ maṃ,
ariyamaggaṃ samānayi,
dak'ābhisecanā bhoti,
imaṃ sāṭaṃ dadāmi te.

THI 65 puṇṇātherīgāthā

orabbhikā sūkarikā,
macchikā migabandhakā,
corā ca vajjhaghātā ca,
ye c'aññe pāpakammino,
dak'ābhisecanā te'pi,
pāpakammā pamuccare.

THI 65 puṇṇātherīgāthā
dakāsaya 1

adj. who lives in water; living underwater [daka + āsaya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who lives in water; living underwater
Construction daka + āsaya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dakamhi + āsaya)
Variant udakāsaya
Commentary (SNa) dak'āsayā'ti udakavāsino macchakacchap'ādayo.
Sanskrit udaka + āśraya
dakāsaya 2

masc. creature living in water ✗
dakkha

adj. expert; skilled; able; adroit [√dakkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from dakkhati
Meaning expert; skilled; able; adroit
Root Family √dakkh
Root √dakkh×1 a (be able, please)
Construction √dakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (DNa) dakkho'ti cheko paṭibalo nhānīyacuṇṇāni kātuñ'c'eva payojetuñ'ca sannetuñ'ca.
Sanskrit dakṣa
Sanskrit Root √dakṣ 1 (be able)

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo ye te bhattu abbhantarā kamm'antā, uṇṇā'ti vā kappāsā'ti vā, tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho nhāpako vā nhāpak'antevāsī vā kaṃsathāle nhānīyacuṇṇāni ākiritvā udakena paripphosakaṃ paripphosakaṃ sanneyya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
dakkhakammāraputtaukkāmukhasukusalasampahaṭṭha

adj. very skilfully wrought in the forge by an able smith's son; adroitly forged in the furnace by a skilled smith's son [dakkha + kammāraputta + ukkāmukha + sukusala + sampahaṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very skilfully wrought in the forge by an able smith's son; adroitly forged in the furnace by a skilled smith's son
Construction dakkha + kammāraputta + ukkāmukha + sukusala + sampahaṭṭha
Commentary (SNa) dakkha-kammāraputta-ukkāmukha-sukusala-sampahaṭṭhan'ti sukusalena kammāraputtena ukkāmukhe pacitvā sampahaṭṭhaṃ.
Sanskrit dakṣa + kammāra + putra + ukkā + mukha + su + kuśala + sampraghṛṣṭa

seyyathā'pi nāma nikkhaṃ jambonadaṃ dakkha-kammāraputta-ukkāmukha-sukusala-sampahaṭṭhaṃ paṇḍukambale nikkhittaṃ bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
dakkhakammāraputtasuparikammakata

adj. finely crafted by a skilled young blacksmith [dakkha + kammāraputta + suparikammakata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning finely crafted by a skilled young blacksmith
Construction dakkha + kammāraputta + suparikammakata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dakkhakammāraputtena + suparikammakata)
Commentary (ANa) dakkhakammāraputtasuparikammakatan'ti dakkhena suvaṇṇakāraputtena suṭṭhu kataparikammaṃ.
Sanskrit dakṣa + kammāra + putra + su + parikarman + kṛta
dakkhati 1

pr. (+acc) sees; finds [√dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sees; finds
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dakkha (irreg)
Construction dakkha + ti
Variant dakkhiti
Notes only occurs as a future verb in Sanskrit
Sanskrit paśyati, drakṣati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

passaṃ naro dakkhati nāmarūpaṃ,
disvāna vā ñassati tāni'm'eva,
kāmaṃ bahuṃ passatu appakaṃ vā,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

paṭisotagāmiṃ nipuṇaṃ,
gambhīraṃ duddasaṃ aṇuṃ,
rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
dakkhati 2

fut. (+acc) will see [√dis + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of dassati, trans (+acc)
Meaning will see
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a + ssa > dakkha (fut, irreg)
Construction dakkha + ti
Commentary (THa) paññāya dacchan'ti vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya dakkhissaṃ.
Sanskrit drakṣyati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

yāv'assa kāyo ṭhassati tāva naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā kāyassa bhedā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā na naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā'ti

DN 1.21 brahmajālasuttaṃ
dakkhati 3

fut. (+acc) will know [√dis + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of dassati, trans (+acc)
Meaning will know
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a + ssa > dakkha (fut, irreg)
Construction dakkha + ti
Commentary (THa) paññāya dacchan'ti vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya dakkhissaṃ.
Sanskrit drakṣyati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
dakkhi

aor. (+acc) saw [√dis + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of dakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning saw
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dakkha (irreg)
Construction dakkha + i
Variant adakkhi
Sanskrit adarśam
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

tesaṃ sutvāna sappaññā,
sacittaṃ paccaladdhā te,
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ,
dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ

vicinanto tadā dakkhiṃ,
dutiyaṃ sīlapāramiṃ,
pubbakehi mahesīhi,
āsevitanisevitaṃ.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā
dakkhiṇa 1

adj. right (hand side) [√dakkh + iṇa] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning right (hand side)
Root Family √dakkh
Root √dakkh×1 a (be able, please)
Construction √dakkh + iṇa
Derivative kita (iṇa)
Antonym vāma
Sanskrit dakṣiṇa
Sanskrit Root √dakṣ 1 (be able)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, bhikkhu paṃsukūliko rathiyāya nantakaṃ disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā, yo tattha sāro taṃ paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
dakkhiṇa 2

adj. south; southern [√dakkh + iṇa] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning south; southern
Root Family √dakkh
Root √dakkh×1 a (be able, please)
Construction √dakkh + iṇa
Derivative kita (iṇa)
Antonym uttara
Sanskrit dakṣiṇa
Sanskrit Root √dakṣ 1 (be able)

atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

AN 10.107 dhovanasuttaṃ

ko nu kho, bho, pahoti imaṃ mahāpathaviṃ uttarena āyataṃ dakkhiṇena sakaṭamukhaṃ sattadhā samaṃ suvibhattaṃ vibhajitun'ti?

DN 19.8 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
dakkhiṇagiri

masc. southern hills; area south of Rājagaha [dakkhiṇa + giri] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning southern hills; area south of Rājagaha
Construction dakkhiṇa + giri
Commentary (MNa) tattha dakkhiṇāgirismin'ti girī'ti pabbato, rājagahaṃ parikkhipitvā ṭhitapabbatassa dakkhiṇadisābhāge janapadass'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
dakkhiṇajanapada

masc. southern country ✗
dakkhiṇajāṇumaṇḍala

nt. right knee cap; lit. right knee circle [dakkhiṇa + jāṇu + maṇḍala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning right knee cap; lit. right knee circle
Construction dakkhiṇa + jāṇu + maṇḍala
Compound kammadhāraya (dakkhiṇa + jāṇumaṇḍala)
Sanskrit dakṣiṇa + jānu + maṇḍala

atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dakkhiṇajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ nihantvā yena te satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ nāmaṃ sāvesi

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
dakkhiṇato

ind. to the south (of); to the right; from the south ✗

Antonym uttaranta
dakkhiṇamādisati

pr. gives a gift (to); makes a donation (to); makes an offering (to) ✗
dakkhiṇasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.78 (AN4.78) ✗
dakkhiṇā

fem. gift; donation [√dakkh + iṇā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning gift; donation
Root Family √dakkh
Root √dakkh×1 a (be able, please)
Construction √dakkh + iṇā
Derivative kita (iṇā)
Notes (PED) Vedic dakṣiṇā to dakṣ as in daśasyati to honour, to consecrate, but taken as f. of dakkhiṇa by grammarians expl. as gift by the "giving" (i.e. the right) hand with popular analogy to dā to give (dadāti)
Sanskrit dakṣiṇā
Sanskrit Root √dakṣ 1 (be able)

vandanaṃ dāni vajjāsi,
lokanāthaṃ anuttaraṃ,
padakkhiṇañ'ca katvāna,
ādiseyyāsi dakkhiṇaṃ.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā

kāle dadanti sappaññā,
vadaññū vītamaccharā,
kālena dinnaṃ ariyesu,
ujubhūtesu t'ādisu,
vippasannamanā tassa,
vipulā hoti dakkhiṇā.

masc. South of India; lit. southern road [dakkhiṇā + patha] ✓

Meaning South of India; lit. southern road
Construction dakkhiṇā + patha
Compound kammadhāraya (dakkhiṇā + patha)
Commentary (VMVt) gaṅgāya dakkhiṇāya disāya deso dakkhiṇāpatho
Sanskrit dakṣiṇa + pathin

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya

VIN 4.5.158 mahākaccānassa pañcavaraparidassanā
dakkhiṇāpathaka

adj. belonging to the southern region; from the Deccan ✗
dakkhiṇābhimukha

dakkhiṇāvaṭṭakajāta

Construction dakkhiṇa + āvaṭṭaka + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (dakkhiṇāvaṭṭaka + jāta)
Variant dakkhiṇāvattakajāta
Sanskrit dakṣiṇa + āvartaka + jāta

uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

dakkhiṇenābhimukha

adj. southwards; lit. facing with south [dakkhiṇena + abhimukha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning southwards; lit. facing with south
Construction dakkhiṇena + abhimukha
Compound alutta tatiyā tappurisa (dakkhiṇena + abhimukha)
Sanskrit dakṣiṇa + abhimukha

tasmiṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, saṅgāme devā jiniṃsu, asurā parājayiṃsu. parājitā ca, bhikkhave, asurā apayiṃsu'y'eva dakkhiṇen'ābhimukhā, abhiyiṃsu devā. atha kho, bhikkhave, asurānaṃ etadahosi, abhiyant'eva kho devā.

AN 9.39 devāsurasaṅgāmasuttaṃ
dakkhiṇeyya 1

adj. worthy of gifts; worthy of offerings [√dakkh + iṇā + eyya] ✓

Grammar adj, from dakkhiṇā
Meaning worthy of gifts; worthy of offerings
Root Family √dakkh
Root √dakkh×1 a (be able, please)
Construction √dakkh + iṇā + eyya
dakkhiṇā + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Sanskrit ḍhaukana +
Sanskrit Root √dakṣ 1 (be able)

yadidaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā'ti

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

viceyya dānaṃ sugatappasatthaṃ,
ye dakkhiṇeyyā idha jīvaloke,
etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni,
bījāni vuttāni yathā sukhette'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ
dakkhiṇeyya 2

masc. recipient; who is worthy of gifts [√dakkh + iṇā + eyya] ✓

Grammar masc, from dakkhiṇā
Meaning recipient; who is worthy of gifts
Root Family √dakkh
Root √dakkh×1 a (be able, please)
Construction √dakkh + iṇā + eyya
dakkhiṇā + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Sanskrit ḍhaukana +
Sanskrit Root √dakṣ 1 (be able)

yaṃ kho, aggivessana, t'ādisaṃ dakkhiṇeyyaṃ āgamma avītarāgaṃ avītadosaṃ avītamohaṃ, taṃ dāyakānaṃ bhavissati. yaṃ kho, aggivessana, mādisaṃ dakkhiṇeyyaṃ āgamma vītarāgaṃ vītadosaṃ vītamohaṃ, taṃ tuyhaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
dakkhiṇeyyaggi

masc. fire (of hell for those abusing) someone worthy of gifts; lit. fire for offerings [dakkhiṇeyya + aggi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire (of hell for those abusing) someone worthy of gifts; lit. fire for offerings
Construction dakkhiṇeyya + aggi
Commentary (ANa) dakkhiṇeyy'aggī'ti ettha pana dakkhiṇā'ti cattāro paccayā, bhikkhusaṅgho dakkhiṇeyyo. so gihīnaṃ tīsu saraṇesu pañcasu sīlesu dasasu sīlesu mātāpituupaṭṭhāne dhammikasamaṇabrāhmaṇaupaṭṭhāne'ti evam'ādīsu kalyāṇadhammesu niyojanena bahūpakāro, tasmiṃ micchāpaṭipannā gihī bhikkhusaṅghaṃ akkositvā paribhāsitvā niray'ādīsu nibbattanti, tasmā so'pi purimanayen'eva anudahan'aṭṭhena dakkhiṇeyy'aggī'ti vutto.
Sanskrit ḍhaukana + agni
dakkhitāye

inf. (+acc) to see [√dis + a + itāye] ✓

Grammar inf of dakkhati, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning to see
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dakkha (irreg)
Construction dakkha + itāye
Commentary (SNa) dakkhitāye ... dassan'atthāya
Sanskrit driśaye
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

mahāsamayo pavanasmiṃ,
devakāyā samāgatā,
āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ,
dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghan'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ
dakkhiti

pr. (+acc) sees [√dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sees
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dakkhi (irreg)
Construction dakkhi + ti
Synonym dissati, passati
Sanskrit drakṣyati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhintī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
dakkhituṃ

inf. (+acc) to see [√dis] ✗
dakkhiya

ger. (+acc) seeing; beholding [√dis + a + iya] ✓

Grammar ger of dakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning seeing; beholding
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dakkha (irreg)
Construction dakkha + iya
Commentary (THIa) tava me nayanāni dakkhiyā'ti tava vuttaguṇavisesāni nayanāni disvā
Sanskrit dṛśya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

akkhīni ca turiyā'r'iva,
kinnariyā'r'iva pabbat'antare,
tava me nayanāni dakkhiya,
bhiyyo kāmaratī pavaḍḍhati.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
dakkhissati

fut. will see [√dis] ✗
dakkhī

masc. who sees or perceives [√dis] ✗
dakkhuṃ

imperf. (+acc) they saw [√dis + a + uṃ] ✓

Grammar imperf 3rd pl of dakkhi, trans (+acc)
Meaning they saw
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dakkha (irreg)
Construction dakkha + uṃ
Commentary (ANa) aniccato dakkhun'ti aniccabhāvena addasaṃsu.
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

tesaṃ sutvāna sappaññā,
sacittaṃ paccaladdhā te,
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ,
dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
dacchaṃ

fut. (+acc) I will see; I will know [√dis + a + ssa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar fut, reflx 1st sg of dakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning I will see; I will know
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a + ssa > daccha (fut, irreg)
Construction daccha + aṃ
Commentary (THa) paññāya dacchan'ti vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya dakkhissaṃ.
Sanskrit drakṣyati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
dajja

opt. 3rd. pers. sing. opt. of dadāti [√dā] ✗
dajjā

opt. (+acc) would give; should give [√dā + a + ā] ✓

Grammar opt of dadāti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning would give; should give
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)
Base √dā + dā + a > dadā > dajja (irreg)
Construction dajja + ā
Phonetic Change dā > dajja (Kacc 499, 507)
Sanskrit dadyāt
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyya,
dajjā appam'pi yācito,
etehi tīhi ṭhānehi,
gacche devāna santike.

DHP 224 kodhavaggo

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amussa āsīvisassa ghoravisassa hatthaṃ vā aṅguṭṭhaṃ vā dajjā yaṃ jaññā, imin'āhaṃ daṭṭho maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti?

acchādehī'ti dajjehi.

sace'pi me ayyaputtā vesāliṃ s'āhāraṃ dajjeyyātha n'eva dajjaṃ ahaṃ taṃ bhattan'ti

VIN 1.4.1.8 upakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit daṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √daṃś √daṅś 1 (bite)

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amussa āsīvisassa ghoravisassa hatthaṃ vā aṅguṭṭhaṃ vā dajjā yaṃ jaññā, imin'āhaṃ daṭṭho maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ aññataro bhikkhu ahinā daṭṭho kālaṅ'kato hoti.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ

Grammar abs of √dis, irreg, trans (+acc)

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ
daṭṭhu

abs. (+acc) having seen [√dis + a + tu] ✓

Grammar abs of √dis, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning having seen
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dassa (irreg)
Construction dassa + tu
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Synonym daṭṭhā, disvāna, passitvā
Commentary (SNPa) tattha daṭṭhū'ti disvā. (SPM) apica, nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato'ti ettha daṭṭhun'ti padassa disvā'ti atthadassanato yath'ārahaṃ tum'antāni tvāsadd'antapad'atthavasena'pi gahetabbāni
Sanskrit dṛṣṭvā, dṛśya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

iccheyyāsi no tvaṃ, mārisa moggallāna, vejayantassa pāsādassa rāmaṇeyyakaṃ daṭṭhun'ti? adhivāsesi kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno tuṇhībhāvena.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

Commentary (ANa) daṭṭheyyan'ti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
Sanskrit draṣṭavya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

yattha kho, āvuso, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, n'āhaṃ taṃ gamanena lokassa antaṃ ñāteyyaṃ daṭṭheyyaṃ patteyyan'ti vadāmī'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

yathā yathā vā pana taṃ ñāteyyaṃ vā daṭṭheyyaṃ vā sacchikareyyaṃ vā, tathā tathā ñassati vā dakkhati vā sacchikarissati vā'ti ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati.

tena kho pana samayena rañño utenassa uyyānagatassa antepuraṃ daḍḍhaṃ hoti, pañca ca itthisatāni kālaṅ'katāni honti sāmāvatīpamukhāni.

UD 70 utenasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi vā pana nandiya sukkhe tiṇadāye aggi mutto ḍahaññ'eva gacchati no daḍḍhaṃ paccudāvattati

daṇḍatajjita

adj. threatened with a stick; threatened with punishment; lit. frightened with a stick [daṇḍa + tajjita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning threatened with a stick; threatened with punishment; lit. frightened with a stick
Construction daṇḍa + tajjita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (daṇḍena + tajjita)
Commentary (ANa) vadhadaṇḍatajjitā'ti daṇḍakaṃ gahetvā vadhena tajjitā, ghātessāmi nan'ti vuttā.
Sanskrit daṇḍa + tarjita

ye'pi'ssa te honti dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, te'pi daṇḍatajjitā bhayatajjitā assumukhā rudamānā parikammāni karonti.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ

akkuddhasantā vadhadaṇḍatajjitā,
aduṭṭhacittā patino titikkhati,
akkodhanā bhattuvas'ānuvattinī,
yā evarūpā purisassa bhariyā,
dāsī ca bhariyā'ti ca sā pavuccati.

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
daṇḍaparāyaṇa

daṇḍaparāyana

adj. leaning on a staff; supported by a walking stick [daṇḍa + parāyana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leaning on a staff; supported by a walking stick
Construction daṇḍa + parāyana
Compound sattamī tappurisa (daṇḍamhi + parāyana)
Commentary (MNa) daṇḍaparāyaṇan'ti daṇḍapaṭisaraṇaṃ daṇḍadutiyaṃ.
Sanskrit daṇḍa + parāyaṇa

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
daṇḍaparissāvana

nt. kind of sieve or filter (made on a wooden framework) ✗
daṇḍapāṇisikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 58; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone with) a stick in hand [daṇḍapāṇī + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 58; lit. rule about (teaching the Dhamma to someone with) a stick in hand
Construction daṇḍapāṇī + sikkhāpada
daṇḍapāṇī 1

adj. with a stick in hand; carrying a staff [daṇḍa + pāṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a stick in hand; carrying a staff
Construction daṇḍa + pāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (daṇḍa + pāṇī)
Commentary (VINa) daṇḍapāṇissā'ti ettha daṇḍo nāma majjhimassa purisassa catuhatthappamāṇo daṇḍapāṇibhāvo pan'assa chattapāṇimhi vuttanayen'eva veditabbo.
Sanskrit daṇḍapāṇi

na daṇḍapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 58 daṇḍapāṇisikkhāpadaṃ

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a Sakyan layman; lit. with staff in hand
Construction daṇḍa + pāṇī

Commentary (MNa) daṇḍapāṇī'ti na jarādubbalatāya daṇḍahattho. ayañ'hi taruṇo paṭhamavaye ṭhito, daṇḍacittatāya pana suvaṇṇadaṇḍaṃ gahetvā vicarati, tasmā daṇḍapāṇī'ti vutto.
Sanskrit daṇḍapāṇi

daṇḍapāṇi'pi kho sakko jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena mahāvanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā khemako daṇḍam'olubbha yena therā bhikkhū ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā therehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ sammodi.

tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ pare aniṭṭhehi akantehi amanāpehi samudācaranti, pāṇisamphassena'pi leḍḍusamphassena'pi daṇḍasamphassena'pi satthasamphassena'pi.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā
dada

adj. giving; offering; bestowing [√dā + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from dadāti
Meaning giving; offering; bestowing
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)
Base √dā + dā + a > dadā
Construction dadā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit dada
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

so ca sabbadado hoti,
yo dadāti upassayaṃ,
amataṃ dado ca so hoti,
yo dhammam'anusāsatī'ti.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ

duddadaṃ dadamānānaṃ,
dukkaraṃ kamma kubbataṃ,
asanto n'ānukubbanti,
sataṃ dhammo duranvayo.

Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

maccheraṃ dadato malaṃ,
malā ve pāpakā dhammā,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

DHP 242 malavaggo

dhammaṃ care yo'pi samuñjakaṃ care,
dārañ'ca posaṃ dadam'appakasmiṃ,
sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

SPM 6 ākāranta pulliṅga nāmikapada mālā
daddu

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

te tattha sākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, sāmākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, nīvārabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, daddulabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, haṭabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, kaṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, ācāmabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, piññākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, tiṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, gomayabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, vanamūlaphal'āhārā yāpesuṃ pavattaphalabhojī.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
dadhi

nt. curd; sour milk [√dhe + √dhe + i] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning curd; sour milk
Root Family √dhe
Root √dhe×1 a (drink, suck)
Construction √dhe + √dhe > dadhe + i
Derivative kita (i)
Sanskrit dadhi
Sanskrit Root √dhe √dhā 1 (suck)

yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, sappi, navanītaṃ, telaṃ, madhu, phāṇitaṃ, maccho, maṃsaṃ, khīraṃ, dadhi. yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 39 paṇītabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggam'akkhāyati.

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
danta 1.2

masc. tusk ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tusk
Sanskrit danta

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato … dantehi'pi kammaṃ karoti, naṅguṭṭhena'pi kammaṃ karoti, rakkhat'eva soṇḍaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato rakkhati purimaṃ kāyaṃ, rakkhati pacchimaṃ kāyaṃ, rakkhati purime pāde, rakkhati pacchime pāde, rakkhati sīsaṃ, rakkhati kaṇṇe, rakkhati dante, rakkhati soṇḍaṃ, rakkhati vāladhiṃ, rakkhati hatth'āruhaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo rakkhitā hoti.

danta 2.1

Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym adanta
Commentary (SNa) danto'ti nibbisevano.
Sanskrit dānta
Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)

yatthakāmanipātino,
cittassa damatho sādhu,
cittaṃ dantaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.

DHP 35 cittavaggo

varam'assatarā dantā,
ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā,
attadanto tato varaṃ.

Meaning slow; sluggish

pāpā cittaṃ nivāraye,
dandhañ'hi karoto puññaṃ,
pāpasmiṃ ramatī mano.

DHP 116 pāpavaggo

rāgo kho, āvuso, appasāvajjo dandhavirāgī, doso mahāsāvajjo khippavirāgī, moho mahāsāvajjo dandhavirāgī'ti.

Sanskrit dhandha + virāgin

katamā ca, bhikkhave, dukkhassa vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ adhimattaṃ, atthi parittaṃ, atthi dandhavirāgi, atthi khippavirāgi. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhassa vemattatā.

Meaning kusa grass used for sacrificial purposes
Sanskrit darbha

tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihisatthāya

DN 5.10 kūṭadantasuttaṃ

ettakā ajā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā urabbhā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā assā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā rukkhā chijjantu yūp'atthāya, ettakā dabbhā lūyantu barihis'atthāyā'ti.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
dama

masc. taming; restraint; self-control [√dam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from dammati
Meaning taming; restraint; self-control
Root Family √dam
Root √dam･3 ya (be tame)
Construction √dam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (MNa) damenā'ti indriyadamena uposathakammena.
Sanskrit dama
Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)

uṭṭhānen'appamādena,
saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī,
yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.

DHP 25 appamādavaggo

it'āyaṃ kodharūpena,
maccupāso guhāsayo,
taṃ damena samucchinde,
paññāvīriyena diṭṭhiyā.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
damaka

masc. tamer; trainer [√dam + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, in comps, from dammati
Meaning tamer; trainer
Root Family √dam
Root √dam･3 ya (be tame)
Construction √dam + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit damaka
Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)

hatthidamakena, bhikkhave, hatthidammo sārito ekaṃ'y'eva disaṃ dhāvati, puratthimaṃ vā pacchimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā dakkhiṇaṃ vā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

assadamakena, bhikkhave, assadammo sārito ekaññ'eva disaṃ dhāvati, puratthimaṃ vā pacchimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā dakkhiṇaṃ vā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
damatha

masc. taming; control; mastery; self-control [√dam + a + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from dama
Meaning taming; control; mastery; self-control
Root Family √dam
Root √dam･3 ya (be tame)
Construction √dam + a + tha
dama + tha
Derivative taddhita (tha)
Sanskrit damatha
Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)

dunniggahassa lahuno,
yatthakāmanipātino,
cittassa damatho sādhu,
cittaṃ dantaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.

DHP 35 cittavaggo

buddho so bhagavā bodhāya dhammaṃ deseti, danto so bhagavā damathāya dhammaṃ deseti, santo so bhagavā samathāya dhammaṃ deseti, tiṇṇo so bhagavā taraṇāya dhammaṃ deseti, parinibbuto so bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammaṃ desetī'ti

MN 35 cūḷa saccakasuttaṃ
damappatta

adj. who has attained self-mastery; who is self-controlled; lit. reached taming [dama + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has attained self-mastery; who is self-controlled; lit. reached taming
Construction dama + patta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (damaṃ + patta)
Sanskrit dama + prāpta

upāyāsā ca te sabbe,
viddhastā vinaḷīkatā,
sītibhūto damappatto,
dhitimā saccanikkamo.

SNP 32 damaka 1
damayati

pr. (+acc) tames; masters; controls; lit. makes tame [√dam + *aya + ti] ✓

Root √dam･3 *aya (be tame)
Base √dam + aya > damaya (caus)
Construction damaya + ti
Sanskrit damayati
Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)

udakañ'hi nayanti nettikā,
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ,
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā,
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.

ek'āsanaṃ ekaseyyaṃ,
eko caram'atandito,
eko damayam'attānaṃ,
van'ante ramito siyā.

Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)
damasacca

yo vatthaṃ paridahissati,
apeto damasaccena,
na so kāsāvam'arahati.

yo ca vantakasāvassa,
sīlesu susamāhito,
upeto damasaccena,
sa ve kāsāvam'arahati.

khalu tāya vanaṃ gatā'ti.

THI 32 dantikātherīgāthā
damūpasama

Sanskrit dama + upaśama

sādhu sādhu, puṇṇa! sakkhissasi kho tvaṃ, puṇṇa, iminā dam'ūpasamena samannāgato sunāparantasmiṃ janapade vatthuṃ. yassa dāni tvaṃ, puṇṇa, kālaṃ maññasī'ti.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
dametar

masc. tamer, controller, trainer [√dam] ✗

yath'āññam'anusāsati,
sudanto vata dametha,
attā hi kira duddamo.

DHP 159 attavaggo

satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.

TH 206 vijitasenattheragāthā
dametuṃ

inf. to tame; to discipline [√dam] ✗
damenta

prp. taming, training, mastering, converting [√dam] ✗
damma 1.1

adj. able to be tamed; fit to be trained; tameable; trainable; lit. to be tamed [√dam + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of dameti
Meaning able to be tamed; fit to be trained; tameable; trainable; lit. to be tamed
Root Family √dam
Root √dam･3 ya (be tame)
Construction √dam + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change y > m
Sanskrit damya
Sanskrit Root √dam 4 (control)

assakhaḷuṅko hi, sandha, doṇiyā baddho, yavasaṃ yavasan'ti jhāyati. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi, sandha, assakhaḷuṅkassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṃ hoti, kiṃ nu kho maṃ ajja assadammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāressati, kim'ass'āhaṃ paṭikaromī'ti.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā'ti.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gadrabho gogaṇaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi dammo, aham'pi dammo'ti.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ
damma 2.1

pr. (+acc) we give [√dā + a + āma] ✓

Grammar pr 1st pl of dadāti, irreg form of dadāma, trans (+acc)

Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)
Base √dā + a > dā
Construction dā + āma > damma
Phonetic Change āma > mma (Kacc 482, 508)
Variant dāhāma
Sanskrit dā
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

atha v'aṅge vā magadhe,
mayaṃ bhoto dadāmase,
atha vā assak'āvantī,
sumanā damma te mayaṃ

JA 532 soṇanandajātakaṃ

dā'icc'etassa dhātussa antassa aṃ hoti mi ma'icc'etesu. dammi, damma.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 482
dammago

Meaning tameable cow; instructable cow

Compound kammadhāraya (damma + go)

Sanskrit damya + go

so paṭhamaṃ patāresi ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā. te tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamaṃsu. ath'āpare patāresi balavagāvo dammagāvo.

uragavaggo 4

et'āhaṃ bhante veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dammī'ti

VIN 4.1.1 bodhikathā
dayati

pr. goes [√ḍi] ✗
dayā

fem. (+loc) compassion (for); kindness (towards); mercy (for); pity (on) [√day + ā] ✓

Meaning compassion (for); kindness (towards); mercy (for); pity (on)

Root √day×1 a (be kind, have pity)
√ In Comps day or dday
Construction √day + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit dayā
Sanskrit Root √day 1 (share)

ekajaṃ vā dvijaṃ v'āpi,
yo'dha pāṇaṃ vihiṃsati,
yassa pāṇe dayā n'atthi,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

tatrāssu me idaṃ, sāriputta, jegucchismiṃ hoti, so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, sato'va abhikkamāmi, sato'va paṭikkamāmi, yāva udakabindumhi'pi me dayā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti, m'āhaṃ khuddake pāṇe visamagate saṅghātaṃ āpādesin'ti.

Sanskrit dayā + āpad

idha cunda ekacco pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī viharati

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato ahosiṃ nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī vihāsiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
dayita

pp. sympathised [√day] ✗
dayhati

pr. is burned; is scorched [√ḍah + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of dahati, intrans
Meaning is burned; is scorched
Root Family √ḍah
Root √ḍah･1 ya (burn)
Base √ḍah + ya > ḍayha > dayha (pass, irreg)
Construction dayha + ti
Phonetic Change ḍ > ḍ
hy > yh (metathesis)
Variant ḍayhati
Sanskrit dahyate
Sanskrit Root √dah 1, 2, 4 (burn)

tatra, bhikkhave, ko mantā ko saddhātā, ayañ'ca pathavī sineru ca pabbatarājā dayhissanti vinassissanti, na bhavissantī'ti aññatra diṭṭhapadehi?

AN 7.66 sattasūriyasuttaṃ
dayhamāna

prp. being burned; being scorched [√ḍah + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of dayhati, pass, intrans
Meaning being burned; being scorched

Root √ḍah･1 ya (burn)
Base √ḍah + ya > ḍayha > dayha (pass, irreg)
Construction dayha + māna

hy > yh (metathesis)

Commentary (THa) ḍayhamāne'ti agginā jhāyamāne.
Sanskrit dahyamāna
Sanskrit Root √dah 1, 2, 4 (burn)

imissā ca, bhikkhave, mahāpathaviyā sinerussa ca pabbatarājassa jhāyamānānaṃ dayhamānānaṃ acci vātena khittā yāva brahmalokā'pi gacchati.

sabbā āsattiyo chetvā,
vineyya hadaye daraṃ,
upasanto sukhaṃ seti,
santiṃ pappuyya cetaso'ti.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

yassa pāraṃ apāraṃ vā,
pār'āpāraṃ na vijjati,
vītaddaraṃ visaṃyuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

SN 4.17 chaphassāyatanasuttaṃ

yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

nagarassa samīpe pavattati kathā iti upanagaraṃ, darathānaṃ abhāvo niddarathaṃ, makasānaṃ abhāvo nimmakasaṃ, vuḍḍhānaṃ paṭipāṭi yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, ye ye vuḍḍhā vā yathāvuḍḍhaṃ

darī

fem. cleavage, cleft, cavern [√dar] ✗
dalidda

adj. poor; needy; impoverished ✓

Meaning poor; needy; impoverished

nirayaṃ tiracchānayoniṃ,
yamalokaṃ upapajjare,
sace enti manussattaṃ,
dalidde jāyare kule.

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco daliddo hoti appassako appabhogo. evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.

ārādhayitvā dhanikehi pīḷito,
tuṭṭho bhavissaṃ adhigamma sāsanaṃ,
mah'esino taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

Sanskrit daridra + viśikhā

atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo tāni pañcamattāni devatāsatāni paṭikkhipitvā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi, yena daliddavisikhā kapaṇavisikhā pesakāravisikhā.

UD6 mahākassapasuttaṃ
daliddasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 11.14 (SN11.14) ✗
daliddasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.46 (SN46.46) ✗
dava 1.1

masc. fun; joke; play; sport; pleasure [√dū + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fun; joke; play; sport; pleasure
Root Family √dū
Root √dū×1 a (go, run)
Construction √dū > dav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ū > av
Commentary (VINa) davo'ti parihāsavacanaṃ
Sanskrit drava
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma, paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma, n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

kathañ'hi nāma bhikkhu saṅghaṃ ārabbha davaṃ karissatī'ti

Meaning running; racing; sprinting

Notes see dava 3,4
Sanskrit drava
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

Phonetic Change ū > av

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
dasa 2.1

adj. seeing; understanding [√dis + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning seeing; understanding
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dasa (irreg)
Construction dasa + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (MNa) dassanavasena dassanavasena daso, sabbaṃ passatī'ti dīpeti.
Sanskrit darśa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

sammaddasā vedaguno,
samma'd'aññāya paṇḍitā,
abhibhuyya mārasaṃyogaṃ,
na gacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

pesuññaṃ nāma dvīh'ākārehi pesuññaṃ hoti, piyakamyassa vā bhed'ādhippāyassa vā. dasah'ākārehi pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati, jātito'pi, nāmato'pi, gottato'pi, kammato'pi, sippato'pi, ābādhato'pi, liṅgato'pi, kilesato'pi, āpattito'pi, akkosato'pi.

Meaning maximum of ten days; ten days at the most
Construction dasa + aha + paramatā
Compound kammadhāraya (dasāha + paramatā)
Commentary (VINa) ettha yā das'āhaparamatā das'āhaparamabhāvo, ayaṃ ettako kālo yāva n'ātikkamati tāva dhāretabban'ti.
Sanskrit daśāha + paramatā

das'āhaparaman'ti das'āhaparamatā dhāretabbaṃ.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
dasāhaparamaṃ

ind. for ten days at the most; for a maximum of ten days [dasa + aha + parama + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of dasāhaparama
Meaning for ten days at the most; for a maximum of ten days
Construction dasa + aha + parama + aṃ
dasāhaparama + aṃ
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.1) das'āhaparaman'ti das'āhaparamatā dhāretabbaṃ. (VINa) das'āhaparaman'ti dasa ahāni paramo paricchedo assā'ti das'āhaparamo
Sanskrit daśāha + paramam

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine das'āhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 1 kathinasikkhāpadaṃ

das'āhaparamaṃ atirekapatto dhāretabbo, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 21 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
dasāhātikkanta 1

adj. (kept) longer than ten days; lit. exceeding ten days [dasāha + atikkanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (kept) longer than ten days; lit. exceeding ten days
Construction dasāha + atikkanta
Commentary (VINa) das'āh'ātikkante atikkantasaññī'ti das'āhaṃ atikkante cīvare atikkantaṃ idan'ti evaṃsaññī, das'āhe vā atikkante atikkanto das'āho'ti evaṃsaññī.

nt. more than ten days; lit. ten days past [dasāha + atikkanta] ~

Meaning more than ten days; lit. ten days past

adj. for ten days coming up to; ten days before; lit. ten days not come [dasāha + anāgata] ✓

Construction dasāha + anāgata
Compound kammadhāraya (dasāha + anāgata)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.8) das'āh'ānāgatan'ti das'āh'ānāgatāya pavāraṇāya.
Sanskrit daśāha + anāgata

das'āh'ānāgataṃ kattikatemāsikapuṇṇamaṃ bhikkhuno pan'eva accekacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, accekaṃ maññamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ

VIN PAT NP 28 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ
dasāhuppanna

adj. which appeared on the tenth day; which becomes available on the nine day after; lit. ten days came up [dasāha + uppanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which appeared on the tenth day; which becomes available on the nine day after; lit. ten days came up
Construction dasāha + uppanna
dasika

nt. hem; fringe; border [dasā + ika] ✓

Grammar nt, from dasā
Meaning hem; fringe; border
Construction dasā + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit daśā +

nānappakārakaṃ nāma cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā, antamaso cuṇṇapiṇḍo'pi dantakaṭṭham'pi dasikasuttam'pi.

VIN 1.4.2.10 kayavikkayasikkhāpadaṃ

so satthārā dinnanaye ṭhatvā satthāraṃ vanditvā, ajja ādiṃ katvā mama santakaṃ dasikasuttamattam'pi maṃ abhibhavitvā anekasatā'pi rājāno vā corā vā gaṇhituṃ samatthā nāma mā hontu, agginā'pi mama santakaṃ mā ḍayhatu, udakena'pi mā vuyhatū'ti patthanaṃ akāsi.

DHPa 2.26.33 jaṭilatthera vatthu
dasikasutta

nt. tassel thread; fringe thread [dasika + sutta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning tassel thread; fringe thread
Construction dasika + sutta
Compound kammadhāraya (dasika + sutta)
Commentary (PYt) dasikasutt'ādin'ti ettha dasā'ti vatthass'āvayavo. so hi diyyati avakhaṇḍīyatī'ti dasā'ti vuccati, tassaṃ dasāyaṃ pavattaṃ dasikaṃ, tam'eva suttaṃ dasikasuttaṃ. ādisaddena vakkhamānaṃ dukkantitasutt'ādiṃ saṅgaṇhātī'ti.
Sanskrit daśā + sūtra

nānappakārakaṃ nāma cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārā, antamaso cuṇṇapiṇḍo'pi dantakaṭṭham'pi dasikasuttam'pi.

VIN 1.4.2.10 kayavikkayasikkhāpadaṃ

so satthārā dinnanaye ṭhatvā satthāraṃ vanditvā, ajja ādiṃ katvā mama santakaṃ dasikasuttamattam'pi maṃ abhibhavitvā anekasatā'pi rājāno vā corā vā gaṇhituṃ samatthā nāma mā hontu, agginā'pi mama santakaṃ mā ḍayhatu, udakena'pi mā vuyhatū'ti patthanaṃ akāsi.

DHPa 2.26.33 jaṭilatthera vatthu
dasuttara

adj. increasing (from one) up to ten; lit. ten higher [dasa + uttara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning increasing (from one) up to ten; lit. ten higher
Construction dasa + uttara
Compound kammadhāraya (dasa + uttara)
Commentary (DNa) das'uttaraṃ pavakkhāmī'tiādim'āha. tattha dasadhā mātikaṃ ṭhapetvā vibhatto'ti das'uttaro, ekakato paṭṭhāya yāva dasakā gato'ti'pi das'uttaro, ekekasmiṃ pabbe dasa dasa pañhā visesitā'ti'pi das'uttaro, taṃ das'uttaraṃ.
Sanskrit daśa + uttara

das'uttaraṃ pavakkhāmi,
dhammaṃ nibbānapattiyā,
dukkhass'antakiriyāya,
sabbaganthappamocanaṃ.

DN 34.1 dasuttarasuttaṃ
dasuttarasutta

nt. Dīgha Nikāya 34 (DN 34) ✗

Meaning ten brief statements
Construction dasa + uddesa

Sanskrit daśa + uddeśa

dasa pañhā das'uddesā dasa veyyākaraṇānī'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ?

AN 10.27 paṭhamamahāpañhāsuttaṃ
dassa

adj. seeing; looking at; viewing [√dis + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning seeing; looking at; viewing
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > disa > dassa (irreg)
Construction dassa + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit darśa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

rājāno nāma pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. ete rājāno nāma.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
dassaka

adj. who shows [√dis] ✗
dassati 1.1

fut. (+acc and +dat) will give (to) [√dā + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of dadāti, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning will give (to)
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)
Base √dā + a + ssa > dassa (fut, irreg)
Construction dassa + ti
Sanskrit dāsyáti
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

yattakaṃ tulitā esā,
tuyhaṃ dhītā anopamā,
tato aṭṭhaguṇaṃ dassaṃ,
hiraññaṃ ratanāni ca.

THI 54 anopamātherīgāthā

sace pana te, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā pāṇinā pahāraṃ dassanti, tatra pana te, puṇṇa, kinti bhavissatī'ti?

appiyehi kudācanaṃ,

appiyānañ'ca dassanaṃ.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti

Sanskrit darśana + mūlaka

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning excellent sight; best vision
Construction dassana + vara

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of vision
Construction dassana + samāpatti
Commentary (DNa) ayaṃ paṭhamā dassanasamāpattī'ti ayaṃ dvattiṃ sākāraṃ paṭikūlato manasikatvā paṭikūladassanavasena uppāditā paṭhamajjhānasamāpatti paṭhamā dassanasamāpatti nāma, sace pana taṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā sot'āpanno hoti, ayaṃ nippariyāyen'eva paṭhamā dassanasamāpatti.

dassanasampadā

fem. attainment of vision; success in seeing [dassana + sampadā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of vision; success in seeing
Construction dassana + sampadā
Compound catutthī tappurisa (dassanassa + sampadā)
Commentary (KPa) dassanasampadāyā'ti sotāpattimaggasampattiyā. sot'āpattimaggo hi nibbānaṃ disvā kattabbakiccasampadāya sabbapaṭhamaṃ nibbānadassanato dassanan'ti vuccati, tassa attani pātubhāvo dassanasampadā, tāya dassanasampadāya saha eva.
Sanskrit darśana + sampradā

sahā'v'assa dassanasampadāya ,
tayassu dhammā jahitā bhavan'ti,
sakkāyadiṭṭhī vicikicchitañ'ca,
sīlabbataṃ v'āpi yadatthi kiñci.

Sanskrit darśana + sampanna

ete parābhave loke,
paṇḍito samavekkhiya,
ariyo dassanasampanno,
sa lokaṃ bhajate sivan'ti.

dassana + ā

Notes see SCPN §6
Sanskrit darśanena
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā saṃvarā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā.

Sanskrit darśana + anuttarya

evaṃ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu tīhi anuttariyehi samannāgato hoti, dassan'ānuttariyena, paṭipad'ānuttariyena, vimutt'ānuttariyena.

yo pana bhikkhu uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gaccheyya aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning beautiful to behold; lovely to look at; handsome; lit. to be seen

Commentary (ANa) dassanīyā'ti dassanayuttā.
Sanskrit darśanīya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

apissu taṃ jano disvā evam'āha, abhirūpo vata, bho, rañño nāgo, dassanīyo vata, bho, rañño nāgo, pāsādiko vata, bho, rañño nāgo, kāy'upapanno vata, bho, rañño nāgo'ti!

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ

ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacco mātugāmo abhirūpā ca hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgatā, daliddā ca hoti appassakā appabhogā appesakkhā ca?

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
dassanīyatara

adj. more beautiful [√dis] ✗
dassanuppāda

masc. arising of insight; epithet of stream entry; lit. coming up of vision [dassana + uppāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of insight; epithet of stream entry; lit. coming up of vision
Construction dassana + uppāda
dassanūpacāra

masc. field of vision; range of sight; lit. neighbourhood of seeing [dassana + upacāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning field of vision; range of sight; lit. neighbourhood of seeing
Construction dassana + upacāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dassanassa + upacāra)
Commentary (VINa) dassan'ūpacāraṃ vā savan'ūpacāraṃ vā vijahantassā'ti ettha yadi ṭhito vā nisinno vā uyyojeti. yo uyyojito, so vijahati, tassa ca āpatti nāma n'atthi.
Sanskrit darśana + upacāra

uyyojeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dassan'ūpacāraṃ vā savan'ūpacāraṃ vā vijahantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa. vijahite, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.5.2 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ

yattha ṭhito passati, āpatti pācittiyassa. dassan'ūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.5.8 uyyuttasenāsikkhāpadaṃ
dassayati

pr. (+acc) shows; exhibits; displays; lit. causes to see [√dis + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of passati, trans (+acc)
Meaning shows; exhibits; displays; lit. causes to see
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *aya (see)
Base √dis + aya > dassaya (caus)
Construction dassaya + ti
Sanskrit darśayati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti,
na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena,
na ucc'āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

DHP 83 paṇḍitavaggo

patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno,
bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ,
sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ,
yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.

aṭṭhakavaggo 6

muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃ'va dassayaṃ,
ummattaken'eva mayā palobhasi,
kiñ'c'āpi te citta virādhitaṃ mayā.

evaṃ abhikkantadassāviṃ,

kathaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passati.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3

sutavā ca kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto, sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto, rūpaṃ n'etaṃ mama

DHPa 1.6.4 mahākappinatthera vatthu

atha kho jīvako komārabhacco seṭṭhiṃ gahapatiṃ mañcake nipātetvā sambandhitvā sīsacchaviṃ uppāṭetvā sibbiniṃ vināmetvā dve pāṇake nīharitvā mahājanassa dassesi.

VIN 4.8.205 rājagahaseṭṭhi vatthu
daha 1

masc. like ✗
daha 2

masc. lake ✗

Construction daha + ti
Variant dahāti
Sanskrit dadhati
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,
n'ev'attato no parato dahetha,
phusanti phassā upadhiṃ paṭicca,
nirūpadhiṃ kena phuseyyu phassā'ti.

UD 14 sakkārasuttaṃ

te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.

Variant ḍahati

Sanskrit Root √dah 1, 2, 4 (burn)

so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, tejo sucim'pi dahati, asucim'pi dahati, gūthagatam'pi dahati, muttagatam'pi dahati, kheḷagatam'pi dahati, pubbagatam'pi dahati, lohitagatam'pi dahati, na ca tena tejo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
dahara 1

adj. young; youthful; junior ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning young; youthful; junior
Commentary (MNa) kumāro'ti na mahallako.
Sanskrit dahara

yo have daharo bhikkhu,
yuñjati buddhasāsane,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā muttova candimā.

DHP 382 bhikkhuvaggo

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu daharo hoti yuvā susu kāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo samayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
dahara 2

adj. small; short ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning small; short
Sanskrit dahara

evam'eva manussesu,
daharo ce'pi paññavā,
so hi tattha mahā hoti,
n'eva bālo sarīravā'ti.

SN 21.6 lakuṇḍakabhaddiyasuttaṃ
dahara 3

masc. young boy; young man; youth ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning young boy; young man; youth
Antonym daharī
Commentary (MNa) daharo'va samāno'ti taruṇo'va samāno.
Sanskrit dahara

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, aparena samayena daharo'va samāno, susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā, akāmakānaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ assumukhānaṃ rudantānaṃ, kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajiṃ.

tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa paribbājakassa daharamāṇavikā pajāpati hoti gabbhinī upavijaññā. atha kho sā paribbājikā taṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavoca, gaccha tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, telaṃ āhara, yaṃ me vijātāya bhavissatī'ti.

UD16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
daharasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 3.1 (SN3.1) ✗

VIN 1.2.3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ
dahāti

pr. (+acc) considers as; takes as; regards as; lit. puts [√dhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning considers as; takes as; regards as; lit. puts
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Base √dhā + a > dhā > daha (irreg)
Construction daha + ti
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ā
Variant dahati
Sanskrit dadhati
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno,
samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā,
ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ,
tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

yen'eva bālo'ti paraṃ dahāti,
ten'ātumānaṃ kusalo'ti c'āha,
sayam'attanā so kusalo vadāno,
aññaṃ vimāneti tadeva pāva.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
dahāpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to burn; makes scorches [√ḍah + *āpe + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of dahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to burn; makes scorches
Root Family √ḍah
Root √ḍah･1 *āpe (burn)
Base √ḍah + āpe > ḍahāpe > dahāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction dahāpe + ti
Phonetic Change ḍ > d
Commentary (VINa) dahati vā dahāpeti vā'ti antamaso pattam'pi pacanto sayaṃ vā dahati, aññena vā dahāpeti. yattakesu ṭhānesu aggiṃ deti vā dāpeti vā tattakāni pācittiyāni.
Sanskrit dahayati
Sanskrit Root √dah 1, 2, 4 (burn)
dahi 1.1

aor. accepted [√dhā] ✗
dahi 2.1

aor. burnt [√ḍah] ✗
dahitvā

abs. (+acc) having burned; having set fire (to) [√ḍah + a + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of dahati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having burned; having set fire (to)
Root Family √ḍah
Root √ḍah･1 a (burn)
Base √ḍah + a > ḍaha > daha (irreg)
Construction daha + itvā
Phonetic Change ḍ > d
Synonym ḍahitvā, ḍahetvā
Sanskrit dagdhvā
Sanskrit Root √dah 1, 2, 4 (burn)

sā tattha aggim'pi janeyya, dhūmam'pi janeyya, aggim'pi janetvā dhūmam'pi janetvā tam'eva mahantaṃ tiṇapuñjaṃ vā kaṭṭhapuñjaṃ vā pariyādiyitvā gaccham'pi daheyya, dāyam'pi daheyya, gacchampi dahitvā dāyam'pi dahitvā haritantaṃ vā pathantaṃ vā sel'antaṃ vā udak'antaṃ vā ramaṇīyaṃ vā bhūmibhāgaṃ āgamma anāhārā nibbāyeyya.

AN 7.55 purisagatisuttaṃ
daḷidda

adj. poor, needy, poor person [dalidda] ✗
daḷha 1

adj. strong; firm; steady [√dah + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, pp of √dah
Meaning strong; firm; steady
Root Family √dah
Root √dah×1 a (be strong)
Construction √dah + ta > daḍha > daḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Variant gāḷha
Commentary (MNa) daḷhā'ti thirā.
Sanskrit dṛḷha, dṛḍha
Sanskrit Root √dṛh 1, 4 (make firm)

na taṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā,
yadāyasaṃ dārujapabbajañ'ca,
sārattarattā maṇikuṇḍalesu,
puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā.

DHP 345 taṇhāvaggo

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

Root √dah×1 a (be strong)

Commentary (SNa) yāyaṃ paṭipadā daḷhā'ti ayaṃ dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipadā daḷhā thirā. (SNt) paṭipakkhavidhamane asithilatāya daḷhā.
Sanskrit dṛḷha, dṛḍha
Sanskrit Root √dṛh 1, 4 (make firm)

na y'idaṃ bhāsitamattena,
ek'antasavanena vā,
anukkamitave sakkā,
yāyaṃ paṭipadā daḷhā,
yāya dhīrā pamuccanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

Commentary (SNa) daḷhadhammo'ti daḷhadhanu, uttamappamāṇena dhanunā samannāgato. (ANa) daḷhadhammo'ti daḷhadhanuṃ gahetvā ṭhito.
Sanskrit dṛḍha + dhanvan

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cattāro daḷhadhammā dhanuggahā susikkhitā katahatthā kat'ūpāsanā catuddisā ṭhitā assu.

DHP 23 appamādavaggo

āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
daḷhapākāratoraṇa

adj. with strong encircling wall and gateway [daḷha + pākāra + toraṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with strong encircling wall and gateway
Construction daḷha + pākāra + toraṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (daḷha + pākāratoraṇa)
Commentary (SNa) daḷhapākāratoraṇan'ti thirapākārañ'c'eva thiratoraṇañ'ca. toraṇāni nāma hi puris'ubbedhāni nagarassa alaṅkār'atthaṃ karīyanti, coranivāraṇatthāni'pi honti'y'eva. atha vā toraṇan'ti piṭṭhasaṅghāṭass'etaṃ nāmaṃ, thirapiṭṭhasaṅghāṭan'ti'pi attho.
Sanskrit dṛḍha + prākāra + toraṇa

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhu, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ daḷh'uddhāpaṃ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṃ chadvāraṃ. tatr'assa dovāriko paṇḍito byatto medhāvī, aññātānaṃ nivāretā, ñātānaṃ pavesetā.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

kayirā ce, kayirāth'enaṃ,
daḷham'enaṃ parakkame,
sithilo hi paribbājo,
bhiyyo ākirate rajaṃ.

cūḷavaggo 10

sak'āyane tattha daḷhaṃ vadānā.

ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca, api nu te, gahapati, kule dānaṃ dīyatī'ti? dīyati me, bhante, kule dānaṃ. tañ'ca kho lūkhaṃ kaṇājakaṃ biḷaṅgadutiyan'ti.

Construction dāna + pati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dānassa + pati)
Commentary (SNa) dānapatī'ti yaṃ dānaṃ demi, tassa pati hutvā demi, na dāso na sahāyo.
Sanskrit dānapati

puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati, yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ, visārado'va upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.

AN 5.35 dānānisaṃsasuttaṃ

bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhante, sirī nāma rājā ahosiṃ dāyako dānapati dānassa vaṇṇavādī.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ
dānapatha

Meaning source of charity; stream of generosity; lit. giving path
Construction dāna + patha
Commentary (VINa) dānapathānī'ti dānāni'y'eva vuccanti. atha vā dānapathānī'ti dānanibaddhāni dānavattānī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, cāgadhanaṃ

Meaning now this

sandhi. right now I [dāni + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning right now I
Construction dāni + ahaṃ
Variant dānihaṃ, idānihaṃ
Sanskrit idānīm + aham

dhammikā kho devā, adhammikā asurā, idh'eva dān'āhaṃ devapuraṃ gacchāmī'ti, atha kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi muttaṃ attānaṃ samanupassati, dibbehi ca pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

sve dān'āhaṃ sake nivesane bhagavato vādaṃ āropessāmī'ti bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya attacatuttho bhattan'ti.

Meaning now; immediately
Construction ima + dāni

Sanskrit idānīm

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.

DN 16.36 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

pariccattaṃ kho rañño nāgassa jīvitaṃ. n'atthi dāni kiñci rañño nāgassa akaraṇīyan'ti.

Meaning now you are
Construction dāni + asi
Sanskrit idānīm + asi

yamapurisā'pi ca te upaṭṭhitā,
uyyogamukhe ca tiṭṭhasi,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

DHP 235 malavaggo

upanītavayo ca dāni'si,
sampayāto'si yamassa santike,
vāso te n'atthi antarā,
pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

dāpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to give; makes give [√dā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Root √dā･1 *āpe (give)

Construction dāpe + ti
Sanskrit dāpayati
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, dassāmī'ti vā dāpessāmī'ti vā oloketi, na ujjhānasaññissa, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

dāpetvā

Root √dā･1 *āpe (give)
Base √dā + āpe > dāpe (caus)
Construction dāpe + tvā
Antonym adāpetvā
Commentary (VIN 2.5.5.2) tassa dāpetvā'ti yāguṃ vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dāpetvā
Sanskrit dāttvā
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ, eh'āvuso, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā'ti tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti

Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit dāru

udakañ'hi nayanti nettikā,
usukārā namayanti tejanaṃ,
dāruṃ namayanti tacchakā,
attānaṃ damayanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 80 paṇḍitavaggo

api c'āhaṃ, gāmaṇi, evaṃ vadāmi, tiṇaṃ tiṇ'atthikena pariyesitabbaṃ, dāru dāru'tthikena pariyesitabbaṃ, sakaṭaṃ sakaṭ'atthikena pariyesitabbaṃ, puriso puris'atthikena pariyesitabbo'ti

diṭṭhā hi mayā sucittitā,
sombhā dārukapillakāni vā,
tantīhi ca khīlakehi ca,
vinibaddhā vividhaṃ panaccakā.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

Construction dāruka + pillaka
Compound kammadhāraya (dāruka + pillaka)
Commentary (THIa) dārukapillakāni vā'ti dārudaṇḍ'ādīhi uparacitarūpakāni.
Sanskrit dāruka + ??

diṭṭhā hi mayā sucittitā,
sombhā dārukapillakāni vā,
tantīhi ca khīlakehi ca,
vinibaddhā vividhaṃ panaccakā.

Commentary (ANa) dārukammiko'ti dāruvikkayena pavattit'ājīvo eko upāsako.

dārucīra + iya

Sanskrit dāru + cīra

tena kho pana samayena bāhiyo dārucīriyo suppārake paṭivasati samuddatīre sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito lābhī cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānapaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.

puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā.

DHP24 taṇhāvaggo
dāruṇa

adj. brutal; savage; vicious; cruel [√dar + *uṇa] ✓

Meaning brutal; savage; vicious; cruel

Root √dar･1 a (break, split apart)
Construction √dar > dār + *uṇa

Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) dāruṇo'ti sāhasiko.
Sanskrit dāruṇa
Sanskrit Root √dṝ √dṛ 2, 9 (pierce, split)

rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.

DHP 139 daṇḍavaggo

dāruṇo, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasiloko kaṭuko pharuso antarāyiko anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

dibbā dijā pakkhi visuddhacakkhū,
vehāsayā te vanamajjhapattā,
citrā supaṇṇā iti tesa nāmaṃ.

pp. seen; found; visible [√dis + ta] ✓

Meaning seen; found; visible

gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,

gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā.

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym adiṭṭha
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

yato kho te bāhiya diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
diṭṭha 1.3

nt. sight; seeing; vision; lit. seen [√dis + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of √dis
Meaning sight; seeing; vision; lit. seen
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

alaṃ, vakkali, kiṃ te iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati so maṃ passati, yo maṃ passati so dhammaṃ passati

SN 22.87 vakkalisuttaṃ

passāmi suddhaṃ paramaṃ arogaṃ,
diṭṭhena saṃsuddhi narassa hoti,
ev'ābhijānaṃ paraman'ti ñatvā,
suddh'ānupassī'ti pacceti ñāṇaṃ.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
diṭṭha 2.1

masc. foe; enemy; adversary [√dis] ✗
diṭṭhadhamma 1

masc. this life; this world; the here and now; lit. seen things [diṭṭha + dhamma] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, comp
Meaning this life; this world; the here and now; lit. seen things
Construction diṭṭha + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭha + dhamma)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma

imesañ'ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī bhavissasi akicchalābhī akasiralābhī

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa t'ādisaṃ'y'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, n'ānu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahu'd'eva.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhamma 2

adj. who has seen the Dhamma; who has perceived reality [diṭṭha + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has seen the Dhamma; who has perceived reality
Construction diṭṭha + dhamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭha + dhammaṃ)
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭho ariyasaccadhammo etenā'ti diṭṭhadhammo.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṃkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhammanibbāna

nt. nibbāna in this life ✗
diṭṭhadhammanibbānappatta

adj. attained Nibbāna in this very life; whose fire has gone out here and now [diṭṭha + dhamma + nibbāna + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attained Nibbāna in this very life; whose fire has gone out here and now
Construction diṭṭha + dhamma + nibbāna + patta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ + patta)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma + nirvāna + prāpta

jarāmaraṇassa ce, āvuso, bhikkhu nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti, diṭṭhadhammanibbānappatto bhikkhū'ti alaṃ vacanāya.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ

avijjāya ce, āvuso, bhikkhu nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto hoti, diṭṭhadhammanibbānappatto bhikkhū'ti alaṃ vacanāyā'ti. sattamaṃ.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhammanibbānavāda 1

masc. (proponent of the) doctrine of total emancipation in this life itself ✗
diṭṭhadhammanibbānavāda 2

adj. holding the doctrine of total emancipation in this life itself ✗
diṭṭhadhammanibbānasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.51 (AN9.51) ✗
diṭṭhadhammavedanīya

adj. to be felt in this life; to be experienced here and now [diṭṭha + dhamma + vedanīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning to be felt in this life; to be experienced here and now
Construction diṭṭha + dhamma + vedanīya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhadhamme + vedanīya)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma + vedanīya

evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa t'ādisaṃ'y'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, n'āṇu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahu'd'eva.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhammasukha

nt. happiness in this life ✗
diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāra

masc. comfortable existence in this very life; pleasant way to pass the time here and now [diṭṭha + dhamma + sukha + vihāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning comfortable existence in this very life; pleasant way to pass the time here and now
Construction diṭṭha + dhamma + sukha + vihāra
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhadhamme + sukhavihāra)
Commentary (ANa) diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāyā'ti imasmiṃ'y'eva paccakkhe attabhāve sukhavihār'atthāya.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma + sukha + vihāra

taṃ t'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ vadāmi, iṅgha tvaṃ, mārisa, app'ossukko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāram'anuyutto viharassu, anakkhātaṃ kusalañ'hi, mārisa, mā paraṃ ovadāhī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu … catunnañ'ca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāramanuyutta

adj. enjoying a comfortable existence here and now; pursuing a pleasant life in this very world [diṭṭha + dhamma + sukha + vihāraṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying a comfortable existence here and now; pursuing a pleasant life in this very world
Construction diṭṭha + dhamma + sukha + vihāraṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma + sukha + vihāra + anuyukta

taṃ t'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ vadāmi, iṅgha tvaṃ, mārisa, app'ossukko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāram'anuyutto viharassu, anakkhātaṃ kusalañ'hi, mārisa, mā paraṃ ovadāhī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhammahita

nt. benefit in this life; welfare here and now [diṭṭhadhamma + hita] ✓

Meaning benefit in this life; welfare here and now
Construction diṭṭhadhamma + hita
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhadhamme + hita)

cattāro'me, byagghapajja, dhammā kulaputtassa diṭṭhadhammahitāya saṃvattanti diṭṭhadhammasukhāya. katame cattāro?

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ

diṭṭhadhammahitatthāya

Antonym samparāyasukhāya
Sanskrit dṛṣṭadharma + hita + artha

diṭṭhadhammahit'atthāya,
samparāyasukhāya ca,
kat'āvakāsā pucchāma,
yaṃ kiñci abhipatthitan'ti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippatta

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attained perfection and mastery of direct knowledge in this very life
Construction diṭṭhadhamma + abhiññāvosānapāramippatta
diṭṭhadhammābhinibbuta

adj. completely calmed in this life, perfectly extinguished here and now ✗
diṭṭhadhammika

adj. concerning this life; regarding this world; relevant to here and now [diṭṭha + dhammika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning concerning this life; regarding this world; relevant to here and now
Construction diṭṭha + dhammika
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭha + dhammika)
Commentary (ITIa) diṭṭhadhammikā'ti imasmiṃ attabhāve bhavā vattamānā.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + dharmya

duve imā cakkhumatā pakāsitā,
nibbānadhātū anissitena tādinā,
ekā hi dhātu idha diṭṭhadhammikā,
saupādisesā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
anupādisesā pana samparāyikā,
yamhi nirujjhanti bhavāni sabbaso.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

atha kho brahmāyussa brāhmaṇassa etadahosi, kat'āvakāso kho'mhi samaṇena gotamena. kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ puccheyyaṃ, diṭṭhadhammikaṃ vā atthaṃ samparāyikaṃ vā'ti.

Meaning due to striving in the present
Construction diṭṭhadhamma + upakkama + hetu
diṭṭhapada

adj. who has seen the way; who has seen the state (of Nibbāna) [diṭṭha + pada] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has seen the way; who has seen the state (of Nibbāna)
Construction diṭṭha + pada
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭha + padaṃ)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + pada

kiñ'c'āpi so kamma karoti pāpakaṃ,
kāyena vācā uda cetasā vā,
abhabba so tassa paṭicchadāya,
abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
diṭṭhapubba

adj. seen before [diṭṭha + pubba] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seen before

Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + pūrva

diṭṭhapubbo pana te, bhikkhu, so bhagavā, disvā ca pana jāneyyāsī'ti? na kho me, āvuso, diṭṭhapubbo so bhagavā, disvā c'āhaṃ na jāneyyan'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
