Meaning who has attained vision (of Nibbāna); epithet of a stream enterer
Construction diṭṭha + patta
Commentary (ADHa) diṭṭhaṃ viditaṃ sacchikataṃ passitaṃ paññāyā'ti diṭṭhappatto. ayam'pi kāyasakkhī viya chabbidho'va hoti.
diṭṭhamatta

adj. merely the seen; only what is seen; as much as is seen; lit. seen amount [diṭṭha + matta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning merely the seen; only what is seen; as much as is seen; lit. seen amount
Construction diṭṭha + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭha + matta)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭamātra

ettha ca te, māluṅkyaputta, diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha te, bāhiya, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
diṭṭhavāditar

masc. (+loc) who speaks about the seen (as); who states what one has seen (as) [diṭṭha + vāditar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp (+loc)
Meaning who speaks about the seen (as); who states what one has seen (as)
Construction diṭṭha + vāditar
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhaṃ + vāditar)
Antonym adiṭṭhavāditar
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā'tiādīsu yāya cetanāya diṭṭhe diṭṭhaṃ me'ti vadati, sā diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā nāma. (DNa) diṭṭhavāditā'ti diṭṭhaṃ mayā'ti evaṃ vāditā.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + vaditṛ

diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā, sute sutavāditā, mute mutavāditā, viññāte viññātavāditā, ime kho, āvuso, cattāro vohārā tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena samma'd'akkhātā.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, ariyavohārā. katame aṭṭha? adiṭṭhe adiṭṭhavāditā, asute asutavāditā, amute amutavāditā, aviññāte aviññātavāditā, diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā, sute sutavāditā, mute mutavāditā, viññāte viññātavāditā.

AN 8.68 ariyavohārasuttaṃ
diṭṭhavādī

adj. (+loc) who speaks about the seen (as); who states what one has seen (as) [diṭṭha + vādī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning who speaks about the seen (as); who states what one has seen (as)
Construction diṭṭha + vādī
Antonym adiṭṭhavādī
diṭṭhasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as seen; thinking one has seen (something) [diṭṭha + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as seen; thinking one has seen (something)
Construction diṭṭha + saññī
Commentary (VINa) tattha adiṭṭhe diṭṭhasaññino'ti arahatte ñāṇacakkhunā adiṭṭhey'eva, diṭṭhaṃ amhehi arahattan'ti diṭṭhasaññino hutvā. esa nayo appatt'ādīsu.
diṭṭhasuta

nt. what is seen and heard [diṭṭha + suta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning what is seen and heard
Construction diṭṭha + suta
Compound dvanda (diṭṭha ca suta ca)
Variant diṭṭhassuta
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + śruta

udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni n'opalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
diṭṭhasutamutaviññāta

adj. visible audible feelable and knowable; seen, heard, felt and known ✗
diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabba

adj. visible, audible, sensible and knowable; which can be seen, heard, sensed and known; lit. to be seen heard sensed and known [diṭṭha + suta + muta + viññātabba] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp, comp
Meaning visible, audible, sensible and knowable; which can be seen, heard, sensed and known; lit. to be seen heard sensed and known
Construction diṭṭha + suta + muta + viññātabba
Compound dvanda (diṭṭha ca suta ca muta ca viññātabba ca)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + śruta + mata + vijñātavya

ettha ca te, māluṅkyaputta, diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

idha diṭṭhasutamutaviññātesu,
piyarūpesu hemaka,
chandarāgavinodanaṃ,
nibbānapadam'accutaṃ.

SNP 63 hemaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 8
diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbasaṅkhāramatta

masc. mere visible, audible, sensible and knowable conditions; just fabrications which can be seen, heard, sensed and known [diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabba + saṅkhāra + matta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mere visible, audible, sensible and knowable conditions; just fabrications which can be seen, heard, sensed and known
Construction diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabba + saṅkhāra + matta
diṭṭhassuta

nt. what is seen and heard [diṭṭha + suta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning what is seen and heard
Construction diṭṭha + suta
Compound dvanda (diṭṭha ca suta ca)
Variant diṭṭhasuta
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + śruta

ye kec'ime samaṇabrāhmaṇāse,
diṭṭhassuten'āpi vadanti suddhiṃ,
sīlabbatenāpi vadanti suddhiṃ,
anekarūpena vadanti suddhiṃ,
kacci'ssu te bhagavā tattha yatā carantā,
atāru jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7

ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ,
phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
diṭṭhā

ind. thank heavens! what luck! ✗
diṭṭhānugati

fem. (+gen) imitation; following the example (of); lit. imitation of seen [diṭṭha + anugati] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+gen)
Meaning imitation; following the example (of); lit. imitation of seen
Construction diṭṭha + anugati
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhaṃ + anugati)
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjatī'ti dassan'ānugatiṃ paṭipajjati, yan'diṭṭhiko bhavaṃ gotamo yaṃkhantiko yaṃruciko, te'pi tan'diṭṭhikā honti taṃkhantikā taṃrucikā'ti attho.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + anugati

kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

ye'me, bho gotama, kulaputtā bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā, bhavaṃ tesaṃ gotamo pubbaṅ'gamo, bhavaṃ tesaṃ gotamo bahukāro, bhavaṃ tesaṃ gotamo samādapetā, bhoto ca pana gotamassa sā janatā diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjatī'ti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
diṭṭhānusaya

masc. underlying tendency towards views; inherent inclination towards opinions; underlying conceptual beliefs; lit. views sleeping alongside [diṭṭhi + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency towards views; inherent inclination towards opinions; underlying conceptual beliefs; lit. views sleeping alongside
Construction diṭṭhi + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + anusaya)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + anuśaya

es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto paṭigh'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto diṭṭh'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto vicikicch'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto mān'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto bhavarāg'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto avijj'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto daṇḍ'ādāna-satth'ādāna-kalaha-viggaha-vivāda-tuvaṃtuvaṃ-pesuñña-musāvādānaṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

kāmarāg'ānusayassa ... paṭigh'ānusayassa ... diṭṭh'ānusayassa ... vicikicch'ānusayassa ... mān'ānusayassa ... bhavarāg'ānusayassa ... avijj'ānusayassa pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.

AN 7.12 dutiānusayassayānusayasuttaṃ
diṭṭhāvikamma

nt. openly expressing one’s opinion; voicing one’s dissent [diṭṭhī + āvi + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning openly expressing one’s opinion; voicing one’s dissent
Construction diṭṭhī + āvi + kamma
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhiṃ + āvikamma)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭin + āvis + karman

evañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, te bhikkhū tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitā honti, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, ṭhapetvā diṭṭh'āvikammaṃ, ṭhapetvā ye na tattha hontī'ti.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
diṭṭhi 1

fem. view; belief; opinion; concept; theory; attitude [√dis + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr
Meaning view; belief; opinion; concept; theory; attitude
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym adiṭṭhi
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena,
mun'īdha nanda kusalā vadanti,
visenikatvā anīghā nirāsā,
caranti ye te munayoti brūmi.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7

visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
diṭṭhi 2

fem. wrong view; incorrect belief [√dis + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr
Meaning wrong view; incorrect belief
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Synonym micchādiṭṭhi
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhiyo'ti micchādiṭṭhiyo.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

yā imā, bhante, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, attavādapaṭisaṃyuttā vā lokavādapaṭisaṃyuttā vā, ādim'eva nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno manasikaroto evam'etāsaṃ diṭṭhīnaṃ pahānaṃ hoti, evam'etāsaṃ diṭṭhīnaṃ paṭinissaggo hotī'ti?

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
diṭṭhiajjhosāna

nt. clinging to views; attachment to beliefs [diṭṭhi + ajjhosāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning clinging to views; attachment to beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + ajjhosāna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + ajjhosāna)
Variant diṭṭhijjhosāna
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + adhyavasāya

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhiajjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhiadhiṭṭhāna

nt. stuck in a view; being entrenched in a belief [diṭṭhi + adhiṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning stuck in a view; being entrenched in a belief
Construction diṭṭhi + adhiṭṭhāna
Compound catutthī tappurisa (diṭṭhīnaṃ + adhiṭṭhāna)
Commentary (ANa) diṭṭh'ādhiṭṭhānan'ti diṭṭhīnaṃ adhiṭṭhānaṃ, adhiṭhatvā adhibhavitvā pavattāya diṭṭhiyā etaṃ nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + adhiṣṭhāna

yāvatā, āvuso, diṭṭhi yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhiadhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamugghāto, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi tam'ahaṃ passāmi.

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
diṭṭhikantāra

masc. wasteland of views; desert of belief [diṭṭhi + kantāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wasteland of views; desert of belief
Construction diṭṭhi + kantāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhīnaṃ + kantāra)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + kāntāra

idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
diṭṭhigata

nt. (wrong or false) belief; misconception; theory; dogma; doctrine; lit. gone into views [diṭṭhi + gata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (wrong or false) belief; misconception; theory; dogma; doctrine; lit. gone into views
Construction diṭṭhi + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhiṃ + gata)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭigata (theory)

idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ,
na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
diṭṭhigatasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 49 (ITI 49) ✗
diṭṭhigatikādhiṭṭhānavaṭṭakathā

fem. discussion about views as the basis for the cycle of existence ✗
diṭṭhigahana

nt. jungle of views; impenetrable thicket of views; thick covering of views [diṭṭhi + gahana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning jungle of views; impenetrable thicket of views; thick covering of views
Construction diṭṭhi + gahana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhīnaṃ + gahana)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + gahana

idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
diṭṭhijāla

nt. net of views ✗
diṭṭhijjhosāna

nt. clinging to views; attachment to beliefs [diṭṭhi + ajjhosāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning clinging to views; attachment to beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + ajjhosāna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + ajjhosāna)
Variant diṭṭhiajjhosāna
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + adhyavasāya

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhiṭṭhāna

nt. basis for opinion; grounds for view; standpoint for views [diṭṭhi + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning basis for opinion; grounds for view; standpoint for views
Construction diṭṭhi + ṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭhi + ṭhāna)
Commentary (ANa) yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānan'ti khandhā'pi diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, avijjā'pi, phasso'pi, saññā'pi, vitakko'pi ayonisomanasikāro'pi, pāpamitto'pi, paratoghoso'pi diṭṭhiṭṭhānan'ti evaṃ yattakaṃ aṭṭhavidham'pi diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhikāraṇaṃ nāma atthi.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + sthāna

attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

so suṇāti tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā sabbesaṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhāna-adhiṭṭhāna-pariyuṭṭhāna-abhinivesa-anusayānaṃ samugghātāya sabbasaṅkhārasamathāya sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammaṃ desentassa.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
diṭṭhiṭṭhānappahāyī

adj. who has abandoned the basis for opinions; who has given up grounds for view [diṭṭhiṭṭhāna + pahāyī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has abandoned the basis for opinions; who has given up grounds for view
Construction diṭṭhiṭṭhāna + pahāyī
Commentary (ANa) diṭṭhiṭṭhānappahāyinan'ti dvāsaṭṭhi-diṭṭhigatappahāyinaṃ.
diṭṭhiṭṭhānādhiṭṭhānapariyuṭṭhānābhinivesānusaya

masc. grounds for views, standpoints for views, obsession with views, adherences and underlying tendencies; basis for views, fixation with views, being possessed by views, dogmatic opinions and dormant dispositions [diṭṭhi + ṭhāna + adhiṭṭhāna + pariyuṭṭhāna + abhinivesa + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning grounds for views, standpoints for views, obsession with views, adherences and underlying tendencies; basis for views, fixation with views, being possessed by views, dogmatic opinions and dormant dispositions
Construction diṭṭhi + ṭhāna + adhiṭṭhāna + pariyuṭṭhāna + abhinivesa + anusaya
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhiṭṭhān'ādhiṭṭhāna-pariyuṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayānan'ti diṭṭhīnañ'ca diṭṭhiṭṭhānānañ'ca diṭṭh'ādhiṭṭhānānañ'ca diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānānañ'ca abhinives'ānusayānañ'ca
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + sthāna + adhiṣṭhāna + paryavasthāna + abhiniveśa + anuśaya

so suṇāti tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā sabbesaṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhān'ādhiṭṭhāna-pariyuṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayānaṃ samugghātāya sabbasaṅkhārasamathāya sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammaṃ desentassa.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
diṭṭhitaṇhā

fem. craving for views; attachment to beliefs [diṭṭhi + taṇhā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning craving for views; attachment to beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + taṇhā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + taṇhā)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + tṛṣṇā

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhinandī

fem. delight in views; happiness with beliefs [diṭṭhi + nandī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning delight in views; happiness with beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + nandī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + nandī)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + nandī

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhinijjhānakkhanti

fem. acceptance of a view after consideration; approving a view after understanding it; lit. view understanding acceptance [diṭṭhi + nijjhāna + khanti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning acceptance of a view after consideration; approving a view after understanding it; lit. view understanding acceptance
Construction diṭṭhi + nijjhāna + khanti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + nijjhānakkhanti)
Commentary (ANa) mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā'ti amhākaṃ nijjhāyitvā khamitvā gahitadiṭṭhiyā saddhiṃ sametī'ti'pi mā gaṇhittha.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + nidhyāna + kṣānti

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
diṭṭhinirodha

masc. end of views; cessation of beliefs; termination of theories [diṭṭhi + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning end of views; cessation of beliefs; termination of theories
Construction diṭṭhi + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhīnaṃ + nirodha)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + nirodha

sutavā ca kho, bhikkhu, ariyasāvako diṭṭhiṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhisamudayaṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhaṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti. tassa sā diṭṭhi nirujjhati, so parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, parimuccati dukkhasmā'ti vadāmi.

AN 7.54 abyākatasuttaṃ
diṭṭhinirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the end of views; going to the cessation of beliefs [diṭṭhinirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the end of views; going to the cessation of beliefs
Construction diṭṭhinirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhinirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + nirodha + gāmin

sutavā ca kho, bhikkhu, ariyasāvako diṭṭhiṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhisamudayaṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhaṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti. tassa sā diṭṭhi nirujjhati, so parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, parimuccati dukkhasmā'ti vadāmi.

AN 7.54 abyākatasuttaṃ
diṭṭhinissaya

masc. support for views; foundation for opinions; basis for views [diṭṭhi + nissaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning support for views; foundation for opinions; basis for views
Construction diṭṭhi + nissaya
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭhi + nissaya)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + niśraya

passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, taṃ diṭṭhinissayaṃ yaṃsa diṭṭhinissayaṃ nissayato na uppajjeyyuṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
diṭṭhipaṭilābha

masc. way of acquiring a view; acquisition of belief [diṭṭhi + paṭilābha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning way of acquiring a view; acquisition of belief
Construction diṭṭhi + paṭilābha
diṭṭhipaṭivedha

masc. breakthrough of vision; penetration of view [diṭṭhi + paṭivedha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning breakthrough of vision; penetration of view
Construction diṭṭhi + paṭivedha
diṭṭhiparibbasāna

adj. stuck in views; settled in theories; entrenched in opinions; with rigid dogma; lit. abiding in views [diṭṭha + paribbasāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning stuck in views; settled in theories; entrenched in opinions; with rigid dogma; lit. abiding in views
Construction diṭṭha + paribbasāna
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhesu + paribbasāna)
Commentary (SNPa) diṭṭhīnivesā'ti idaṃsacc'ābhinivesasaṅkhātāni diṭṭhinivesanāni.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + parivas

ye kec'ime diṭṭhiparibbasānā,
idam'eva saccan'ti vivādayanti,
sabb'eva te nindam'anvānayanti,
atho pasaṃsam'pi labhanti tattha.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhiparibbasānā,
viggayha nānā kusalā vadanti,
yo evaṃ jānāti sa vedi dhammaṃ,
idaṃ paṭikkosamakevalī so.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhāna

nt. obsessing with views [diṭṭhi + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning obsessing with views
Construction diṭṭhi + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhīhi + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Commentary (ANa) diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānan'ti katamāni aṭṭhārasa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānāni? yā diṭṭhi diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ diṭṭhisallaṃ diṭṭhisambādho diṭṭhipalibodho diṭṭhibandhanaṃ diṭṭhipapāto diṭṭh'ānusayo diṭṭhisantāpo diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhigantho diṭṭh'upādānaṃ diṭṭh'ābhiniveso diṭṭhiparāmāso. imāni aṭṭhārasa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānānī'ti evaṃ vuttaṃ diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṃ.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + paryavasthāna

yāvatā, āvuso, diṭṭhi yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhiadhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamugghāto, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi tam'ahaṃ passāmi.

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
diṭṭhipariḷāha

masc. fever for views; burning passion for beliefs [diṭṭhi + pariḷāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fever for views; burning passion for beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + pariḷāha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + pariḷāha)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + paridāha

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhipalāsa

masc. contention among views; enmity about beliefs [diṭṭhi + palāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning contention among views; enmity about beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + palāsa
Variant diṭṭhipaḷāsa
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhipaḷāso'ti'ādīhi cittassa anārādhaniyabhāvo kathito.
diṭṭhipaḷāsa

masc. contention among views; enmity about beliefs [diṭṭhi + paḷāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning contention among views; enmity about beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + paḷāsa
Variant diṭṭhipalāsa
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhipaḷāso'ti'ādīhi cittassa anārādhaniyabhāvo kathito. (ANa) diṭṭhipaḷāso'ti diṭṭhiṃ nissāya uppajjanako yugaggāhalakkhaṇo paḷāso diṭṭhipaḷāso nāma.
diṭṭhipārisuddhi

fem. purification of view; purity of opinion [diṭṭhi + pārisuddhi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning purification of view; purity of opinion
Construction diṭṭhi + pārisuddhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + pārisuddhi)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + pariśuddhi

iti evarūpiṃ diṭṭhipārisuddhiṃ aparipūraṃ vā paripūressāmi paripūraṃ vā tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmī'ti, yo tattha chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca, idaṃ vuccati, byagghapajjā, diṭṭhipārisuddhipadhāniy'aṅgaṃ.

AN 4.194 sāmugiyasuttaṃ
diṭṭhipārisuddhipadhāniyaṅga

nt. factor related to striving for the purification of view [diṭṭhi + pārisuddhi + padhāniya + aṅga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning factor related to striving for the purification of view
Construction diṭṭhi + pārisuddhi + padhāniya + aṅga
Compound catutthī tappurisa (diṭṭhipārisuddhiyā + padhāniyaṅga)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + pariśuddhi + prahāṇika (bsk) + aṅga

iti evarūpiṃ diṭṭhipārisuddhiṃ aparipūraṃ vā paripūressāmi paripūraṃ vā tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmī'ti, yo tattha chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca, idaṃ vuccati, byagghapajjā, diṭṭhipārisuddhipadhāniy'aṅgaṃ.

AN 4.194 sāmugiyasuttaṃ
diṭṭhipipāsā

fem. thirst for views; craving for beliefs [diṭṭhi + pipāsā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning thirst for views; craving for beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + pipāsā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + pipāsā)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + pipāsā

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhippatta

adj. one attained to the noble path by predominance in right view ✗
diṭṭhibyasana

nt. belief system disaster; loss of view [diṭṭhi + byasana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning belief system disaster; loss of view
Construction diṭṭhi + byasana
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭhi + byasana)
Commentary (DNa) sammādiṭṭhiṃ vināsayamānā uppannā diṭṭhi eva byasanaṃ diṭṭhibyasanaṃ.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + vyasana
diṭṭhibyasanahetu

ind. because of loss of view; due to loss of belief [diṭṭhibyasana + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of loss of view; due to loss of belief
Construction diṭṭhibyasana + hetu
diṭṭhimānānusaya

masc. underlying tendency towards thinking I am; underlying tendency towards self-comparison; lit. views and comparing sleeping alongside [diṭṭhi + māna + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency towards thinking I am; underlying tendency towards self-comparison; lit. views and comparing sleeping alongside
Construction diṭṭhi + māna + anusaya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhimānaṃ + anusaya)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + māna + anuśaya

so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
diṭṭhimucchā

fem. infatuation with views; fixation on beliefs [diṭṭhi + mucchā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning infatuation with views; fixation on beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + mucchā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + mucchā)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + mūrchā

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhiya

adj. following views ✗
diṭṭhiyoga

masc. bond of beliefs; bondage of views [diṭṭhi + yoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bond of beliefs; bondage of views
Construction diṭṭhi + yoga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + yoga)
Commentary (ANa) sassatadiṭṭhisahagato ca rāgo dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyo ca diṭṭhiyogo ... diṭṭhīsu yojetī'ti diṭṭhiyogo.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + yoga

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, yogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogo, bhavayogo, diṭṭhiyogo, avijjāyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhiyogavisaññoga

masc. detachment from the bond of beliefs [diṭṭhiyoga + visaññoga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detachment from the bond of beliefs
Construction diṭṭhiyoga + visaññoga
diṭṭhiyogavisaṃyoga

masc. detachment from the bond to views; disconnection from bondage to beliefs [diṭṭhiyoga + visaṃyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detachment from the bond to views; disconnection from bondage to beliefs
Construction diṭṭhiyoga + visaṃyoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyogamhā + visaṃyoga)
Commentary (ANa) kāmayogavisaṃyogo'ti kāmayogato visaṃyojanakāraṇaṃ. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + visaṃyoga

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, visaṃyogā. katame cattāro? kāmayogavisaṃyogo, bhavayogavisaṃyogo, diṭṭhiyogavisaṃyogo, avijjāyogavisaṃyogo.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhirāga

masc. passion for views; love of beliefs [diṭṭhi + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion for views; love of beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + rāga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + rāga)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + rāga

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhirāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosāna

nt. attachment to passion for views, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; adherence to love of beliefs, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it [diṭṭhirāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning attachment to passion for views, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; adherence to love of beliefs, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it
Construction diṭṭhirāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna
diṭṭhirāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānahetu

ind. due to attachment to passion for views, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; because of adherence to love of beliefs, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it [diṭṭhirāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to attachment to passion for views, bondage to it, greed for it, obsession with it and fixation with it; because of adherence to love of beliefs, being tied to it, craving for it, being consumed by it and addiction to it
Construction diṭṭhirāga + abhinivesa + vinibandha + paligedha + pariyuṭṭhāna + ajjhosāna + hetu
Commentary (ANa) kāmarāgābhinivesa-vinibandha-paligedha-pariyuṭṭhān'ajjhosānahetū'ti kāmarāg'ābhinivesahetu, kāmarāgavinibandhahetu, kāmarāgapaligedhahetu, kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhānahetu, kāmarāgaajjhosānahetū'ti attho. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, yv'āyaṃ pañca kāmaguṇe nissāya uppajjati kāmarāgo, tass'ābhinives'ādihetu. kāmarāgena abhiniviṭṭhattā vinibaddhattā tasmiṃ'y'eva ca kāmarāge mahāpaṅke viya paligedhattā anupaviṭṭhattā ten'eva ca kāmarāgena pariyuṭṭhitattā gahitattā kāmarāgene'va ca ajjhositattā gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā gahitattā'ti. diṭṭhirāg'ādipadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
diṭṭhivagga

masc. Chapter 15 of the Khandasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
diṭṭhivipatti

fem. failure in view; wrong view [diṭṭhi + vipatti] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning failure in view; wrong view
Construction diṭṭhi + vipatti
Commentary (ANa) diṭṭhivipattī'ti micchādiṭṭhi. (VSa) tattha garukānaṃ dvinnaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ vasena sīlavipatticodanā veditabbā, avasesānaṃ vasena ācāravipatticodanā, micchādiṭṭhi-antaggāhikadiṭṭhivasena diṭṭhivipatticodanā, ājīvahetu paññattānaṃ channaṃ sikkhāpadānaṃ vasena ājīvavipatticodanā veditabbā.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + vipatti
diṭṭhivipattihetu

ind. due to failure of view [diṭṭhivipatti + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to failure of view
Construction diṭṭhivipatti + hetu
diṭṭhivipallāsa

masc. deluded view; distorted opinion; inversion of view [diṭṭhi + vipallāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning deluded view; distorted opinion; inversion of view
Construction diṭṭhi + vipallāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭhi + vipallāsa)
Antonym nadiṭṭhivipallāsa
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + viparyāsa

anicce, bhikkhave, niccan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso. dukkhe, bhikkhave, sukhan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
diṭṭhivipassaka

adj. having (right) view and insight [diṭṭhi + vipassaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having (right) view and insight
Construction diṭṭhi + vipassaka
Commentary (SNa) sukhumaṃdiṭṭhivipassakan'ti arahattamaggadiṭṭhiyā sukhumadiṭṭhiphalasamāpattiatthāya vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā āgatattā vipassakaṃ.
diṭṭhivipphandita

masc. writhing of views; contortion of views [diṭṭhi + vipphandita] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning writhing of views; contortion of views
Construction diṭṭhi + vipphandita
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭhi + vipphandita)
Commentary (NIDD1a) kadāci sassatassa, kadāci ucchedassa gahaṇato diṭṭhiyā virūpaṃ phanditan'ti diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + vispandita

idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
diṭṭhivisuddhattha

masc. for the sake of purity of view; for the purpose of purification of belief [diṭṭhi + visuddhi + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning for the sake of purity of view; for the purpose of purification of belief
Construction diṭṭhi + visuddhi + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhivisuddhiyā + attha)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + viśuddhi + arhta

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, diṭṭhivisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, āvuso, sīlavisuddhi yāva'd'eva cittavisuddh'atthā, cittavisuddhi yāva'd'eva diṭṭhivisuddh'atthā, diṭṭhivisuddhi yāva'd'eva kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddh'atthā

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
diṭṭhivisuddhi

fem. purity of view; purification of belief [diṭṭhi + visuddhi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning purity of view; purification of belief
Construction diṭṭhi + visuddhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + visuddhi)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + viśuddhi

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, diṭṭhivisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, diṭṭhivisuddhi anupādāparinibbānan'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

diṭṭhisamugghāta

masc. eradication of views [diṭṭhi + samugghāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning eradication of views
Construction diṭṭhi + samugghāta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhīnaṃ + samugghāta)
Commentary (ANa) sot'āpattimaggo pana diṭṭhisamugghāto nāma sabbadiṭṭhīnaṃ samugghātakattā.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + samudghāta

yāvatā, āvuso, diṭṭhi yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhiadhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamugghāto, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi tam'ahaṃ passāmi.

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
diṭṭhisamuṭṭhāna

nt. arising of views [diṭṭhi + samuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning arising of views
Construction diṭṭhi + samuṭṭhāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhīnaṃ + samuṭṭhāna)
Commentary (ANa) samuṭṭhānan'ti diṭṭhiṭṭhānass'eva vevacanaṃ. vuttañ'h'etaṃ. khandhā paccayo diṭṭhīnaṃ upādāya samuṭṭhān'aṭṭhenā'ti sabbaṃ vitthāretabbaṃ.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + samutthāna

yāvatā, āvuso, diṭṭhi yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhiadhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamugghāto, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi tam'ahaṃ passāmi.

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
diṭṭhisamudaya

masc. origin of view ✗

diṭṭhisampanna

adj. having right view; with correct outlook; with correct belief [diṭṭhi + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having right view; with correct outlook; with correct belief
Construction diṭṭhi + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + sampanna)
Synonym sammādiṭṭhi
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhisampanno'ti maggadiṭṭhiyā sampanno sot'āpanno ariyasāvako.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + sampanna

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, yathārūpāya dhammatāya diṭṭhisampanno puggalo samannāgato, aham'pi tathārūpāya dhammatāya samannāgato'ti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
diṭṭhisaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24 (SN24) ✗
diṭṭhisaṃyojana

nt. bond of belief; fetter of views [diṭṭhi + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bond of belief; fetter of views
Construction diṭṭhi + saṃyojana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + saṃyojana)
Variant diṭṭhisaññojana
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + saṃyojana

diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutto, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, na parimuccati dukkhasmā'ti vadāmi

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutta

adj. attached to the chain of views; fettered with the bond of views [diṭṭhi + saṃyojana + saṃyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attached to the chain of views; fettered with the bond of views
Construction diṭṭhi + saṃyojana + saṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhisaṃyojanena + saṃyutta)
Commentary (MNa) idāni'ssa tam'eva bandhanatthaṃ dassento diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutto'tiādim'āha. tass'āyaṃ saṅkhep'attho. iminā diṭṭhisaṃyojanena saṃyutto puthujjano etehi jātiādīhi na parimuccatī'ti.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + saṃyojana + saṃyukta

diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutto, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, na parimuccati dukkhasmā'ti vadāmi

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
diṭṭhisāmaññagata

adj. (+instr) with views in common (with); with beliefs in harmony (with) [diṭṭhi + sāmaññagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+instr)
Meaning with views in common (with); with beliefs in harmony (with)
Construction diṭṭhi + sāmaññagata
Compound kammadhāraya (diṭṭhi + sāmaññagata)
Commentary (MNa) diṭṭhisāmaññagato'ti samānadiṭṭhibhāvaṃ upagato hutvā viharati.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + sāmānya + gata

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu y'āyaṃ diṭṭhi ariyā niyyānikā niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāya tathārūpāya diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhisāmaññagato viharati sabrahmacārīhi āvi c'eva raho ca.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
diṭṭhisutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.212 (AN4.212) ✗
diṭṭhisutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.222 (AN4.222) ✗
diṭṭhisneha

masc. affection for views; love for beliefs [diṭṭhi + sneha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning affection for views; love for beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + sneha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (diṭṭhīsu + sneha)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + sneha

tassa diṭṭhīnaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ appajānato yo diṭṭhīsu diṭṭhirāgo diṭṭhinandī diṭṭhisneho diṭṭhimucchā diṭṭhipipāsā diṭṭhipariḷāho diṭṭhi'jjhosānaṃ diṭṭhitaṇhā sānuseti.

AN 4.10 yogasuttaṃ
diṭṭhī 1

adj. having a view; having the opinion; holding the belief [√dis + ti + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from diṭṭhi
Meaning having a view; having the opinion; holding the belief
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + ti + ī
diṭṭhi + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit dṛṣṭin
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
diṭṭhī 2

masc. who has a view; who has the opinion [√dis + ti + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from diṭṭhi
Meaning who has a view; who has the opinion
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + ti + ī
diṭṭhi + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Sanskrit dṛṣṭin
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

diṭṭhena ce suddhi narassa hoti,
ñāṇena vā so pajahāti dukkhaṃ,
aññena so sujjhati sopadhīko,
diṭṭhī hi naṃ pāva tathā vadānaṃ.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
diṭṭhīnivesa

masc. fixed view; rigid idea; dogmatic opinion; attachment to view [diṭṭhi + nivesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fixed view; rigid idea; dogmatic opinion; attachment to view
Construction diṭṭhi + nivesa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhiṃ + nivesa)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭin + niveśa

diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
diṭṭhupādāna

nt. grasping views; clinging to beliefs [diṭṭhi + upādāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning grasping views; clinging to beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + upādāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (diṭṭhiṃ + upādāna)
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + upādāna

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, upādānaṃ? cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, upādānāni, kām'upādānaṃ, diṭṭh'upādānaṃ, sīlabbat'upādānaṃ, attavād'upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, upādānaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

te na sammā sabb'upādānapariññaṃ paññapenti, kām'upādānassa pariññaṃ paññapenti, na diṭṭh'upādānassa pariññaṃ paññapenti, na sīlabbat'upādānassa pariññaṃ paññapenti, na attavād'upādānassa pariññaṃ paññapenti.

MN 11 cūḷasīhanādasuttaṃ
diṭṭheyya

ptp. (+instr) could be seen (by); visible (by); lit. to be seen [√dis + eyya] ✓

Grammar ptp of √dis (+instr)
Meaning could be seen (by); visible (by); lit. to be seen
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + [t] + eyya
Derivative kicca (eyya)
Phonetic Change +t
st > ṭṭh
Synonym passeyya
Variant daṭṭheyya
Commentary (ANa) daṭṭheyyan'ti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
Sanskrit draṣṭavya
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

yattha kho, āvuso, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, n'āhaṃ taṃ gamanena lokassa antaṃ ñāteyyaṃ diṭṭheyyaṃ patteyyan'ti vadāmī'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ
diṭṭhevadhamme

sandhi. in this life; right here right now; in the present; lit. even in seen things [diṭṭhe + eva + dhamme] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + ind + masc
Meaning in this life; right here right now; in the present; lit. even in seen things
Construction diṭṭhe + eva + dhamme
Commentary (ANa) diṭṭh'eva dhamme'ti imasmiṃ'y'eva attabhāve
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + eva + dharme

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'evadhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan'ti

MN 6 ākaṅkheyyasuttaṃ

so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya, paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā, asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā, avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā, diṭṭh'evadhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
diṭṭhogha

masc. flood of views; torrent of beliefs [diṭṭhi + ogha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning flood of views; torrent of beliefs
Construction diṭṭhi + ogha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (diṭṭhiyā + ogha)
Commentary (SNa) diṭṭh'ogho'ti dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyo.
Notes cattāro oghā 1. kāmogha, 2. bhavogha, 3. diṭṭhogha, 4. avijjogha.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭi + ogha

mahā udakaṇṇavo'ti kho, bhikkhave, catunn'etaṃ oghānaṃ adhivacanaṃ, kām'oghassa, bhav'oghassa, diṭṭh'oghassa, avijj'oghassa.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ
diṭṭhosi

sandhi. you are seen; you've been discovered [diṭṭho + asi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + pr
Meaning you are seen; you've been discovered
Construction diṭṭho + asi
Commentary (DHPa) diṭṭho'sī'ti sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ paṭivijjhantena mayā idāni diṭṭho'si.
Sanskrit dṛṣṭa + asi

gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,
puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā,
gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.

DHP 154 jarāvaggo
ditta

pp. blazed, shone [√dīp] ✗
diddha

pp. smeared (with poison) [√dih + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of √dih
Meaning smeared (with poison)
Root Family √dih
Root √dih×1 a (accumulate, smear)
Construction √dih + ta > diddha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ht > ddha
Sanskrit digdha
Sanskrit Root √dih 2 (smear)

sevamāno sevamānaṃ,
samphuṭṭho samphusaṃ paraṃ,
saro diddho kalāpaṃ'va,
alittam'upalimpati.
upalepabhayā dhīro,
n'eva pāpasakhā siyā.

diddhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 17.7 (SN17.7) ✗
dinna 1

pp. (+dat or +loc) given (to); offered (to) [√dā + na] ✓

Grammar pp of dadāti (+dat or +loc)
Meaning given (to); offered (to)
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 a (give)
Construction √dā > dī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
īn > inn
Antonym adinna
Synonym datta, yiṭṭha
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.10) dinnaṃ nāma kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā dente hatthapāse ṭhito kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhāti, etaṃ dinnaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit datta
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

appasm'eke pavecchanti,
bahun'eke na dicchare,
appasmā dakkhiṇā dinnā,
sahassena samaṃ mitā'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ

kāle dadanti sappaññā,
vadaññū vītamaccharā,
kālena dinnaṃ ariyesu,
ujubhūtesu t'ādisu,
vippasannamanā tassa,
vipulā hoti dakkhiṇā.

AN 5.36 kāladānasuttaṃ
dinna 2

Root √dā･1 a (give)
Construction √dā > dī + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
īn > inn
Antonym adinna
Sanskrit datta
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

tiṇadosāni khettāni,
rāgadosā ayaṃ pajā,
tasmā hi vītarāgesu,
dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ.

DHP 356 taṇhāvaggo

ye puggalā aṭṭha sataṃ pasatthā,
cattāri etāni yugāni honti,
te dakkhiṇeyyā sugatassa sāvakā,
etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

tassa yapaccayassa cavagga yakāra vakārattaṃ hoti dhātūnaṃ antena saha yathāsambhavaṃ. vuccate, vuccante, uccate, uccante, paccate, paccante. majjate, majjante, yujjate, yujjante. bujjhate, bujjhante, kujjhate, kujjhante, ujjhate, ujjhante. haññate, haññante. kayyate, kayyante. dibbate, dibbante.

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.

ind. during the day; lit. day part [divasa + bhāga + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of divasabhāga
Meaning during the day; lit. day part
Construction divasa + bhāga + aṃ
divasabhāga + aṃ
Antonym rattibhāgaṃ
Commentary (MNa) rattibhāgaṃ vā divasabhāgaṃ vā'ti rattikoṭṭhāse vā divasakoṭṭhāse vā ... divasabhāge ñatvā divā'va pakkamitabbaṃ, divā paribandhe sati sūriy'atthaṅgamanaṃ āgametabbaṃ.
Sanskrit divasa + bhāgam

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā rattibhāgaṃ vā divasabhāgaṃ vā tamhā vanapatthā pakkamitabbaṃ, na vatthabbaṃ.

MN 17 vanapatthasuttaṃ
divasasantatta

Construction divasa + santatta

Root Family √div

Construction √div + asa + aṃ
divasa + aṃ

Sanskrit Root √div 4 (play)

divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasaṃ santatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati. evam'eva so pāyaso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.

uragavaggo 4

seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasasantatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati. evam'eva so pāyaso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
divaṃ

Meaning on the day

Root √div･3 ya (shine)
Construction √div + a + aṃ
diva + aṃ
English Cognate divine, divinity, divination, diviner
Sanskrit diva
Sanskrit Root √div 4 (play)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vadhukā yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā ānītā hoti, tāva'd'ev'assā tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sassuyā'pi sasure'pi sāmike'pi antamaso dāsakammakaraporisesu.

AN 4.73 sappurisasuttaṃ
divā

ind. by day; during the day [√div + a + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of diva
Meaning by day; during the day
Root Family √div
Root √div･3 ya (shine)
Construction √div + a + ā
diva + ā
Synonym divassa
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit divā
Sanskrit Root √div 4 (play)

yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukh'āvaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ,
tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati.

Construction √div + a + ā + tara + aṃ
divātara + aṃ
Commentary (MNa) divātaraṃ uṭṭhāsī'ti punadivase ussūrataraṃ uṭṭhāsi.
Sanskrit divātara
Sanskrit Root √div 4 (play)

atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷī dāsī divātaraṃ'y'eva uṭṭhāsi. atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷiṃ dāsiṃ etadavoca, he je, kāḷī'ti. kiṃ, ayye'ti? kiṃ, je, divātaraṃ uṭṭhāsī'ti? na khv'ayye, kiñcī'ti.

gijjhakūṭamhi pabbate,
nāgaṃ ogāhamuttiṇṇaṃ,
nadītīramhi addasaṃ.

MN 95 caṅkīsuttaṃ
divi

adj. divine; celestial; heavenly [√div] ✗
diviya

adj. divine; celestial; heavenly [√div] ✗
disa 1.1

masc. enemy; foe; opponent; rival [√dis + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from dessati
Meaning enemy; foe; opponent; rival
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･3 ya (dislike, hate)
Construction √dis + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym verī
Sanskrit dviṣa
Sanskrit Root √dviṣ 2, 6 (hate)

diso disaṃ yaṃ taṃ kayirā,
verī vā pana verinaṃ,
micchāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
pāpiyo naṃ tato kare.

DHP 42 cittavaggo

yassa accantadussīlyaṃ,
māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ,
yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

mah'esino pabbajito'mhi sāsane,
na mādisā honti vināsadhārino.

disodisaṃ

disvā

Root √dis･1 a (see)
Construction √dis + tvā
Antonym adisvā
Sanskrit dṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, saṃvaro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
disvāna

Construction √dis + tvāna

Sanskrit dṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

disvāna rūpesu vihaññamāne,
ruppanti rūpesu janā pamattā,
tasmā tuvaṃ piṅgiya appamatto,
jahassu rūpaṃ apunabbhavāya.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16

addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna soṇḍipañcamāni aṅgāni sake kapāle samodahitvā app'ossukko tuṇhībhūto saṅkasāyati.

pr. is seen; is observed; is manifest [√dis + ya + ti] ✓

Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 ya (see)
Base √dis + ya > dissa (pass)
Construction dissa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit dṛśyate
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

mahantasmiṃ kho pana lokasannivāse santi samaṇabrāhmaṇā iddhimanto dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduno. te dūrato'pi passanti, āsannā'pi na dissanti, cetasā'pi cittaṃ pajānanti.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

dissati, bhikkhave, imassa cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa ācayo'pi apacayo'pi ādānam'pi nikkhepanam'pi

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ
dissati 2

pr. seems; lit. is seen [√dis + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of √dis, intrans
Meaning seems; lit. is seen
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 ya (see)
Base √dis + ya > dissa (pass)
Construction dissa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit dṛśyate
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

mohasambandhano loko,
bhabbarūpo'va dissati,
upadhibandhano bālo,
tamasā parivārito,
sassato'riva khāyati,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

UD 70 utenasuttaṃ

sadevakassa lokassa,
yathā dissati cakkhumā,
sabbaṃ tamaṃ vinodetvā,
eko'va ratim'ajjhagā.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
dissati 3

pr. (+loc) appears; lit. is seen [√dis + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of √dis, intrans (+loc)
Meaning appears; lit. is seen
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 ya (see)
Base √dis + ya > dissa (pass)
Construction dissa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit dṛśyate
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, palagaṇḍassa vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsissa vā vāsijaṭe dissant'eva aṅgulipadāni dissati aṅguṭṭhapadaṃ.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ
dissati 4

pr. (+acc) sees [√dis + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning sees
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 a (see)
Base √dis + a > dissa
Construction dissa + ti
Synonym dakkhiti, passati
Notes Kaccāyana considers as active not passive
Sanskrit paśyati
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

disa'icc'etassa dhātussa passa dissa dakkha'icc'ete ādesā honti vā. passati, dissati, dakkhati, adakkha. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? addasa.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 471
dissanta

prp. seeming, appearing [√dis] ✗
dissamāna

prp. seeming, appearing, visible [√dis] ✗
dī

abbrev. abbreviation of Dīgha (Nikāya) ✓

Grammar abbrev
Meaning abbreviation of Dīgha (Nikāya)
Sanskrit dīgha

tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṃ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṃ {sugato kapp'āvasesaṃ (pī. ka.) dī. ni. 2.167} bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan'ti yathā taṃ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto.

SN 51.10 cetiyasuttaṃ
dīgha 1

adj. long (in space or time); tall; deep ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning long (in space or time); tall; deep
Antonym rassa
Sanskrit dīrgha

dīghā jāgarato ratti,
dīghaṃ santassa yojanaṃ,
dīgho bālānaṃ saṃsāro,
saddhammaṃ avijānataṃ.

DHP 60 bālavaggo

hoti kho so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena tassa mahānirayassa puratthimaṃ dvāraṃ apāpurīyati.

MN 130 devadūtasuttaṃ
dīgha 2

masc. (gram) long vowel; metrically more than one measure long ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (gram) long vowel; metrically more than one measure long
Antonym rassa
Sanskrit dīrgha

478, 438. akāro dīghaṃ hi mi mesu.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 478

akāro dīgham'āpajjate hi mi ma'icc'etesu vibhattīsu. gacchāhi, gacchāmi, gacchāma, gacchāmhe. mikāraggahaṇena hivibhattimhi akāro kvaci na dīgham'āpajjate. gacchahi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 478
dīgha 3

masc. name of a spirit ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a spirit
Commentary (MNa) dīgho'ti maṇi māṇivaro dīgho, atho serīsako sahā'ti (dī. ni. 3.293) evaṃ āgato aṭṭhavīsatiyā yakkhasenāpatīnaṃ abbhantaro eko devarājā.
Sanskrit dīrgha

atha kho dīgho parajano yakkho yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

Sanskrit dīrghāṅguli

dīgh'aṅguli kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

ind. for a long time [dīgha + aṃ + addha + ānaṃ] ✓

bālasaṅgatacārī hi,
dīgham'addhāna socati,
dukkho bālehi saṃvāso,
amitten'eva sabbadā,
dhīro ca sukhasaṃvāso,
ñātīnaṃ'va samāgamo.

Sanskrit dīrgha + āyus

na dīgham'āyuṃ labhate dhanena,
na c'āpi vittena jaraṃ vihanti,
appaṃ h'idaṃ jīvitam'āhu dhīrā,
asassataṃ vippariṇāmadhammaṃ.

TH 251 raṭṭhapālatheragāthā

dīgham'āyu manussānaṃ,
na naṃ hīḷe suporiso,
careyya khīramattova,
natthi maccussa āgamoti.

dīpa 1.1

masc. lamp; light [√dīp + a] ✓

Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

gandhatelappadittena,
dīpena tamadhaṃsinā,
tilokadīpaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
pūjayāmi tamonudaṃ.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā

ayañ'hi dīp'obhāsaṃ vā aggiobhāsaṃ vā adisvā maṇiāloken'eva bhuñjati ca nisīdati ca nipajjati ca, devo pana dīpa-ālokena nisinno bhavissatī'ti?

DHP 25 appamādavaggo

majjhe sarasmiṃ tiṭṭhataṃ,
oghe jāte mahabbhaye,
jarāmaccuparetānaṃ,
dīpaṃ pabrūmi kappa te.

SNP 65 kappa māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 10
dīpagāmī

adj. leading to terra firma; going to solid ground [dīpa + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to terra firma; going to solid ground
Construction dīpa + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dīpaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (SNa) patiṭṭh'aṭṭhena dīpaṃ.
dīpada

adj. giving light; who gives a lamp [dīpa + da] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning giving light; who gives a lamp
Construction dīpa + da
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dīpaṃ + da)
Sanskrit dīpa + da

annado balado hoti,
vatthado hoti vaṇṇado,
yānado sukhado hoti,
dīpado hoti cakkhudo.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ
dīpi

masc. leopard; panther ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning leopard; panther
Sanskrit dvīpin

mayūrakoñc'ābhirutamhi kānane,
dīpīhi byagghehi purakkhato vasaṃ,
kāye apekkhaṃ jaha mā virādhaya,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

sārambhaṃ nāma ... dīpīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, acchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, taracchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, yesaṃ kesañci tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ āsayo hoti, pubb'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, apar'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti

masc. panther ✗

Construction dīpi + vighāsa
dīpī

masc. panther; leopard ✗
dīpeti 1

pr. (+acc) explains; illustrates; illuminates; lit. shines [√dīp + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of dippati, trans (+acc)
Meaning explains; illustrates; illuminates; lit. shines
Root Family √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, blaze)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe (caus)
Construction dīpe + ti
Sanskrit dīpayati
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)

yo mukhasaṃyato bhikkhu,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
atthaṃ dhammañ'ca dīpeti,
madhuraṃ tassa bhāsitaṃ.

DHP 363 bhikkhuvaggo

dve'me, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhanti. katame dve? yo ca abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenā'ti dīpeti, yo ca bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenā'ti dīpeti.

AN 2.24 bālavaggo
dīpeti 2

pr. (+acc) light [√dīp] ✗
dīyati

pr. is given; is offered [√dā + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of dadāti, intrans
Meaning is given; is offered
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 īya (give)
Base √dā + īya > dīya (pass)
Construction dīya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Variant diyyati
Sanskrit dīyate
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

maccherā ca pamādā ca,
evaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati,
puññaṃ ākaṅkhamānena,
deyyaṃ hoti vijānatā'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ

ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca, api nu te, gahapati, kule dānaṃ dīyatī'ti? dīyati me, bhante, kule dānaṃ. tañ'ca kho lūkhaṃ kaṇājakaṃ biḷaṅgadutiyan'ti.

AN 9.20 velāmasuttaṃ
dīyamāna

prp. being given [√dā] ✗
dīyi

aor. was given; was offered [√dā + īya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of dīyati, pass, intrans
Meaning was given; was offered
Root Family √dā
Root √dā･1 īya (give)
Base √dā + īya > dīya (pass)
Construction dīya + i
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit adāyi
Sanskrit Root √dā 3 (give)

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, catūsu dvāresu dānaṃ dīyittha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānaṃ.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ
duka

nt. pair; dyad; group of two [dvi + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from dvi
Meaning pair; dyad; group of two
Construction dvi > du + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change dvi > du
Sanskrit dvika

ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā'ti, satam'pi mayaṃ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyo'pi gaṇāpema.

dukanipāta 1

masc. Book 2 of the Itivuttaka; Book of Twos ✗

masc. Chapter 2 of the Jātaka ✗

fem. Book 2 of the Aṅguttara Nikāya; Book of Twos ✗
dukūlasandana

adj. with halters made of fine cloth; (comm) with spreads made of fine cloth [dukūla + sandana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with halters made of fine cloth; (comm) with spreads made of fine cloth
Construction dukūla + sandana
Compound kammadhāraya (dukūla + sandana)
Commentary (SNa) dukūlasandānānī'ti dukūlasantharāni
Notes misspelling of dukūlasandāna?
Sanskrit dukūla + saṃdāna

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītidhenusahassāni ahesuṃ dukūlasandanāni kaṃs'ūpadhāraṇāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
dukūlasandāna

adj. with halters of fine cloth (?); with coverings of fine cloth (?) ✗
dukkaṭa 1

adj. badly done; wrongly done [dur + √kar + ta] ✓

Grammar adj, from kaṭa
Meaning badly done; wrongly done
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction dur + √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + kaṭa)
Antonym sukata
Sanskrit duṣkṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

sammādiṭṭhiko hoti aviparītadassano atthi dinnaṃ atthi yiṭṭhaṃ atthi hutaṃ atthi sukaṭadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko atthi ayaṃ loko atthi paro loko atthi mātā atthi pitā atthi sattā opapātikā

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

punakammāya ukkoṭeyyā'ti, akataṃ kammaṃ dukkaṭaṃ kammaṃ punakātabbaṃ kammaṃ anihataṃ dunnihataṃ puna nihanitabbaṃ'ti ukkoṭeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.3 ukkoṭanasikkhāpadaṃ
dukkaṭa 2

nt. bad deed; wrong action [dur + √kar + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, from kaṭa
Meaning bad deed; wrong action
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction dur + √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + kaṭa)
Antonym sukata
Sanskrit duṣkṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo,
pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ'ca sukataṃ seyyo,
yaṃ katvā n'ānutappati.

DHP 314 nirayavaggo

yassa kāyena vācāya,
manasā n'atthi dukkaṭaṃ,
saṃvutaṃ tīhi ṭhānehi,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 391 brāhmaṇavaggo
dukkaṭa 3

Construction dur + √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > ṭ
Sanskrit duṣkṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

na jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ. yo paribhuñjeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa. anujānāmi tikoṭiparisuddhaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ, adiṭṭhaṃ assutaṃ aparisaṅkitan'ti.

VIN 4.6.178 sīhasenāpativatthu

dukkaṭakārī

masc. wrong-doer; who does wrong; lit. doer of badly done [dur + kaṭa + kārī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning wrong-doer; who does wrong; lit. doer of badly done
Construction dur + kaṭa + kārī
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkaṭa + kārī)
Sanskrit duṣkṛta + kārin

attānañ'ce piyaṃ jaññā,
na naṃ pāpena saṃyuje,
na hi taṃ sulabhaṃ hoti,
sukhaṃ dukkaṭakārinā.

dukkathāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.157 (AN5.157) ✗
dukkara 1

adj. difficult to do; hard to achieve [dur + √kar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from kara
Meaning difficult to do; hard to achieve
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction dur + √kar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + kara)
Antonym sukara
Sanskrit duṣkara
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

duddadaṃ dadamānānaṃ,
dukkaraṃ kamma kubbataṃ,
asanto n'ānukubbanti,
sataṃ dhammo duranvayo.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, acelo kassapo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, dukkaraṃ, bho gotama, sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dukkara 2

nt. which is difficult to do; something hard to achieve [dur + √kar + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from kara
Meaning which is difficult to do; something hard to achieve
Root Family √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction dur + √kar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + kara)
Antonym sukara
Sanskrit duṣkara
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

dukkaraṃ v'āpi karonti,
sekhā sīlasamāhitā,
ṭhitattā anagāriy'upetassa,
tuṭṭhi hoti sukh'āvahā'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ
dukkarakāraka

adj. who does what is difficult to do; performer of difficult feats [dukkara + kāraka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who does what is difficult to do; performer of difficult feats
Construction dukkara + kāraka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkaraṃ + kāraka)
Sanskrit duṣkara + kāraka

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ, bhante, acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko dukkarakārako chamānikkhittaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
dukkarakārikā

fem. practice of austerities; extreme asceticism; gruelling discipline; lit. performance of what is difficult to do [dukkara + kārikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning practice of austerities; extreme asceticism; gruelling discipline; lit. performance of what is difficult to do
Construction dukkara + kārikā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkarānaṃ + kārikā)
Commentary (MNa) dukkarakārikāyā'ti pasata-pasata-muggayūs'ādiāharakaraṇ'ādinā dukkarakaraṇena. (PPa) dukkarakārikan'ti sarīratāpanaṃ.
Sanskrit duṣkara + kārikā

na kho pan'āhaṃ imāya kaṭukāya dukkarakārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ. siyā nu kho añño maggo bodhāyā'ti?

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

tāya'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, iriyāya tāya paṭipadāya tāya dukkarakārikāya n'ājjhagamaṃ uttariṃ manussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dukkaratara

adj. harder to do; more difficult ✗
dukkarapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.16 (SN38.16) ✗
dukkarasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.17 (SN1.17) ✗
dukkarasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 39.2 (SN39.2) ✗
dukkha 1

adj. uncomfortable; unpleasant [√dukkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning uncomfortable; unpleasant
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Variant dukha
Commentary (SNa) dukkhan'ti sukhapaṭikkhepo.
Sanskrit duḥkha
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

anekajātisaṃsāraṃ,
sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakārakaṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

DHP 153 jarāvaggo
dukkha 2

adj. painful [√dukkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning painful
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Variant dukha
Commentary (SNa) dukkhan'ti sukhapaṭikkhepo.
Sanskrit duḥkha
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.

MN 130 devadūtasuttaṃ
dukkha 3

nt. (+loc) discomfort; suffering; unease; unpleasantness; something unsatisfactory; trouble; a bummer; stress [√dukkh + a] ✓

Grammar nt (+loc)
Meaning discomfort; suffering; unease; unpleasantness; something unsatisfactory; trouble; a bummer; stress
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym sukha
Variant dukha
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit duḥkha
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.

DHP 277 maggavaggo
dukkha 4

nt. pain; physical discomfort [√dukkh + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning pain; physical discomfort
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym sukha
Variant dukha
Sanskrit duḥkha
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

katamañca, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kāyikaṃ dukkhaṃ kāyikaṃ asātaṃ kāyasamphassajaṃ dukkhaṃ asātaṃ vedayitaṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ.

MN 10.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ, dukkhasaccaniddeso
dukkhakkhandha

masc. heap of suffering; mass of difficulties; mountain of trouble [dukkha + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning heap of suffering; mass of difficulties; mountain of trouble
Construction dukkha + khandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + khandha)
Commentary (MNa) dukkhakkhandho'ti dukkharāsi.
Sanskrit duḥkha + skandha

app'eva nāma imassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyā paññāyethā'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
dukkhakkhaya

masc. wearing away of suffering; extinction of stress; termination of tension [dukkha + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of suffering; extinction of stress; termination of tension
Construction dukkha + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + khaya)
Variant dukhakkhaya
Commentary (ANa) dukkhakkhayāyā'ti sabbadukkhakkhay'atthaṃ.
Sanskrit duḥkhakṣaya

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya, sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, paññ'indriyaṃ

SN 48.9 paṭhamavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
dukkhakkhayagāmī

adj. leading to the slow destruction of suffering; leading to the extinction of stress [dukkha + khaya + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the slow destruction of suffering; leading to the extinction of stress
Construction dukkha + khaya + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkhakkhayaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (MNa) sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā'ti idhā'pi maggapaññā sammā hetunā nayena vaṭṭadukkhaṃ khepayamānā gacchatī'ti sammā dukkhakkhayagāminī nāma. vipassanā tadaṅgavasena vaṭṭadukkhañ'ca kilesadukkhañ'ca khepayamānā gacchatī'ti dukkhakkhayagāminī. dukkhakkhayagāminiyā vā maggapaññāya paṭilābhasaṃvattanato esā dukkhakkhayagāminī'ti veditabbā.
Sanskrit samyak + duḥkhakṣaya + gāmin

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā. sambodhipakkhikānaṃ, āvuso, dhammānaṃ ayaṃ pañcamī upanisā bhāvanāya.

AN 9.1 sambodhisuttaṃ
dukkhachandādisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.171-173 (SN35.171-173) ✗
dukkhatā

fem. unsatisfactoriness, suffering ✗
dukkhatāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.165 (SN45.165) ✗
dukkhato 1

nt. from suffering; from discomfort; from pain [√dukkh + a + to] ✓

Grammar nt, abl sg of dukkha
Meaning from suffering; from discomfort; from pain
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a + to
dukkha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Sanskrit duḥkhāt
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

evaṃ kir'assa ahosi, saddhā tāva dhammaṃ sotu'kāmā gamissanti'y'eva, assaddhā'pi pana dhanalobhena gantvā dhammaṃ sutvā dukkhato muccissantī'ti.

DHPa 2.26.33 jaṭilatthera vatthu
dukkhato 2

ind. as suffering; as pain; as discomfort [√dukkh + a + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of dukkha
Meaning as suffering; as pain; as discomfort
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a + to
dukkha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (MNa) dukkhato'ti na sukhato. (ANa) paṭipīḷan'ākārena dukkhato
Notes in reality denominative of dukkha
Sanskrit duḥkhāt
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda,
dukkham'addakkhi sallato,
ubhay'antarena n'āhosi,
kena lokasmi kiṃ siyā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

tesaṃ sutvāna sappaññā,
sacittaṃ paccaladdhā te,
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ,
dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
dukkhatta

nt. difficulty; fact of being painful [√dukkh] ✗
dukkhadukkhatā

fem. dukkha as ordinary suffering ✗
dukkhadomanassa

nt. discomfort and distress; pain and stress; physical pain and mental suffering [dukkha + domanassa] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning discomfort and distress; pain and stress; physical pain and mental suffering
Construction dukkha + domanassa
Compound dvanda (dukkha ca domanassa ca)
Commentary (MNa) dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāyā'ti kāyikadukkhassa ca cetasikadomanassassa cā'ti imesaṃ dvinnaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya, nirodhāyā'ti attho. ayañ'hi maggo bhāvito tissatther'ādīnaṃ viya dukkhassa, sakk'ādīnaṃ viya ca domanassassa atthaṅ'gamāya saṃvattati.
Sanskrit duḥkha + daurmanasya

ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā

DN 22.1 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dukkhadhamma 1

nt. misfortune; painful experience; state of suffering [dukkha + dhamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning misfortune; painful experience; state of suffering
Construction dukkha + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + dhamma)
Commentary (DNa) dukkhadhammenā'ti vadhabandh'ādinā dukkhakāraṇena. (SNa) dukkhadhammānan'ti dukkhasambhavadhammānaṃ. pañcasu hi khandhesu sati chedanavadhabandhan'ādibhedaṃ dukkhaṃ sambhavati, tasmā te dukkhasambhavadhammattā dukkhadhammā'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit duḥkha + dharma

ajātaṃ asamuppannaṃ,
asokaṃ virajaṃ padaṃ,
nirodho dukkhadhammānaṃ,
saṅkhār'ūpasamo sukho'ti.

ITI 43 ajātasuttaṃ

katamo ca, bhikkhave, soko? yo kho, bhikkhave, aññatar'aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa aññatar'aññatarena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa soko socanā socitattaṃ antosoko antoparisoko, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, soko

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dukkhadhamma 2

adj. uncomfortable in nature; of unpleasant character [dukkha + dhamma] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning uncomfortable in nature; of unpleasant character
Construction dukkha + dhamma
Commentary (SNa) dukkhadhammānan'ti dukkhasambhavadhammānaṃ. pañcasu hi khandhesu sati chedanavadhabandhan'ādibhedaṃ dukkhaṃ sambhavati, tasmā te dukkhasambhavadhammattā dukkhadhammā'ti vuccanti.
dukkhadhammasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 23.16 (SN23.16) ✗
dukkhadhammasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.244 (SN35.244) ✗
dukkhadhātu

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of physical pain
Construction dukkha + dhātu
dukkhanidāna 1

nt. source of misery ✗
dukkhanidāna 2

adj. causing pain ✗
dukkhanibbānasappāyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.148 (SN35.148) ✗
dukkhanirodha

masc. end of suffering; cessation of distress [dukkha + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning end of suffering; cessation of distress
Construction dukkha + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + nirodha)
Antonym dukkhasamudaya
Sanskrit duḥkha + nirodha

dukkhaṃ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṃ, dukkhassa nidānasambhavo veditabbo, dukkhassa vemattatā veditabbā, dukkhassa vipāko veditabbo, dukkhanirodho veditabbo, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, avijjā? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dukkhanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the cessation of suffering [dukkhanirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the cessation of suffering
Construction dukkhanirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkhanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Commentary (SNa) dukkhanirodhagāminī samanupassanā'ti ettha saha vipassanāya catumaggañāṇaṃ samanupassanā'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit duḥkha + nirodha + gāmin

katamā ca, bhikkhave, avijjā? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sakkāyanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti. iti h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, vuccati dukkhanirodhagāminī samanupassanā'ti. ayam'ev'ettha attho'ti.

SN 22.44 paṭipadāsuttaṃ
dukkhanuda

Meaning driving out suffering
Construction dukkha + nuda

Meaning gone to the end of suffering
Construction dukkha + antagū
Commentary (SNPa) dukkh'antagunā'ti vaṭṭadukkhassa antagatena.
dukkhanti

sandhi. suffering; pain; uncomfortable [dukkhaṃ + iti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning suffering; pain; uncomfortable
Construction dukkhaṃ + iti
Antonym sukhantipi
Sanskrit duḥkham + iti

dukkhan'ti khandhe paṭipassa yoniso,
yato ca dukkhaṃ samudeti taṃ jaha,
idh'eva dukkhassa karohi antaṃ,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
dukkhantipi

sandhi. this is unpleasant; this is painful [dukkhaṃ + iti + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind + ind
Meaning this is unpleasant; this is painful
Construction dukkhaṃ + iti + api
Antonym sukhantipi
Sanskrit duḥkham + iti + api

kiñ'ca vijānāti? sukhan'ti'pi vijānāti, dukkhan'ti'pi vijānāti, adukkham'asukhan'ti'pi vijānāti. vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇanti vuccatī'ti.

dukkhapaṭikūla

Meaning averse to suffering; opposed to pain

Sanskrit duḥkha + pratikūla

atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhapaṭikūlo.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
dukkhapaṭikkūla

adj. averse to suffering; opposed to pain [dukkha + paṭikūla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning averse to suffering; opposed to pain
Construction dukkha + paṭikūla
Compound catutthī tappurisa (dukkhassa + paṭikūla)
Variant dukkhapaṭikūla
Commentary (MNa) dukkhapaṭikkūlan'ti dukkhassa paṭikūlaṃ, paccanīkasaṇṭhitaṃ dukkhaṃ apatthayamānan'ti attho.
Sanskrit duḥkha + pratikūla

yv'āyaṃ, bhante, puggalo attantapo attaparitāpan'ānuyogam'anuyutto so attānaṃ sukhakāmaṃ dukkhapaṭikkūlaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, iminā me ayaṃ puggalo cittaṃ n'ārādheti.

Meaning afflicted with suffering; overcome by misery
Construction dukkha + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dukkhena + pareta)
Sanskrit duḥkha + parīta

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
dukkhappaṭikkūla

adj. averse to suffering; opposed to pain [dukkha + paṭikūla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning averse to suffering; opposed to pain
Construction dukkha + paṭikūla
Compound catutthī tappurisa (dukkhassa + paṭikkūla)
Variant dukkhappaṭikūla
Commentary (MNa) dukkhapaṭikkūlan'ti dukkhassa paṭikūlaṃ, paccanīkasaṇṭhitaṃ dukkhaṃ apatthayamānan'ti attho.
Sanskrit duḥkha + pratikūla

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, aṅgārakāsu sādhikaporisā, pūrā aṅgārānaṃ vīt'accikānaṃ vītadhūmānaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikkūlo.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
dukkhappadhāna

nt. painful effort; unpleasant exertion [dukkha + padhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning painful effort; unpleasant exertion
Construction dukkha + padhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + padhāna)
Sanskrit duḥkha + praṇidhāna

āraddhaṃ kho pana me, aggivessana, vīriyaṃ hoti asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, sāraddho ca pana me kāyo hoti appaṭippassaddho ten'eva dukkhappadhānena padhān'ābhitunnassa sato.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
dukkhabahula

adj. full of problems; with many troubles [dukkha + bahula] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of problems; with many troubles
Construction dukkha + bahula
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + bahula)
Antonym sukhabahula
Commentary (MNa) dukkhabahulā'ti pettivisayasmiñ'hi dukkham'eva bahulaṃ, sukhaṃ parittaṃ kadāci anubhavitabbaṃ hoti, tasmā evam'āha.
Sanskrit duḥkhabahula

tam'enaṃ passāmi aparena samayena dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pettivisayaṃ upapannaṃ, dukkhabahulā vedanā vedayamānaṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dukkhama

adj. hard to endure; difficult to tolerate [dur + √kham + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from khama
Meaning hard to endure; difficult to tolerate
Root Family √kham
Root √kham･1 a (tolerate, endure)
√ In Comps kkham
Construction dur + √kham + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + khama)
Commentary (THa) dukkhamamhi'pī'ti aññam'aññaṃ tikhiṇa-kasā-patod'ābhighāt'ādidukkhehi dussahāya'pi. liṅgavipallāsena h'etaṃ vuttaṃ, dukkhamamhi'pī'ti.
Sanskrit dus + kṣama
Sanskrit Root √kṣam 1, 4 (endure)

saṃsaraṃ hi nirayaṃ agacchissaṃ,
petalokam'agamaṃ punappunaṃ,
dukkhamamhi'pi tiracchānayoniyaṃ,
n'ekadhā hi vusitaṃ ciraṃ mayā.

TH 183 gotamattheragāthā
dukkhamacceti

pr. escapes suffering; overcomes distress ✗
dukkhamaticca

ger. escaping suffering; overcoming distress [dukkhaṃ + aticca] ✓

Grammar ger of dukkhamacceti, comp vb
Meaning escaping suffering; overcoming distress
Construction dukkhaṃ + aticca
Compound comp verb (dukkhaṃ + aticca)
Commentary (SNa) dukkham'aticca iriyatī'ti dukkhaṃ atikkamitvā viharati
Sanskrit duḥkham + atyaya

kathaṃvidhaṃ sīlavantaṃ vadanti,
kathaṃvidhaṃ paññavantaṃ vadanti,
kathaṃvidho dukkham'aticca iriyati,
kathaṃvidhaṃ devatā pūjayantī'ti.

SN 2.14 nandanasuttaṃ
dukkhamaddakkhi

aor. saw suffering; understood discomfort [dukkhaṃ + addakkhi] ~

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning saw suffering; understood discomfort
Construction dukkhaṃ + addakkhi
Commentary (ITIa) dukkhamaddakkhi sallato'ti yathā sallaṃ sarīraṃ anupavisantam'pi paviṭṭham'pi uddhariyamānam'pi pīḷam'eva janeti, evaṃ dukkhavedanā uppajjamānā'pi ṭhitippattā'pi bhijjamānā'pi vibādhati'y'evā'ti taṃ sallato vipassī'ti vuttaṃ.

Grammar imperf, comp vb
Meaning saw discomfort; saw suffering
Construction dukkhaṃ + addasā
dukkhamanveti

pr. (+acc) suffering follows; discomfort comes after [dukkhaṃ + anveti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb (+acc)
Meaning suffering follows; discomfort comes after
Construction dukkhaṃ + anveti
Commentary (DHPa) tato naṃ dukkham'anvetī'ti tato tividhaduccaritato taṃ puggalaṃ dukkhaṃ anveti, duccarit'ānubhāvena catūsu apāyesu, manussesu vā tam'attabhāvaṃ gacchantaṃ kāyavatthukam'pi itarampī'ti iminā pariyāyena kāyikacetasikaṃ vipākadukkhaṃ anugacchati.
Sanskrit duḥkham + anvaiti

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃ'va vahato padaṃ.

DHP1 yamakavaggo
dukkhamappiyaṃ

sandhi. (+dat) suffering is disliked (by); lit. pain is not dear [dukkhaṃ + appiyaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + adj (+dat)
Meaning suffering is disliked (by); lit. pain is not dear
Construction dukkhaṃ + appiyaṃ
Commentary (UDa) dukkhaṃ appiyaṃ aniṭṭhaṃ
Sanskrit duḥkham + apriyam

sace bhāyatha dukkhassa,
sace vo dukkham'appiyaṃ,
m'ākattha pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.

UD 44 kumārakasuttaṃ
dukkhamicchati

pr. (+dat) wants suffering (for); desires discomfort (for) [dukkhaṃ + icchati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb (+dat)
Meaning wants suffering (for); desires discomfort (for)
Construction dukkhaṃ + icchati
Compound comp verb (dukkhaṃ + icchati)
Sanskrit duḥkham + icchati

na paro paraṃ nikubbetha,
n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kañci,
byārosanā paṭighasaññā,
n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā,
aviddasū yattha sitā puthujjanā,
te dukkham'icchanti punabbhav'esino,
cittena nītā niraye nirākatā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

Meaning this is suffering

jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo,
mā te kāmaguṇe ramessu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

yaṃ kho ahaṃ idaṃ kāyena kammaṃ kattukāmo idaṃ me kāyakammaṃ attabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, parabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, ubhayabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti

dukkhavihārasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 28 (ITI 28) ✗
dukkhavedanā

fem. painful feeling; unpleasant sensation; bad experience [dukkha + vedanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning painful feeling; unpleasant sensation; bad experience
Construction dukkha + vedanā
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + vedanā)
Antonym sukhavedanā
Sanskrit duḥkha + vedanā

tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ pare akkosanti paribhāsanti rosenti vihesenti, so evaṃ pajānāti, uppannā kho me ayaṃ sotasamphassajā dukkhavedanā. sā ca kho paṭicca, no apaṭicca. kiṃ paṭicca?

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
dukkhavedaniya

adj. painful; uncomfortable; lit. to be felt as pain [dukkha + vedaniya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning painful; uncomfortable; lit. to be felt as pain
Construction dukkha + vedaniya
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + vedaniya)
Antonym sukhavedaniya, adukkhamasukhavedaniya
Variant dukkhavedanīya
Sanskrit duḥkha + vedanīya

dukkhavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhu, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tass'eva dukkhavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ dukkhavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannā dukkhā vedanā sā nirujjhati, sā vūpasammatī'ti pajānāti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dukkhavedanīya
