Antonym sukhavedanīya, adukkhamasukhavedanīya
Variant dukkhavedaniya
Sanskrit duḥkha + vedanīya
dukkhavepakka

adj. having painful or unpleasant consequences ✗
dukkhasaccaniddesa

masc. detailed analysis of the truth of suffering; investigation of the first truth [dukkhasacca + niddesa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning detailed analysis of the truth of suffering; investigation of the first truth
Construction dukkhasacca + niddesa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhasaccassa + niddesa)
dukkhasaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of suffering (in); perception of no ease (in); perceiving discomfort (in) [dukkha + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of suffering (in); perception of no ease (in); perceiving discomfort (in)
Construction dukkha + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + saññā)
Sanskrit duḥkha + saṃjñā

cha, bhikkhave, ānisaṃse sampassamānena alam'eva bhikkhunā sabbasaṅkhāresu anodhiṃ karitvā dukkhasaññaṃ upaṭṭhāpetuṃ. katame cha?

AN 6.103 ukkhittāsikasuttaṃ
dukkhasaññāparicita

adj. (+loc) fortified by the perception of suffering (in) [dukkhasaññā + paricita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning fortified by the perception of suffering (in)
Construction dukkhasaññā + paricita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkhasaññaṃ + paricita)
Sanskrit duḥkha + saṃjñā + paricita

anicce dukkhasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato ālasye kosajje vissaṭṭhiye pamāde ananuyoge apaccavekkhaṇāya tibbā bhayasaññā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti, seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ukkhittāsike vadhake.

AN 7.49 dutiyasaññāsuttaṃ
dukkhasaññī

adj. (+loc) recognising suffering (in); perceiving no ease (in); perceiving discomfort (in) [dukkha + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognising suffering (in); perceiving no ease (in); perceiving discomfort (in)
Construction dukkha + saññī
dukkhasamudaya

masc. source of stress; arising of suffering; appearance of discomfort [dukkha + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of stress; arising of suffering; appearance of discomfort
Construction dukkha + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + samudaya)
Antonym dukkhanirodha
Sanskrit duḥkha + samudaya

yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chando ālayo anunayo ajjhosānaṃ so dukkhasamudayo. yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, so dukkhanirodho'ti. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bahukataṃ hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, avijjā? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dukkhasamudayagāmī

adj. leading to the arising of suffering; which leads to the source of stress; which creates discomfort [dukkha + samudaya + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the arising of suffering; which leads to the source of stress; which creates discomfort
Construction dukkha + samudaya + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkhasamudayaṃ + gāmī)
Antonym dukkhanirodhagāmī
Commentary (SNa) dukkhasamudayagāminī samanupassanā'ti yasmā sakkāyo dukkhaṃ, tassa ca samudayagāminī paṭipadā nāma rūpaṃ attato samanupassatī'ti evaṃ diṭṭhisamanupassanā vuttā, tasmā dukkhasamudayagāminī samanupassanā'ti ayam'ettha attho hoti.
Sanskrit duḥkha + samudaya + gāmin

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sakkāyasamudayagāminī paṭipadā, sakkāyasamudayagāminī paṭipadā'ti. iti h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, vuccati dukkhasamudayagāminī samanupassanā'ti. ayam'ev'ettha attho.

SN 22.44 paṭipadāsuttaṃ
dukkhasamudayasambhava

masc. generation of the arising of suffering; creation of the source of stress ✗
dukkhasamudayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.106 (SN35.106) ✗
dukkhasamuppāda

masc. arising of discomfort; origination of suffering [dukkha + samuppāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of discomfort; origination of suffering
Construction dukkha + samuppāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + samuppāda)
Sanskrit duḥkha + samutpāda

dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ,
dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ,
ariyaṃ c'aṭṭh'aṅgikaṃ maggaṃ,
dukkh'ūpasamagāminaṃ.

DHP 191 buddhavaggo
dukkhasamphassa

adj. unpleasant to the touch; painful to the touch [dukkha + samphassa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning unpleasant to the touch; painful to the touch
Construction dukkha + samphassa
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + samphassa)
Antonym sukhasamphassa
Commentary (DSa) dukkhasamphassan'ti dukkhavedanāpaccayaṃ aniṭṭhaphoṭṭhabbaṃ.
Sanskrit duḥkha + saṃsparśa

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya, api nu so puriso iti c'itic'eva kāyaṃ sannāmeyyā'ti? evaṃ, bho gotama. taṃ kissa hetu? asu hi, bho gotama, aggi dukkhasamphasso c'eva mah'ābhitāpo ca mahāpariḷāho cā'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
dukkhasamphassatā

fem. unpleasantness to the touch; fact of being painful to the touch [dukkha + samphassa + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from dukkhasamphassa
Meaning unpleasantness to the touch; fact of being painful to the touch
Construction dukkha + samphassa + tā
dukkhasamphassa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym sukhasamphassatā
Commentary (MNt) āyatiṃ dukkhaphalatāya etarahi ca kilesadukkhabahulatāya kāmānaṃ dukkhasamphassatā, tadubhayasaṃyuttesu tesu ca taṃ asallakkhitvā ek'antasukh'ābhiniveso viparītasaññāya, na kevalāya sukhavedanāya sukhā'ti pavattasaññī.
Sanskrit duḥkha + saṃsparśa +
dukkhasambhūta

adj. produced by something uncomfortable [dukkha + sambhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by something uncomfortable
Construction dukkha + sambhūta
dukkhasammata

adj. considered to be stressful; regarded as painful; agreed to be uncomfortable [dukkha + sammata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning considered to be stressful; regarded as painful; agreed to be uncomfortable
Construction dukkha + sammata
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkha + sammata)
Antonym sukhasammata
Sanskrit duḥkha + sammata

sadevakassa lokassa,
ete vo sukhasammatā,
yattha c'ete nirujjhanti,
taṃ nesaṃ dukkhasammataṃ.

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.75 (AN6.75) ✗
dukkhassanta

masc. end of suffering [dukkhassa + anta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning end of suffering
Construction dukkhassa + anta
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + anta)
Sanskrit duḥkhānta

etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissatha,
akkhāto vo mayā maggo,
aññāya sallakantanaṃ.

DHP 275 maggavaggo

yo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye,
appamatto vihassati,
pahāya jātisaṃsāraṃ,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissatī'ti.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ
dukkhassantakara

adj. who makes an end of suffering [dukkhassa + antakara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who makes an end of suffering
Construction dukkhassa + antakara
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dukkhassa + antakara)
Commentary (ANa) dukkhass'antakaro hotī'ti sakalavaṭṭadukkhassa pariyantaṃ parivaṭumaṃ karo hoti.
Sanskrit duḥkhasya + antakaraṇa

upasanto anāyāso,
vippasanno anāvilo,
kalyāṇasīlo medhāvī,
dukkhass'antakaro siyā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhu abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānāti, pariññeyyaṃ parijānāti, abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānanto pariññeyyaṃ parijānanto diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hotī'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
dukkhassantakiriya

nt. making an end of suffering [dukkhassa + anta + kiriya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning making an end of suffering
Construction dukkhassa + anta + kiriya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkhassantaṃ + kiriya)
Commentary (DNa) dukkhass'antakiriyāyā'ti sakalassa vaṭṭadukkhassa pariyantakaraṇ'atthaṃ.
Sanskrit duḥkhānta + kriyā

das'uttaraṃ pavakkhāmi,
dhammaṃ nibbānapattiyā,
dukkhass'antakiriyāya,
sabbaganthappamocanaṃ.

DN 34.1 dasuttarasuttaṃ
dukkhaṃ

ind. badly; with difficulty; uncomfortably [√dukkh + a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of dukkha
Meaning badly; with difficulty; uncomfortably
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a + aṃ
dukkha + aṃ
Sanskrit duḥkham
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

jayaṃ veraṃ pasavati,
dukkhaṃ seti parājito,
upasanto sukhaṃ seti,
hitvā jayaparājayaṃ.

DHP 201 sukhavaggo

kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodh'ābhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'c'āpi so pallaṅke seti gonak'atthate paṭalik'atthate kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇe sauttaracchade ubhatolohitak'ūpadhāne, atha kho so dukkhaññ'eva seti kodh'ābhibhūto.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
dukkhādhivaha

adj. bringing suffering; causing discomfort [dukkha + adhivāha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bringing suffering; causing discomfort
Construction dukkha + adhivāha
Antonym sukhādhivaha
Commentary (ANa) jāti'pi dukkhā'tiādinā nayena vuttaṃ dukkhaṃ adhivahati āharatī'ti dukkh'ādhivahaṃ. dukkh'ādhivāhan'ti'pi pāṭho. tass'attho, lok'uttarapādakajjhān'ādi ariyadhamm'ābhimukhaṃ dukkhena adhivāhīyati pesīyatī'ti dukkh'ādhivāhaṃ. idam'pi vaṭṭavasena uppannacittam'eva.
dukkhādhivāha

adj. bringing suffering; conducive to pain [dukkha + adhivāha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bringing suffering; conducive to pain
Construction dukkha + adhivāha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dukkhaṃ + adhivāha)
Commentary (SNa) dukkh'ādhivāhā hontī'ti nerayik'ādibhedaṃ adhikadukkhaṃ āvahanakā honti.
Sanskrit duḥkha + adhivāha

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, phass'āyatanā adantā aguttā arakkhitā asaṃvutā dukkh'ādhivāhā honti. katame cha? cakkhu, bhikkhave, phass'āyatanaṃ adantaṃ aguttaṃ arakkhitaṃ asaṃvutaṃ dukkh'ādhivāhaṃ hoti

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
dukkhānupatita

adj. afflicted with suffering; stricken by pain; fallen into misery [dukkha + anupatita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with suffering; stricken by pain; fallen into misery
Construction dukkha + anupatita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dukkhena + anupatita)
Antonym sukhānupatita
Commentary (SNa) dukkh'ānupatitā'ti dukkhena anupatitā.
Sanskrit duḥkha + anupatita

duppabbajjaṃ durabhiramaṃ,
durāvāsā gharā dukhā,
dukkhosamānasaṃvāso,
dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū,
tasmā na c'addhagū siyā,
na ca dukkh'ānupatito siyā.

DHP 302 pakiṇṇakavaggo

rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, mahāli, ek'antadukkhaṃ abhavissa dukkh'ānupatitaṃ dukkh'āvakkantaṃ anavakkantaṃ sukhena, na'y'idaṃ sattā rūpasmiṃ sārajjeyyuṃ.

SN 22.60 mahālisuttaṃ
dukkhānupatitaddhagū

masc. a traveller who is afflected with suffering; a wayfarer stricken by pain [dukkhānupatita + addhagū] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning a traveller who is afflected with suffering; a wayfarer stricken by pain
Construction dukkhānupatita + addhagū
Compound kammadhāraya (dukkhānupatita + addhagū)
Commentary (DHPa) dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū'ti ye vaṭṭasaṅkhātaṃ addhānaṃ paṭipannattā addhagū, te dukkhe anupatitā'va.
Sanskrit duḥkha + anupatita + adhvaga

duppabbajjaṃ durabhiramaṃ,
durāvāsā gharā dukhā,
dukkhosamānasaṃvāso,
dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū,
tasmā na c'addhagū siyā,
na ca dukkh'ānupatito siyā .

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujan'āhitāya bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

Antonym sukhita
Commentary (DNa) dukkhitan'ti rogadukkhena dukkhitaṃ. (UDa) dukkhito'ti kāyasannissitaṃ dukkhaṃ sañjātaṃ assā'ti dukkhito, dukkhappatto'ti attho.
Notes in reality denominative of dukkha
Sanskrit duḥkhita
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
dukkhetta

nt. poor, infertile land ✗
dukkhena 1

nt. with pain; with discomfort; with suffering [√dukkh + a + ena] ✓

Grammar nt, instr sg of dukkha
Meaning with pain; with discomfort; with suffering
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a + ena
dukkha + ena
Sanskrit duḥkhena
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

yena vā pana dukkhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto bahiddhā pariyeṭṭhiṃ āpajjati, ko ekapadaṃ dvipadaṃ jānāti imassa dukkhassa nirodhāyā'ti?

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

phassena phuṭṭho na sukhena majje,
dukkhena phuṭṭho'pi na sampavedhe,
phassadvayaṃ sukhadukkhe upekkhe,
anānuruddho aviruddha kenaci.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
dukkhena 2

ind. painfully; difficultly; uncomfortably [√dukkh + a + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of dukkha
Meaning painfully; difficultly; uncomfortably
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh + a + ena
dukkha + ena
Notes in reality denominative of dukkha
Sanskrit duḥkhena
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

tasmā hi dhīro idh'upaṭṭhitassatī, kāme ca pāpe ca asevamāno, sahā'pi dukkhena jaheyya kāme, paṭisotagāmī'ti tam'āhu puggalaṃ.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ
dukkhotiṇṇa

adj. immersed in suffering; afflicted with suffering; fallen into misery [dukkha + otiṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in suffering; afflicted with suffering; fallen into misery
Construction dukkha + otiṇṇa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dukkhena + otiṇṇa)
Sanskrit duḥkha + avatīrṇa

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco kulaputto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, otiṇṇo'mhi jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, dukkh'otiṇṇo dukkhapareto.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
dukkhosamānasaṃvāso

sandhi. living together with others is painful; (comm) living together with people from different backgrounds and with different abilities is suffering [dukkho + samāna + saṃvāso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + adj + masc
Meaning living together with others is painful; (comm) living together with people from different backgrounds and with different abilities is suffering
Construction dukkho + samāna + saṃvāso
dukkho + asamāna + saṃvāso
Commentary (DHPa) dukkho samānasaṃvāso'ti gihino vā hi ye jātigottakulabhogehi pabbajitā vā sīl'ācārabāhusacc'ādīhi samānā'pi hutvā, ko'si tvaṃ, ko'smi ahan'tiādīni vatvā adhikaraṇapasutā honti, te asamānā nāma, tehi saddhiṃ saṃvāso dukkho'ti attho.
Sanskrit duḥkhaḥ + samāna + saṃvāsa

duppabbajjaṃ durabhiramaṃ,
durāvāsā gharā dukhā,
dukkhosamānasaṃvāso,
dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū,
tasmā na c'addhagū siyā,
na ca dukkh'ānupatito siyā.

DHP 302 pakiṇṇakavaggo
dukha 1

adj. uncomfortable; painful; unpleasant [√dukkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning uncomfortable; painful; unpleasant
Root Family √dukkh
Root √dukkh･1 a (be painful)
Construction √dukkh > du(k)kh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change kkh > kh
Variant dukkha
Sanskrit duḥkha
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

na kahāpaṇavassena,
titti kāmesu vijjati,
app'assādā dukhā kāmā,
iti viññāya paṇḍito.

DHP 186 buddhavaggo

duppabbajjaṃ durabhiramaṃ,
durāvāsā gharā dukhā,
dukkhosamānasaṃvāso,
dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū,
tasmā na c'addhagū siyā,
na ca dukkh'ānupatito siyā.

DHP 302 pakiṇṇakavaggo

Variant dukkha
Sanskrit duḥkha
Sanskrit Root duḥkha - (pain)

kadā nu'haṃ bhayajananiṃ dukh'āvahaṃ,
taṇhālataṃ bahuvidh'ānuvattaniṃ,
paññāmayaṃ tikhiṇam'asiṃ gahetvā,
chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

kadā nu'haṃ bhayajananiṃ dukh'āvahaṃ,
taṇhālataṃ bahuvidh'ānuvattaniṃ,
paññāmayaṃ tikhiṇam'asiṃ gahetvā,
chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
dukhita

pp. afflicted; suffering [√dukkh] ✗

Sanskrit duḥkha + udaya
dugga 1

nt. bad place; difficult road [dur + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from ga
Meaning bad place; difficult road
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction dur + √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + ga)
Commentary (SNa) duggā'ti duggamā.
Sanskrit durga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

yo'maṃ palipathaṃ duggaṃ,
saṃsāraṃ moham'accagā,
tiṇṇo pāragato jhāyī,
anejo akathaṃkathī,
anupādāya nibbuto,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 414 brāhmaṇavaggo

appamādaratā hotha,
sacittam'anurakkhatha,
duggā uddharath'attānaṃ,
paṅke sanno'va kuñjaro.

DHP 327 nāgavaggo
dugga 2

nt. fortress [√gam] ✗
duggata

adj. faring badly; poor; miserable; suffering; unfortunate [dur + √gam + ta] ✓

Meaning faring badly; poor; miserable; suffering; unfortunate

Root √gam･1 a (go)

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t

Antonym sugata
Commentary (MNa) duggatā'ti duṭṭhugatā duppaṭipannā kāyadaḷhibahulā vissaṭṭhakammaṭṭhānā. evarūpā'pi ekacce atthi.
Sanskrit durgata
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

tathā hi pana ayam'āyasmā saṅghe vā viharanto eko vā viharanto, ye ca tattha sugatā ye ca tattha duggatā, ye ca tattha gaṇam'anusāsanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisesu saṃdissanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisena anupalittā, n'āyam'āyasmā taṃ tena avajānāti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ

so, duggataṃ durūpetan'ti pāḷiyā na sameti, tasmā vuttanayen'ev'ettha bhāvanam'ārabhitvā sīmāsambhedaṃ katvā appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
duggatasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 15.11 (SN15.11) ✗
duggati

Commentary (ANa) tathā dukkhassa gatibhāvato duggati.
Sanskrit durgati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

taṃ kissa hetu? aparisuddhattā, bhikkhave, vatthassa. evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, citte saṃkiliṭṭhe, duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sakakammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
duggatyā

fem. from a state of misery; from a bad destination; from hell [dur + √gam + ti + iyā] ✓

Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

diṭṭh'eva dhamme gārayhā,
samparāye ca duggati,
na ne jāti nivāreti,
duggatyā garahāya vā.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
duggandha 1

adj. foul smelling; fetid; malodorous; stinky [dur + √ghā + na] ✓

Grammar adj, from gandha
Meaning foul smelling; fetid; malodorous; stinky
Root Family √ghā
Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction dur + √ghā + na
Derivative kita (na)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + gandha)
Antonym suvaṇṇa
Commentary (PVa) duggandho'ti aniṭṭhagandho, kuṇapagandhagandhī'ti attho.
Sanskrit durgandha
Sanskrit Root √ghrā 1, 2, 3 (smell)

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane. katame pañca? acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa nacchādeti.

AN 5.208 dantakaṭṭhasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gūthakūpo kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyosomattāya duggandho hoti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
duggandha 2

masc. bad smell; foul odour [dur + √ghā + na] ✓

Grammar masc, from gandha
Meaning bad smell; foul odour
Root Family √ghā
Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction dur + √ghā + na
Derivative kita (na)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + gandha)
Sanskrit durgandha
Sanskrit Root √ghrā 1, 2, 3 (smell)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gaṇḍo anekavassagaṇiko. tass'assu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni. tato yaṃ kiñci pagghareyya, asuci'y'eva pagghareyya, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pagghareyya.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ
duggandhatara

adj. more foul smelling; more fetid; more malodorous; stinkier [dur + √ghā + na + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, from compar of dugganda
Meaning more foul smelling; more fetid; more malodorous; stinkier
Root Family √ghā
Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction dur + √ghā + na + tara
duggandha + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Commentary (MNa) asucitarāni c'evā'tiādīsu pakatiyā'va tāni asucīni ca duggandhāni ca pūtīni ca, idāni pana asucitarāni c'eva duggandhatarāni ca pūtitarāni ca honti.
Sanskrit durgandha + tara
Sanskrit Root √ghrā 1, 2, 3 (smell)

tathā tathā'ssa tāni vaṇamukhāni asucitarāni c'eva honti duggandhatarāni ca pūtikatarāni ca, hoti c'eva kāci sātamattā assādamattā, yadidaṃ vaṇamukhānaṃ kaṇḍūvanahetu.

duggama

duggamo bhagavā visamo maggo'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ

duggame visame v'āpi,
ariyā gacchanti kāmada,
anariyā visame magge,
papatanti avaṃsirā,
ariyānaṃ samo maggo,
ariyā hi visame samā'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ
duggaha

masc. taking hold of wrongly; bad seizing ✗

kuso yathā duggahito,
hattham'ev'ānukantati,
sāmaññaṃ dupparāmaṭṭhaṃ,
nirayāy'upakaḍḍhati.

DHP 311 nirayavaggo
duggahita 2

√ In Comps ggah

Antonym suggahita
Variant duggahīta
Sanskrit dus + gṛhīta, gṛbhita
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū duggahitehi suttantehi byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca paṭibāhanti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujan'āhitāya paṭipannā bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.42 samacittavaggo

atha ca pana tvaṃ, moghapurisa, attanā duggahitena amhe c'eva abbhācikkhasi, attānañ'ca khanasi, bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavasi. tañ'hi te, moghapurisa, bhavissati dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

so tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ. taṃ kissa hetu? duggahitattā, bhikkhave, alagaddassa.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

ā > ī

sā kho pan'esā, mahānāma, brahmunā sanaṅkumārena gāthā sugītā no duggītā, subhāsitā no dubbhāsitā, atthasaṃhitā no anatthasaṃhitā, anumatā bhagavatā'ti.

dhammacārī sukhaṃ seti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

mal'itthiyā duccaritaṃ,
maccheraṃ dadato malaṃ,
malā ve pāpakā dhammā,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

DHP 242 malavaggo

ye ca kho keci kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti manasā duccaritaṃ caranti tesaṃ appiyo attā

nt. Itivuttaka 64 (ITI 64) ✗
duccaritādikathā

ducchanna

adj. badly-thatched; poorly-roofed; lit. badly covered [dur + √chad + na] ✓

Grammar adj, from channa
Meaning badly-thatched; poorly-roofed; lit. badly covered
Root Family √chad
Root √chad･8 *e (cover, conceal)
√ In Comps cchad
Construction dur + √chad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + channa)
Antonym succhanna
Sanskrit dur + channa
Sanskrit Root √chad 1 (cover)

yathā agāraṃ ducchannaṃ,
vuṭṭhī samativijjhati,
evaṃ abhāvitaṃ cittaṃ,
rāgo samativijjhati.

DHP 13 yamakavaggo
dujjaya

adj. hard to win; difficult to succeed (in) [dur + √ji + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from jaya
Meaning hard to win; difficult to succeed (in)
Root Family √ji
Root √ji･1 a (conquer)
Construction dur + √ji > jay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > ay
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + jaya)
Sanskrit jaya
Sanskrit Root √ji 1, 2 (conquer)

tass'eva tena pāpiyo,
yo kuddhaṃ paṭikujjhati,
kuddhaṃ appaṭikujjhanto,
saṅgāmaṃ jeti dujjayaṃ.

SN 7.3 asurindakasuttaṃ
dujjaha

adj. hard to give up; difficult to abandon; hard to let go of [√hā + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from jaha
Meaning hard to give up; difficult to abandon; hard to let go of
Root Family √hā
Root √hā･1 a (abandon)
Base √hā + hā + a > jaha
Construction dur + jaha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change h > j
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + jaha)
Sanskrit dur + jaha
Sanskrit Root √hā 3 (leave)

kiṃsu bandhati pātheyyaṃ,
kiṃsu bhogānam'āsayo,
kiṃsu naraṃ parikassati,
kiṃsu lokasmi dujjahaṃ,
kismiṃ baddhā puthū sattā,
pāsena sakuṇī yathā'ti.

SN 1.79 pātheyyasuttaṃ

saddhā bandhati pātheyyaṃ,
sirī bhogānam'āsayo,
icchā naraṃ parikassati,
icchā lokasmi dujjahā,
icchābaddhā puthū sattā,
pāsena sakuṇī yathā'ti.

SN 1.79 pātheyyasuttaṃ
dujjāta

adj. of ignoble birth; ignoble ✗
dujjāna

adj. (+instr or +gen) hard to know (for); not easy to know (for); difficult to understand (for) [√ñā + nā + a] ✓

Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction dur + jānā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + jāna)
Sanskrit durjñāna
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

dujjānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, bhante, bhagavato vā jīvit'antarāyānaṃ, mayhaṃ vā jīvit'antarāyānaṃ. desetu me, bhante bhagavā, dhammaṃ, desetu, sugato, dhammaṃ, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatr'āyogena aññatr'ācariyakena, saññā purisassa attā'ti vā, aññā'va saññā añño attā'ti vā'ti.

atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,
vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti,
tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

kacchapo, yadi maṃ sahāyakā nenti, tumhākaṃ ettha kiṃ hoti, duṭṭhaceṭakā'ti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
duṭṭhulla 1

nt. heaviness; discomfort; inertia; lit. bad heavy [dur + √thūl + a] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from thūla
Meaning heaviness; discomfort; inertia; lit. bad heavy
Root Family √thūl
Root √thūl×8 *e (be fat, coarse)
Construction dur + √thūl > thull + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change rth > ṭṭh
ūl > ull
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + thulla)
Sanskrit duṣṭhula (bsk), dauṣṭhulya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sthūl 10 (be stout)

idh'ānanda bhikkhu upadhivivekā akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānā sabbaso kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyā vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ
duṭṭhulla 2

adj. (of speech) rude; obscene; vulgar; coarse [dur + √thūl + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from thūla
Meaning (of speech) rude; obscene; vulgar; coarse
Root Family √thūl
Root √thūl×8 *e (be fat, coarse)
Construction dur + √thūl > thull + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change rth > ṭṭh
ūl > ull
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + thulla)
Antonym aduṭṭhulla
Commentary (VIN 1.2.3) duṭṭhullā nāma vācā vaccamagga-passāvamagga-methunadhammappaṭisaṃyuttā vācā. (VINa) duṭṭhullan'ti duṭṭhuñ'ca kilesehi duṭṭhattā, thūlañ'ca anipuṇabhāvato'ti duṭṭhullaṃ.
Sanskrit duṣṭhula (bsk), dauṣṭhulya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sthūl 10 (be stout)

yo pana bhikkhu otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāseyya yathā taṃ yuvā yuvatiṃ methun'upasaṃhitāhi, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ

methunadhammo nāma yo so asaddhammo gāmadhammo vasaladhammo duṭṭhullaṃ odak'antikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, eso methunadhammo nāma.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
duṭṭhulla 3

adj. (of offence) serious; heavy; bad; corrupt [dur + √thūl + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from thūla
Meaning (of offence) serious; heavy; bad; corrupt
Root Family √thūl
Root √thūl×8 *e (be fat, coarse)
Construction dur + √thūl > thull + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change rth > ṭṭh
ūl > ull
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + thulla)
Antonym aduṭṭhulla
Commentary (VIN 2.5.1.9) duṭṭhullā nāma āpatti, cattāri ca pārājikāni, terasa ca saṅghādisesā.
Sanskrit duṣṭhula (bsk), dauṣṭhulya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √sthūl 10 (be stout)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa āroceyya aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 9 duṭṭhullārocanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

mātugāmo nāma manuss'itthī, na yakkhī, na petī, na tiracchānagatā. viññū paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhull'āduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.

VIN 1.2.3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ

aññatra viññunā purisaviggahenā'ti ṭhapetvā viññuṃ purisaviggahaṃ. viññū nāma purisaviggaho, paṭibalo hoti subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhull'āduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.

Construction duṭṭhulla + ārocanā + sikkhāpada
dutiya 1

ordin. second (2nd) [dvi + tiya] ✓

Grammar ordin of dvi
Meaning second (2nd)
Construction dvi > du + tiya
Derivative taddhita (tiya)
Phonetic Change dvi > du
dutīya with metrically lengthened ī
Antonym adutiya
Sanskrit dvitīya

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

ekañ'hi saccaṃ na dutīyam'atthi,
yasmiṃ pajā no vivade pajānaṃ,
nānā te saccāni sayaṃ thunanti,
tasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
dutiya 2

adj. as a companion; as a partner; lit. second person [dvi + tiya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dvi
Meaning as a companion; as a partner; lit. second person
Construction dvi > du + tiya
Derivative taddhita (tiya)
Phonetic Change dvi > du
Commentary (SNa) saddhā dutiyā purisassa hotī'ti purisassa devaloke manussaloke c'eva nibbānañ'ca gacchantassa saddhā dutiyā hoti, sahāyakiccaṃ sādheti.
Sanskrit dvitīya

taṇhādutiyo puriso,
dīgham'addhāna saṃsaraṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

saddhā dutiyā purisassa hoti,
no ce assaddhiyaṃ avatiṭṭhati,
yaso ca kittī ca tatv'assa hoti,
saggañ'ca so gacchati sarīraṃ vihāyā'ti.

SN 1.36 saddhāsuttaṃ
dutiya 3

masc. (gram) second consonant of each vagga; kh, ch, ṭh, th, ph; lit. second [dvi + tiya] ✓

Grammar masc, from dvi
Meaning (gram) second consonant of each vagga; kh, ch, ṭh, th, ph; lit. second
Construction dvi > du + tiya
Derivative taddhita (tiya)
Phonetic Change dvi > du
Sanskrit dvitīya

461, 464. dutiyacatutthānaṃ paṭhamatatiyā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 461

abbhāsagatānaṃ dutiyacatutthānaṃ paṭhamatatiyā honti. ciccheda, bubhukkhati, babhūva, dadhāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 461
dutiyaakkhantisutta

dutiyakaṃ

ind. second time; another time [dutiya + ka + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of dutiyaka
Meaning second time; another time
Construction dutiya + ka + aṃ
dutiyaka + aṃ
Sanskrit dvitīyaka

te maṃ catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ upādāy'upādāya pañhaṃ puccheyyuṃ, puṭṭho puṭṭho c'āhaṃ tesaṃ byākareyyaṃ, byākatañ'ca me byākatato dhāreyyuṃ, na ca maṃ dutiyakaṃ uttari paṭipuccheyyuṃ.

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.56 (SN1.56) ✗
dutiyajjhāna

nt. second stage of meditation [dutiya + jhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning second stage of meditation
Construction dutiya + jhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (dutiya + jhāna)
Sanskrit dvitīya + dhyāna

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi dutiyajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū dutiyajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya dutiyajjhānasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji, paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajji.

dutiyampi

sandhi. for the second time [dutiyaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning for the second time
Construction dutiyaṃ + api
Sanskrit dvitīyam + api

dutiyam'pi kho bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi.

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? dutiyam'pi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
dutiyayodhājīvasutta

dutiyaṃ

ind. second time [dvi + tiya + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of dutiya
Meaning second time
Construction dvi > du + tiya + aṃ
Sanskrit dvitīyam

dutiyam'pi kho bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi.

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
dutiyā 1

fem. second woman; another woman [dvi + tiya + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from dvi
Meaning second woman; another woman
Construction dvi > du + tiya + ā
dutiya + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Phonetic Change dvi > du
Sanskrit dvitīyā

supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.

dutiyānupassanā

fem. second observation; second contemplation [dutiya + anupassanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning second observation; second contemplation
Construction dutiya + anupassanā
Compound kammadhāraya (dutiya + anupassanā)
Antonym ekānupassanā
Sanskrit dvitīya + anudarśana

idaṃ dukkhaṃ, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti ayam'ek'ānupassanā. ayaṃ dukkhanirodho, ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti, ayaṃ dutiy'ānupassanā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ upadhipaccayā'ti, ayam'ek'ānupassanā. upadhīnaṃ tv'eva asesavirāganirodhā n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo'ti, ayaṃ dutiy'ānupassanā.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ
duttitikkha

adj. hard to endure; difficult to tolerate; hard to last [√tij + kha + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from titikkha, desid
Meaning hard to endure; difficult to tolerate; hard to last
Root Family √tij
Root √tij･1 kha (endure)
Base √tij + tij + sa > titikkha (desid)
Construction dur + titikkha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change r > t
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + titikkha)
Commentary (SNa) duttitikkhan'ti dukkhamaṃ duadhivāsiyaṃ.
Sanskrit dur + titikṣā
Sanskrit Root √tij 1 (be sharp)

dukkaraṃ duttitikkhañ'ca,
abyattena ca sāmaññaṃ,
bahūhi tattha sambādhā,
yattha bālo visīdatī'ti.

asanto n'ānukubbanti,
sataṃ dhammo duranvayo.

Sanskrit durdṛśa
Sanskrit Root √dṛś 1 (see)

duddasaṃ anataṃ nāma,
na hi saccaṃ sudassanaṃ,
paṭividdhā taṇhā jānato,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

UD 72 dutiyanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

sudassaṃ vajjam'aññesaṃ,
attano pana duddasaṃ,
paresaṃ hi so vajjāni,
opunāti yathā bhusaṃ,
attano pana chādeti,
kaliṃ'va kitavā saṭho.

DHP 35 cittavaggo

st > tth

Sanskrit dunivasita
Sanskrit Root √vas 2, 6 (clothe)

so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ

so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti. so rāg'ānuddhaṃsitena cittena sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati.

a > ā

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo

dhanapālo nāma kuñjaro,
kaṭukabhedano dunnivārayo,
baddho kabaḷaṃ na bhuñjati,
sumarati nāgavanassa kuñjaro.

duppañña 1

adj. foolish; stupid; unintelligent; lit. bad understanding [dur + pa + √ñā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from pañña
Meaning foolish; stupid; unintelligent; lit. bad understanding
Root Family pa √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction dur + pa + √ñā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change r > p
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + pañña)
Antonym sumedha, paññavant, paññāsampanna
Synonym dummedha, dummedhī, duppaññajātika
Commentary (MNa) duppaññā'ti nippaññānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. paññā pana duṭṭhā nāma n'atthi.
Sanskrit duṣprajña
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
duppañño asamāhito,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
paññavantassa jhāyino.

paññavato ayaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo duppaññassā'ti

DHP 140 daṇḍavaggo

duppañño duppañño'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, duppañño'ti vuccatī'ti? nappajānāti nappajānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā duppañño'ti vuccati.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
duppaññaeḷamūgasandosahetu

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of being devoid of wisdom and a drooling idiot
Construction duppañña + eḷamūga + sandosahetu
Sanskrit duṣprajña + eḍamūka + saṃdosa + hetu

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā duppaññā eḷamūgā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, duppaññaeḷamūgasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

Commentary (MNa) duppaññajātiko'ti nippaññasabhāvo dandho mahājaḷo.

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, māgadhako gopālako duppaññajātiko, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye, asamavekkhitvā gaṅgāya nadiyā orimaṃ tīraṃ, asamavekkhitvā pārimaṃ tīraṃ, atitthen'eva gāvo patāresi uttaraṃ tīraṃ suvidehānaṃ.

duppaṭinissaggī

adj. giving up with difficulty; not relinquishing quickly; not abandoning easily [dur + pati + nī + √sajj + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from paṭinissaggī
Meaning giving up with difficulty; not relinquishing quickly; not abandoning easily
Root Family pati nī √sajj

√ In Comps ssajj
Construction dur + pati + nī + √sajj > sagg + ī

Phonetic Change r > p
īs > iss
jj > gg
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + paṭinissaggī)
Antonym suppaṭinissaggī
Commentary (MNa) yuttakāraṇaṃ disvāva laddhiṃ paṭinissajjantīti paṭinissaggī, dukkhena kicchena kasirena bahum'pi kāraṇaṃ dassetvā na sakkā paṭinissaggaṃ kātun'ti duppaṭinissaggī
Sanskrit dus + pratiniḥsṛj
Sanskrit Root √sṛj 6 (send forth)

att'ukkaṃsakaparavambhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, sandiṭṭhiparāmāsā ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggino, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, kuhakā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpicchā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, pāpamittā, bhikkhave, nigaṇṭhā, imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi asaddhammehi samannāgatā nigaṇṭhā'ti.

AN 10.78 nigaṇṭhasuttaṃ

pare sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
duppaṭimantiya

adj. hard to answer or refute; hard to argue with ✗
duppaṭivijjha

adj. hard to penetrate; difficult to break through; (comm) difficult to see for oneself [dur + pati + √vidh + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from paṭivijjha
Meaning hard to penetrate; difficult to break through; (comm) difficult to see for oneself
Root Family pati √vidh
Root √vidh･3 ya (throw, pierce)
Construction dur + pati + √vidh + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change r > p
dhy > jjh
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + paṭivijjha)
Commentary (DNa) duppaṭivijjho'ti duppaccakkhakaro.
Sanskrit dus + pratividhya (having shot)
Sanskrit Root √vyadh 4 (pierce)

eko, āvuso, dhammo bahukāro, eko dhammo bhāvetabbo, eko dhammo pariññeyyo, eko dhammo pahātabbo, eko dhammo hānabhāgiyo, eko dhammo visesabhāgiyo, eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho, eko dhammo uppādetabbo, eko dhammo abhiññeyyo, eko dhammo sacchikātabbo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ

katamo eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho? ānantariko cetosamādhi. ayaṃ eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ

duppadhaṃsiya

adj. (+instr) difficult (for) to defeat; hard (for) to overcome; lit. hard to be overcome [dur + pa + √dhaṃs + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from padhaṃsiya (+instr)
Meaning difficult (for) to defeat; hard (for) to overcome; lit. hard to be overcome
Root Family pa √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Construction dur + pa + √dhaṃs + iya
Derivative kicca (iya)
Phonetic Change r > p
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + padhaṃsiya)
Antonym suppadhaṃsiya
Commentary (ANa) duppadhaṃsiyo'ti dummocāpayo, gahitaggahaṇaṃ vissajjāpetuṃ na sakkā'ti attho.
Sanskrit durpradhvaṃsya
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

durāsado duppasaho,
gambhīro duppadhaṃsiyo,
atho atthe anatthe ca,
ubhayassa hoti kovido.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni app'itthikāni bahupurisāni tāni duppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi

SN 20.3 kulasuttaṃ
duppabbajja

adj. difficult to ordain; hard to renounce [dur + pa + √vaj + yā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from pabbajjā
Meaning difficult to ordain; hard to renounce
Root Family pa √vaj
Root √vaj･1 a (go on)
√ In Comps vaj or vvaj
Construction dur + pa + √vaj > baj + yā + a
dur + pabbajjā + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change r > p
v > b
y > j
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + pabbajja)
Sanskrit dur + pravrajya
Sanskrit Root √vraj 1 (proceed)

duppabbajjaṃ durabhiramaṃ,
durāvāsā gharā dukhā,
dukkhosamānasaṃvāso,
dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū,
tasmā na c'addhagū siyā,
na ca dukkh'ānupatito siyā.

DHP 302 pakiṇṇakavaggo

Construction dur + pa + muñca + a

Phonetic Change r > p

Sanskrit dur + pramuñca (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

etaṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā,
ohārinaṃ sithilaṃ duppamuñcaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna paribbajanti,
anapekkhino kāmasukhaṃ pahāya.

DHP 346 taṇhāvaggo

icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā,
te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure v'āpi apekkhamānā,
ime'va kāme purime'va jappaṃ.

a > u
v > r

Sanskrit dur + apāvṛta

so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti. so rāg'ānuddhaṃsitena cittena sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati.

so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti.

bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti

bhikkhū pan'eva dubbacajātiko hotī'ti dubbaco hoti dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato akkhamo appadakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ.

Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)
dubbaṇṇiyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 11.22 (SN11.22) ✗
dubbala 1

adj. frail; weak; feeble [dur + √bal + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from bala
Meaning frail; weak; feeble
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction dur + √bal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + bala)
Antonym balavant, thira
Sanskrit durbala
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.

DHP 7 yamakavaggo

yo have balavā santo,
dubbalassa titikkhati,
tam'āhu paramaṃ khantiṃ,
niccaṃ khamati dubbalo.

SN 11.4 vepacittisuttaṃ
dubbala 2

nt. weak one; frail one [dur + √bal + a] ~

Grammar nt, from bala
Meaning weak one; frail one
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction dur + √bal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + bala)
Antonym balavant, thira
Sanskrit durbala
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)
dubbalaka

adj. (one) who is week, of little strength [√bal] ✗
dubbalakaraṇa

adj. making one weak; causing frailty [dubbala + karaṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning making one weak; causing frailty
Construction dubbala + karaṇa
dubbalakhādikā

fem. eating the weak [dubbala + khādikā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning eating the weak
Construction dubbala + khādikā
dubbalacīvara 1

adj. who has threadbare robes; lit. weak cloth [dubbala + cīvara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has threadbare robes; lit. weak cloth
Construction dubbala + cīvara
dubbalacīvara 2

nt. little expectation of robes; weak possibility of robes; lit. weak cloth [dubbala + cīvara] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning little expectation of robes; weak possibility of robes; lit. weak cloth
Construction dubbala + cīvara
Commentary (VIN 4.3.9) dubbalacīvarapaccāsā nāma sace mayaṃ sakkoma, dassāma karissāmā'ti vācā bhinnā hoti. (VINa) dubbalacīvarapaccāsāyā'ti dubbalāya cīvarapaccāsāya.
dubbalacīvarapaccāsā

fem. weak possibility of (receiving) robes [dubbala + cīvarapaccāsā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning weak possibility of (receiving) robes
Construction dubbala + cīvarapaccāsā
Commentary (KVa) dubbalacīvarapaccāsāyā'ti dubbalāya cīvarapaccāsāya, sace sakkoma dassāmā'ti ettakamattaṃ sutvā uppāditāya āsāyā'ti attho.
dubbalacīvarasañña

adj. (+loc) perceiving there to be a low (expectation of) robes; regarding there to be a weak (possibility of) robes [dubbalacīvara + sañña] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving there to be a low (expectation of) robes; regarding there to be a weak (possibility of) robes
Construction dubbalacīvara + sañña
dubbalatara

adj. weaker [dur + √bal + a + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of dubbala
Meaning weaker
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction dur + √bal + a + tara
dubbala + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Sanskrit durbala + tara
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dve balavanto purisā dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ nānābāhāsu gahetvā aṅgārakāsuyā santāpeyyuṃ samparitāpeyyuṃ, evam'eva kho, āvuso, adhimatto kāyasmiṃ ḍāho.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, balavā puriso dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ sīse vā gale vā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
dubbalasikkhāpada

nt. rule about a worn out (robe); Pācittiya 81 [dubbala + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about a worn out (robe); Pācittiya 81
Construction dubbala + sikkhāpada
dubbalikaraṇa

adj. weakening (of); withering (of); decreasing (of); lit. making weak [dubbala + karaṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning weakening (of); withering (of); decreasing (of); lit. making weak
Construction dubbala > dubbali + karaṇa
Phonetic Change a > i before √bhū
dubbalīkaraṇa

adj. (+gen) which weaken; lit. weak making [dubbala + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+gen)
Meaning which weaken; lit. weak making
Construction dubbala > dubbalī + karaṇa
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dubbalaṃ + karaṇa)
Commentary (ANa) dubbalīkaraṇe'ti yasmā ime pañca nīvaraṇā uppajjamānā anuppannāya lokiyalokuttarāya paññāya uppajjituṃ na denti, uppannā'pi aṭṭha samāpattiyo pañca vā abhiññā ucchinditvā pātenti. tasmā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit durbalī + karaṇa

so ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe kāye ... vedanāsu ... citte ... dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ

samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
dubbalya

nt. weakness; lack of strength; feebleness; incapability; lit. weak state [dur + √bal + a + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from dubbala
Meaning weakness; lack of strength; feebleness; incapability; lit. weak state
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction dur + √bal + a + ya
dubbala + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + balya)
Variant dubballa
Sanskrit daurbalya
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 1 methunadhammasikkhāpadaṃ

evaṃ vutte āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso jighacchādubbalyapareto madhupiṇḍikaṃ adhigaccheyya, so yato yato sāyeyya, labheth'eva sādurasaṃ asecanakaṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
dubbalyāvikamma

nt. disclosure of weakness; revealing one’s incapability [dubbalya + āvikamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning disclosure of weakness; revealing one’s incapability
Construction dubbalya + āvikamma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dubbalyaṃ + āvikamma)
Sanskrit daurbalya + āviṣkaraṇa

sikkhaṃ apaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā'ti, atthi, bhikkhave, dubbaly'āvikammañ'c'eva hoti sikkhā ca apaccakkhātā, atthi, bhikkhave, dubbaly'āvikammañ'c'eva hoti sikkhā ca paccakkhātā.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
dubbā

dubbijāna

adj. hard to comprehend; difficult to understand [vi + √ñā + nā + a] ✓

Meaning hard to comprehend; difficult to understand
Root Family vi √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction dur + vi > dubbi + jānā + a

Phonetic Change r > b
v > b
ñ > j
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + vijāna)
Sanskrit durvijñāna
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

gambhīraṃ bhāsasī vācaṃ,
dubbijānaṃ sudubbudhaṃ,
kassa tvaṃ dhammam'aññāya,
vācaṃ bhāsasi īdisan'ti.

dubbhaṭṭhe n'āpasādaye.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
dubbhati

pr. (+acc) cheats; deceives; plots against; betrays [√dubbh + a + ti] ✓

Base √dubbh + a > dubbha
Construction dubbha + ti
Sanskrit dabhāti
Sanskrit Root √druh √dambh √dabh 1, 5 (be hostile)

nanu dubbhissasi maṃ punappunaṃ,
muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃ'va dassayaṃ,
ummattaken'eva mayā palobhasi,
kiñ'c'āpi te citta virādhitaṃ mayā.

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
dubbhāsita 1

adj. badly spoken; incorrectly said [dur + √bhās + ita] ✓

Grammar adj, from bhāsita
Meaning badly spoken; incorrectly said
Root Family √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (speak)
Construction dur + √bhās + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + bhāsita)
Antonym subhāsita
Commentary (ANa) dubbhāsitan'ti dukkathitaṃ.
Sanskrit durbhāṣita
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnaṃ. katamehi pañcahi?

AN 5.198 vācāsuttaṃ

sā kho pan'esā, mahānāma, brahmunā sanaṅkumārena gāthā sugītā no duggītā, subhāsitā no dubbhāsitā, atthasaṃhitā no anatthasaṃhitā, anumatā bhagavatā'ti.

Sanskrit durbhāṣita
Sanskrit Root √bhāṣ 1 (speak)

dubbhāsitaṃ vikkhalitaṃ,
sampamohaṃ parājayaṃ,
añño'ññass'ābhinandanti,
tadariyo katha'n'ācare.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

ime ce'pi, mahānāma, mahāsālā subhāsitaṃ dubbhāsitaṃ ājāneyyuṃ, ime c'āhaṃ mahāsāle byākareyyaṃ, sot'āpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā'ti, kim'aṅgaṃ pana saraṇāniṃ sakkaṃ

dubbhikkhā + a

Compound kammadhāraya (dur + bhikkha)
Antonym subhikkha
Sanskrit durbhikṣa
Sanskrit Root √bhikṣ 1 (beg)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ

āgantukassa dānaṃ deti, gamikassa dānaṃ deti, gilānassa dānaṃ deti, dubbhikkhe dānaṃ deti, yāni tāni navasassāni navaphalāni tāni paṭhamaṃ sīlavantesu patiṭṭhāpeti.

dubhaya

adj. both; both kinds [[d] + ubha + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ubha
Meaning both; both kinds
Construction [d] + ubha + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change +d
Sanskrit ubhaya

kappāni viceyya kevalāni,
saṃsāraṃ dubhayaṃ cut'ūpapātaṃ,
vigatarajam'anaṅgaṇaṃ visuddhaṃ,
pattaṃ jātikhayaṃ tam'āhu buddhan'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

saddañ'ca sutvā dubhayaṃ piy'āppiyaṃ,
piyamhi sadde na samucchito siyā,
atho'ppiye dosagataṃ vinodaye,
na c'āppiyaṃ me'ti manaṃ padosaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
duma

masc. tree ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tree
Synonym mahiruha, pādapa, rukkha, taru, viṭapī
Commentary (THIa) dumā'ti ... rukkhā
Sanskrit druma

upasanto uparato,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
dhunāti pāpake dhamme,
dumapattaṃ'va māluto'ti.

TH 2 mahākoṭṭhikattheragāthā

madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.

Commentary (ANa) na dummano'ti aniṭṭh'ārammaṇe paṭighavasena na domanassajāto hoti.
Sanskrit durmanas
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

atha kho māro pāpimā, jānāti maṃ uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī'ti dukkhī dummano tatth'ev'antaradhāyī'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ

evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa kho, vappa, bhikkhuno cha satatavihārā adhigatā honti. so cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā n'eva sumano hoti na dummano, upekkhako viharati sato sampajāno.

dummantita

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

Sanskrit dus + medhā
Sanskrit Root medhā - (wisdom)

caranti bālā dummedhā,
amitten'eva attanā,
karontā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
yaṃ hoti kaṭukapphalaṃ.

DHP 66 bālavaggo
dummedha 2

masc. fool; idiot [dur + √medh + ā + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from medhā
Meaning fool; idiot
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (be wise)
Construction dur + √medh + ā + a
dummedhā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change r > m
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + medha)
Synonym manda
Sanskrit dus + medhā
Sanskrit Root medhā - (wisdom)

atha pāpāni kammāni,
karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

DHP 136 daṇḍavaggo

dummedhehi pasaṃsā ca,
viññūhi garahā ca yā,
garahāva seyyo viññūhi,
yaṃ ce bālappasaṃsanā.

TH 245 godattattheragāthā
dummedhī

pamādam'anuyuñjanti,
bālā dummedhino janā,
appamādañ'ca medhāvī,
dhanaṃ seṭṭhaṃ'va rakkhati.

DHP 26 appamādavaggo

ubhayassa hoti kovido.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ

Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction dur + √rakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change dur > du
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + rakkha)
Synonym durakkhiya
Variant dūrakkha
Commentary (DHPa) dūrakkhan'ti kiṭṭhasambādhe ṭhāne kiṭṭhakhādakagoṇaṃ viya ek'ekasmiṃ sappāyārammaṇeyeva duṭṭhapanato dūrakkhaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
durakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

evarūpe kho, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo satthari pataṃ kissa hetu? evañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti yathā taṃ durakkhāte dhammavinaye duppavedite aniyyānike anupasamasaṃvattanike asammāsambuddhappavedite.

duraccaya

Meaning difficult to escape; hard to cross; hard to overcome; difficult to get past

Root √i･1 a (come, go)

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ti > ty > cc
i > ay
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + accaya)
Sanskrit duratyaya (inaccessible)
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

yo c'etaṃ sahate jammiṃ,
taṇhaṃ loke duraccayaṃ,
sokā tamhā papatanti,
udabindu'va pokkharā.

DHP 336 taṇhāvaggo

yo'dha kāme accatari,
saṅgaṃ loke duraccayaṃ,
na so socati n'ājjheti,
chinnasoto abandhano.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

Root Family anu √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction dur + anu > ann + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change anu > ann
i > ay
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + annaya)
Variant duranvaya
Commentary (DHPa) gati tesaṃ durannayā'ti ... gati durannayā na sakkā jānituṃ … gamanassa apaññāyanato gati durannayā na sakkā paññāpetun'ti.
Sanskrit duranvaya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

yesaṃ sannicayo n'atthi,
ye pariññātabhojanā,
suññato animitto ca,
vimokkho yesaṃ gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ,
gati tesaṃ durannayā.

DHP 92 arahantavaggo

yass'āsavā parikkhīṇā,
āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca,
vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ,
padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.

so, duggataṃ durūpetan'ti pāḷiyā na sameti, tasmā vuttanayen'ev'ettha bhāvanam'ārabhitvā sīmāsambhedaṃ katvā appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

bht > ddh

Antonym suladdhaṃ
Sanskrit durlabha
Sanskrit Root √labh 1 (take)

tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamānena na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī'ti, idaṃ tasmiṃ mohanake pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā, dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ, yassa me anabhirati uppannā

SN 8.1 nikkhantasuttaṃ
dullabha 1

Meaning difficult to find (for); hard to obtain (for); rare (for)
Root Family √labh
Root √labh･1 a (get)
Construction dur + √labh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change r > l
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + labha)
Sanskrit durlabha
Sanskrit Root √labh 1 (take)

saṃkhittena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, vitthārena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, saṃkhittavitthārena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, aññātāro ca dullabhā'ti.

AN 3.33 sāriputtasuttaṃ

attā hi attano nātho,
ko hi nātho paro siyā,
attanā hi sudantena,
nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ.

DHP 160 attavaggo

Sanskrit Root √labh 1 (take)

dullabhaṃ v'āpi labhanti,
cittavūpasame ratā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
bhāvanāya rato mano'ti.

SN 2.6 kāmadasuttaṃ
dullabhatara

adj. more difficult to obtain; very rare ✗
dullabhapiṇḍa

adj. difficult to get alms-food [dur + labha + piṇḍa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning difficult to get alms-food
Construction dur + labha + piṇḍa
Compound kammadhāraya (dullabha + piṇḍa)
Sanskrit durlabha + piṇḍa

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ
dullabhasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.115 (AN3.115) ✗
duvagga 1

adj. consisting of a group of two ✗
duvagga 2

masc. group of two ✗
duvassa

adj. of two years' standing; who has been ordained for two years ✗
duvijātavaṇṇasata

nt. appearance of one hundred women who have given birth to two children [duvijāta + vaṇṇa + sata] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning appearance of one hundred women who have given birth to two children
Construction duvijāta + vaṇṇa + sata
duviññāpaya

adj. difficult to be taught; hardly instructible; not educatable [vi + √ñā + *āpaya + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from viññāpaya, caus
Meaning difficult to be taught; hardly instructible; not educatable
Root Family vi √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpaya (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpaya > ñāpaya (caus)
Construction dur + vi + ñāpaya + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + viññāpaya)
Antonym suviññāpaya
Sanskrit su + vijñāpanīya, vijñāpya
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, buddhacakkhunā lokaṃ volokento satte apparaj'akkhe mahāraj'akkhe, tikkh'indriye mud'indriye, svākāre dvākāre, suviññāpaye duviññāpaye, app'ekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, app'ekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
duvidha

adj. two-fold; of two kinds [dvi + vidha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning two-fold; of two kinds
Construction dvi > du + vidha
Phonetic Change dvi > du
Compound kammadhāraya (dvi + vidha)
Commentary (ANa) duvidhenā'ti dvividhena, dvīhi koṭṭhāsehī'ti attho.
Sanskrit dvidha

cīvaram'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, duvidhena vadāmi, sevitabbam'pi asevitabbam'pi. piṇḍapātam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, duvidhena vadāmi, sevitabbam'pi asevitabbam'pi.

AN 10.54 samathasuttaṃ
duvidhena

ind. in two ways; as of two kinds; in a twofold way ✗
duvūpasamaya

adj. difficult to calm; hard to settle; hard to still [vi + upa + √sam + *aya + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from vūpasamaya, caus
Meaning difficult to calm; hard to settle; hard to still
Root Family vi upa √sam
Root √sam･3 *aya (be calm, tired)
Base √sam + aya > samaya (caus)
Construction dur + vi + upa + samaya + a
Derivative kita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + vūpasamaya)
Sanskrit dur + vyupaśam
Sanskrit Root √śam 4 (be quiet)

taṃ kissa hetu? uddhataṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi duvūpasamayaṃ hoti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
duve

card. two (2) ✓

Grammar card, x pl
Meaning two (2)
Synonym dve, dvi
Notes see SCPN §3
Sanskrit dvi

yathā brahmā tathā eko,
yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

TH 178 yasojattheragāthā

appañ'hi etaṃ na alaṃ samāya,
duve vivādassa phalāni brūmi,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
khem'ābhipassaṃ avivādabhūmiṃ.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13
dusanīya

ptp. hateful; detestable; loathsome; lit. to be disliked [√dus + anīya] ~

Grammar ptp of dussati
Meaning hateful; detestable; loathsome; lit. to be disliked
Root Family √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (hate, dislike)
Construction √dus + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Phonetic Change y > s
Variant dussanīya
Commentary (APAa) dussanīye ca dussase'ti dūsitabbe dosakaraṇavatthusmiṃ dūsako asi.
Sanskrit dveṣaṇīya
Sanskrit Root √dviṣ 2, 6 (hate)
dussa

nt. cloth; clothes; garments ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning cloth; clothes; garments
Sanskrit dūrśa, dūṣya

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rajako vā cittakārako vā rajanāya vā lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabb'aṅgapacc'aṅgiṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nānārattānaṃ dussānaṃ dussakaraṇḍako pūro

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nānārattānaṃ dussānaṃ dussakaraṇḍako pūro

seyyathā'pi, āvuso moggallāna, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā nānārattānaṃ dussānaṃ dussakaraṇḍako pūro assa.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
dussati 1.1

pr. (+loc) hates; detests; loathes; opposes [√dus + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning hates; detests; loathes; opposes
Root Family √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (hate, dislike)
Base √dus + ya > dussa
Construction dussa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Sanskrit dveṣṭi
Sanskrit Root √dviṣ 2, 6 (hate)

cakk'ānuvattako thero,
mahāñāṇī samāhito,
pathav'āp'aggisamāno,
na rajjati na dussati.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

rajanīye rajjati, dussanīye dussati, mohanīye muyhati, kuppanīye kuppati, madanīye majjati.

AN 5.81 rajanīyasuttaṃ

Construction dussa + ti
Phonetic Change y > s
Synonym padussati
Sanskrit duṣyati
Sanskrit Root √duṣ 4 (spoil)

sehi dārehi asantuṭṭho,
vesiyāsu padussati,
dussati paradāresu,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

Construction dussa + ti

Sanskrit duṣyati
Sanskrit Root √duṣ 4 (spoil)

yo appaduṭṭhassa narassa dussati,
suddhassa posassa anaṅgaṇassa,
tam'eva bālaṃ pacceti pāpaṃ,
sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ'va khitto.

DHP 125 pāpavaggo

yo daṇḍena adaṇḍesu,
appaduṭṭhesu dussati,
dasannam'aññataraṃ ṭhānaṃ,
khippam'eva nigacchati.

na pallatthikāya nisinnassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthapallatthikāya vā dussapallatthikāya vā nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

evam'ass'āyaṃ apaṇṇako dhammo dussamatto samādinno, ek'aṃsaṃ pharitvā tiṭṭhati, riñcati kusalaṃ ṭhānaṃ.

dūta 1

Sanskrit dūta
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggo vā brāhmaṇo vā gahapatiko vā dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇeyya, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādehī'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ

ambho purisa na tvaṃ addasa manussesu tatiyaṃ devadūtaṃ pātubhūtan'ti? so evam'āha nāddasaṃ bhante'ti

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ
dūta 2

masc. missionary; emissary [√dū] ✗

masc. messenger ✗

Meaning series of messengers; succession of couriers

dūtayuga

nt. pair of messengers; team of runners [dūta + yuga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pair of messengers; team of runners
Construction dūta + yuga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dūtānaṃ + yuga)
Sanskrit dūta + yuga

puratthimāya disāya āgantvā sīghaṃ dūtayugaṃ taṃ dovārikaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, kahaṃ, bho purisa, imassa nagarassa nagarassāmī'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, eso, bhante, majjhe siṅghāṭake nisinno'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
dūteyya

nt. taking messages; running errands [√dū + ta + eyya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from dūta
Meaning taking messages; running errands
Root Family √dū
Root √dū×1 a (go, run)
Construction √dū + ta + eyya
dūta + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Commentary (MNa) dūteyyaṃ vuccati dūtakammaṃ, gihīnaṃ paṇṇaṃ vā sāsanaṃ vā gahetvā tattha tattha gamanaṃ.
Sanskrit dautya
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

khettavatthupaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti dūteyyapahiṇagaman'ānuyogā paṭivirato hoti kayavikkayā paṭivirato hoti

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
dūteyyapahiṇagamanānuyoga

masc. practice of taking messages and going on errands [dūteyya + pahiṇa + gamana + anuyoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning practice of taking messages and going on errands
Construction dūteyya + pahiṇa + gamana + anuyoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dūteyyapahiṇagamanānaṃ + anuyoga)
Commentary (MNa) dūteyyaṃ vuccati dūtakammaṃ, gihīnaṃ paṇṇaṃ vā sāsanaṃ vā gahetvā tattha tattha gamanaṃ. pahiṇagamanaṃ vuccati gharā gharaṃ pesitassa khuddakagamanaṃ. anuyogo nāma tadubhayakaraṇaṃ, tasmā dūteyyapahiṇagamanānaṃ anuyogā'ti evam'ettha attho veditabbo.
Sanskrit dautya + prahitaṃgama + anuyoga

dūteyyapahiṇagaman'ānuyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, kayavikkayā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, tulākūṭakaṃsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭivirato ahosiṃ

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

ye hi keci, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā dūteyyapahiṇagamanānuyogāya micchājīvena jīvikaṃ kappenti, ime vuccanti, bhagini, samaṇabrāhmaṇā disāmukhā bhuñjantī'ti.

SN 28.10 sūcimukhīsuttaṃ
dūteyyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.93 (SN56.93) ✗
dūteyyasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.16 (AN8.16) ✗
dūpaṭṭhāka

adj. difficult to attend or nurse ✗
dūpadhārita

adj. misconceived; misunderstood [upa + √dhar + *e + ita] ~

Grammar adj, from upadhārita
Meaning misconceived; misunderstood
Root Family upa √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Base √dhar + *e > dhāre
Construction dur + upa + dhāre + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + upadhārita)
Commentary (KVa) duggahitena dūpadhāritenā'ti yaṃ vuttaṃ, tato aññathā gahitena ca upadhāritena ca.
Sanskrit upadhrita
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)
dūra 1

adj. (+abl) far away (from); distant (from) [√dū + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, prep, from davati (+abl)
Meaning far away (from); distant (from)
Root Family √dū
Root √dū×1 a (go, run)
Construction √dū + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Antonym santika, āsanna
Sanskrit dūra
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ, dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā'ti, tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.

Sanskrit dūra
Sanskrit Root √du 1 (go)

yasmiṃ, bho gotama, samaye acci vātena khittā dūram'pi gacchati, imassa pana bhavaṃ gotamo kiṃ upādānasmiṃ paññāpetī'ti? yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye acci vātena khittā dūram'pi gacchati, tam'ahaṃ vāt'ūpādānaṃ paññāpemi.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
dūrakantana

nt. disinheritance; disownment; banishment; lit. distant cutting off [dūra + kantana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning disinheritance; disownment; banishment; lit. distant cutting off
Construction dūra + kantana
Compound kammadhāraya (dūra + kantana)
Commentary (THa) dūrakantanā'ti rāj'ādīhi mettaṃ katvā tesu dubbhitvā dubbhibhāvena.
Sanskrit dūra + kṛntana

n'āhaṃ alakkhyā ahirikkatāya vā,
na cittahetū na ca dūrakantanā,
ājīvahetū ca ahaṃ na nikkhamiṃ,
kato ca te citta paṭissavo mayā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo
dūragata

api dūragatā saramhase,
āyatapamhe visuddhadassane,
na hi m'atthi tayā piyattarā,
nayanā kinnarimandalocane.

asarīraṃ guh'āsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti,
mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, nadī pabbateyyā dūraṅ'gamā sīghasotā hārahārinī. tassā puriso ubhato naṅgalamukhāni vivareyya.

dūrato sotthim'āgataṃ,
ñātimittā suhajjā ca,
abhinandanti āgataṃ.

DHP 219 piyavaggo

addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna soṇḍipañcamāni aṅgāni sake kapāle samodahitvā app'ossukko tuṇhībhūto saṅkasāyati.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
dūratopi

sandhi. from far away; from afar [dūrato + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning from far away; from afar
Construction dūrato + api
Synonym dūratova
Sanskrit dūratas + api

mahantasmiṃ kho pana lokasannivāse santi samaṇabrāhmaṇā iddhimanto dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduno. te dūrato'pi passanti, āsannā'pi na dissanti, cetasā'pi cittaṃ pajānanti.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ

sabbasattā bhavantu sukhit'attā.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
dūrepātī

adj. who shoots long-ranges; who is able to shoot long distances [dūre + pātī] ✓

Meaning who shoots long-ranges; who is able to shoot long distances

Commentary (ANa) dūre kaṇḍe pātetī'ti dūrepātī
Sanskrit dūre + pātin

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇavedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, yodh'ājīvo ṭhānakusalo ca hoti, dūrepātī ca, akkhaṇavedhī ca, mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

AN 8.10 kāraṇḍavasuttaṃ
dūsesi 3

aor. defamed [√dus] ✗
dūsesi 4

aor. ill-treated [√dus] ✗
dūhara

adj. (+instr) hard to steal (for); hard to take (for) [dur + √har + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from hara (+instr)
Meaning hard to steal (for); hard to take (for)
Root Family √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction dur > dū + √har + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change dur > dū
Compound kammadhāraya (dur + hara)
Sanskrit dur + hara
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

kiṃsu yāva jarā sādhu,
kiṃsu sādhu patiṭṭhitaṃ,
kiṃsu narānaṃ ratanaṃ,
kiṃsu corehi dūharan'ti.

SN 1.51 jarāsuttaṃ

sīlaṃ yāva jarā sādhu,
saddhā sādhu patiṭṭhitā,
paññā narānaṃ ratanaṃ,
puññaṃ corehi dūharan'ti.

detar

masc. who gives ✗
deti 1

tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tatth'eva dānaṃ detha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānan'ti.

puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.

yo so yodh'ājīvo saṅgāme ussahati vāyamati, tam'enaṃ ussahantaṃ vāyamantaṃ pare hananti pariyāpādenti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā parajitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti.

sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.

yo so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ paṇidhāya brahmacariyaṃ carati, imin'āhaṃ sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devo vā bhavissāmi dev'aññataro vā'ti, tassa cittaṃ na namati ātappāya anuyogāya sātaccāya padhānāya.

kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,

yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ

uttam'aṅgaruhā mayhaṃ,
ime jātā vayoharā,
pātubhūtā devadūtā,
pabbajjāsamayo mamā'ti.

JA 9 maghadeva jātakaṃ
devadūta 2

nt. messenger of the gods; divine envoy [deva + dūta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning messenger of the gods; divine envoy
Construction deva + dūta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + dūta)
Notes normally masculine
Sanskrit devadūta
devadūtavagga

masc. Chapter 4 of Tikanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.31-40 ✗
devadūtasutta 1

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 130 (MN130) ✗
devadūtasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.36 (AN3.36) ✗
devadeva

masc. god of gods; lord of lords; king of kings [deva + deva] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning god of gods; lord of lords; king of kings
Construction deva + deva
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + deva)
Sanskrit devadeva

migaluddo pure āsiṃ,
araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ,
tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.

APA 523 tiṇamuṭṭhidāyaka therāpadānaṃ
devadhammika

adj. member of a particular sect (of ascetics ?) ✗
devadhītar

fem. young nymph ✗
devanikāya

masc. order of deities; class of devas [deva + nikāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning order of deities; class of devas
Construction deva + nikāya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + nikāya)
Sanskrit devanikāya

so muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati. tassa tattha sukhino dhammapadā plavanti. dandho, bhikkhave, sat'uppādo, atha so satto khippaṃ'y'eva visesagāmī hoti.

AN 4.191 sotānugatasuttaṃ

katamo ca, bhikkhu, amanussaggāho? idha, bhikkhu, ekacco aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ paṇidhāya brahmacariyaṃ carati, imin'āhaṃ sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devo vā bhavissāmi dev'aññataro vā'ti.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
devapañha

nt. asking questions by means of deities ✗
devapada

nt. divine footprint; footstep of the gods [deva + pada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning divine footprint; footstep of the gods
Construction deva + pada
Commentary (SNa) devapadānī'ti devānaṃ ñāṇena, devassa vā ñāṇena akkantapadāni. (SNt) devapadānī'ti tesaṃ padāni devapadāni, devo'ti vā sammāsambuddho.
devapadadhammasamannāgata

adj. possessing the quality of a divine footprint [devapada + dhamma + samannāgata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning possessing the quality of a divine footprint
Construction devapada + dhamma + samannāgata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (devapadadhammena + samannāgata)
devaparivāra

adj. surrounded by gods [deva + parivāra] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning surrounded by gods
Construction deva + parivāra
devaparisā

fem. host of devas; assembly of deities [deva + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning host of devas; assembly of deities
Construction deva + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + parisā)
Sanskrit devapariṣad

tassa tattha na h'eva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, api ca kho bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṃ dhammaṃ deseti. tassa evaṃ hoti, ayaṃ vā so dhammavinayo, yatth'āhaṃ pubbe brahmacariyaṃ acarin'ti.

AN 4.191 sotānugatasuttaṃ
devapasaṃsaka

adj. who praises the gods; who approves of the deities [deva + pasaṃsaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who praises the gods; who approves of the deities
Construction deva + pasaṃsaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (deve + pasaṃsaka)
Sanskrit deva + praśaṃsaka

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtapasaṃsakā bhūt'ābhinandino, devapasaṃsakā dev'ābhinandino, pajāpatipasaṃsakā pajāpat'ābhinandino, brahmapasaṃsakā brahm'ābhinandino, te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
devaputta

masc. young deity; minor god; lit. child of god [deva + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning young deity; minor god; lit. child of god
Construction deva + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devassa + putta)
Commentary (SNa) devaputto'ti devānañ'hi aṅke nibbattā purisā devaputtā nāma, itthiyo devadhītaro nāma honti. (SNt) devassa putto devaputto.
Sanskrit devaputra

atha kho rohitasso devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

atha kho kassapo devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

SN 2.1 paṭhamakassapasuttaṃ
devaputtaparisā

fem. retinue of young deities; circle of minor gods [devaputta + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning retinue of young deities; circle of minor gods
Construction devaputta + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devaputtānaṃ + parisā)
Sanskrit devaputra + pariṣad

atha kho susimo devaputto āyasmato sāriputtassa vaṇṇe bhaññamāne mahatiyā devaputtaparisāya parivuto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

SN 2.29 susimasuttaṃ
devaputtasaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 2 (SN2) ✗
devapura

nt. castle of the gods; city of the devas [deva + pura] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning castle of the gods; city of the devas
Construction deva + pura
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + pura)
Sanskrit deva + pura

dhammikā kho devā, adhammikā asurā, idh'eva dān'āhaṃ devapuraṃ gacchāmī'ti, atha kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi muttaṃ attānaṃ samanupassati, dibbehi ca pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
devapuragata

adj. entered the castle of the gods; gone into the city of the devas [devapura + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning entered the castle of the gods; gone into the city of the devas
Construction devapura + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (devapuraṃ + gata)
Sanskrit deva + pura + gata

parājitā ca, bhikkhave, devā bhītā devapuraṃ'y'eva pavisiṃsu. devapuragatānañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, devānaṃ etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni mayaṃ etarahi attanā viharāma akaraṇīyā asurehī'ti. asurānampi, bhikkhave, etadahosi, bhīruttānagatena kho dāni devā etarahi attanā viharanti akaraṇīyā amhehī'ti.

devamanussanirayādisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.111-113 (SN56.111-113) ✗
devamanussapūjita

adj. worshipped by gods and men [devamanussa + pūjita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning worshipped by gods and men
Construction devamanussa + pūjita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (devamanussehi + pūjita)
Sanskrit devamanuṣya + pūjita

yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni,
bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe,
tathāgataṃ devamanussapūjitaṃ,
buddhaṃ namassāma suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
devamanussaloka

masc. world of gods and men [deva + manussa + loka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning world of gods and men
Construction deva + manussa + loka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devamanussānaṃ + loka)
Sanskrit deva + manuṣya + loka

ye kec'ime samaṇabrāhmaṇāse,
diṭṭhassutenāpi vadanti suddhiṃ,
sīlabbatenāpi vadanti suddhiṃ,
anekarūpena vadanti suddhiṃ,
te ce muni brūsi anoghatiṇṇe,
atha ko carahi devamanussaloke,
atāri jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 62 nanda māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 7

te ce n'ātariṃsu yājayogā,
yaññehi jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
atha ko carahi devamanussaloke,
atāri jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
devamanussaseṭṭha

masc. foremost among gods and men; best among divine and human beings [devamanussa + seṭṭha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning foremost among gods and men; best among divine and human beings
Construction devamanussa + seṭṭha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devamanussānaṃ + seṭṭha)
Sanskrit devamanuṣya + śreṣṭha

yo dhammayāgaṃ ayajī amaccharī,
tathāgato sabbabhūt'ānukampī,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ devamanussaseṭṭhaṃ,
sattā namassanti bhavassa pāragun'ti.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
devamanussā

masc. gods and human beings; deities and men [deva + manussa + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning gods and human beings; deities and men
Construction deva + manussa + ā
devamanussa + ā

Commentary (ANa) devamanussānan'ti devānañ'ca manussānañ'ca
Sanskrit devamanuṣya

caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ, mā ekena dve agamittha

te ce n'ātariṃsu yājayogā,
yaññehi jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
atha ko carahi devamanussaloke,
atāri jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

devamānusa

masc. deities and humans; gods and men [deva + mānusa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning deities and humans; gods and men
Construction deva + mānusa
Compound dvanda (devā ca mānusā ca)

Sanskrit deva + mānuṣa

khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṃ,
ye gottapaṭisārino,
vijjācaraṇasampanno,
so seṭṭho devamānuse'ti.

MN 53 sekhasuttaṃ
devayāna

nt. celestial chariot; vehicle of the gods; spaceship [deva + yāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning celestial chariot; vehicle of the gods; spaceship
Construction deva + yāna
Compound kammadhāraya (deva + yāna)
Sanskrit devayāna

devayānaṃ abhiruyha,
virajaṃ so mahāpathaṃ,
kāmarāgaṃ virājetvā,
brahmalok'ūpago ahu,
na naṃ jāti nivāresi,
brahmalok'ūpapattiyā.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
devayāniya

adj. leading to the devas ✗
devara

masc. brother-in-law, husband's brother ✗
devarajja

nt. rulership of the gods [deva + rajja] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning rulership of the gods
Construction deva + rajja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + rajja)
Sanskrit deva + rājya

sattakkhattuṃ mahābrahmā,
vasavattī tadā ahuṃ,
chattiṃsakkhattuṃ dev'indo,
devarajjam'akārayiṃ.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ

padesarajjaṃ issariyaṃ,
cakkavattisukhaṃ piyaṃ,
devarajjam'pi dibbesu,
sabbam'etena labbhati.

sattakkhattuṃ mahābrahmā,
vasavattī tadā ahuṃ,
chattiṃsakkhattuṃ dev'indo,
devarajjam'akārayiṃ.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
devarāja

masc. king of the gods; divine ruler [deva + rāja] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, comp
Meaning king of the gods; divine ruler
Construction deva + rāja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + rāja)
Sanskrit devarāja

sakko devarājā, kiṃ no sādhāraṇena rajjenā'ti asure dibbapānaṃ pāyetvā matte samāne pādesu gāhāpetvā sinerupabbatapāde khipāpesi. te asurabhavanam'eva sampāpuṇiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

samās'antagatānaṃ nāmānam'anto saro kvaci akāro hoti. devānaṃ rājā devarājo, devarājā, devānaṃ sakhā devasakho, devasakhā, pañca ahāni pañc'āhaṃ, satt'āhaṃ, pañcagavaṃ, chatt'upāhanaṃ, upasaradaṃ, visāl'akkho, vimukho.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 337
devala

masc. name of an ascetic [√div + *a + la] ~

Grammar masc, from deva
Meaning name of an ascetic
Root Family √div
Root √div･3 ya (shine)
Construction √div > dev + *a + la
deva + la
Derivative taddhita (la)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit devala
Sanskrit Root √div 4 (play)
devaloka

masc. heaven; world of gods; heavenly realm [deva + loka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning heaven; world of gods; heavenly realm
Construction deva + loka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + loka)
Sanskrit devaloka

katamā ca, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

loko'ti nirayaloko tiracchānaloko pettivisayaloko manussaloko devaloko khandhaloko dhātuloko āyatanaloko ayaṃ loko paro loko brahmaloko devaloko, ayaṃ vuccati loko.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa

katamā ca, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

devalokasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.18 (AN3.18) ✗
devalokābhinandī

adj. who delights in heaven; thoroughly enjoying the world of the gods; very happy in heaven; (comm) aspiring for heaven [devaloka + abhinandī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who delights in heaven; thoroughly enjoying the world of the gods; very happy in heaven; (comm) aspiring for heaven

Sanskrit devaloka + abhinandin

tapojigucchāya āyuttā,
pālayaṃ pavivekiyaṃ,
rūpe ca ye niviṭṭhāse,
devalok'ābhinandino,
te ve samm'ānusāsanti,
paralokāya mātiyā'ti.

devasabhā

fem. hall of the gods [deva + sabhā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning hall of the gods
Construction deva + sabhā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + sabhā)
Sanskrit sabhā

sace, mārisā, dev'āsurasaṅgāme samupabyūḷhe devā jineyyuṃ asurā parājineyyuṃ, yena naṃ vepacittiṃ asur'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā mama santike āneyyātha sudhammaṃ devasabhan'ti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ

atha kho, bhikkhave, devā tāvatiṃsā vepacittiṃ asur'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā sakkassa devānam'indassa santike ānesuṃ sudhammaṃ devasabhaṃ.
