devahitasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 7.13 (SN7.13) ✗
devāna

masc. of the deities; of the gods [√div + *a + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, gen pl of deva, irreg form of devānaṃ
Meaning of the deities; of the gods
Root Family √div
Root √div･3 ya (shine)
Construction √div > dev + *a + ānaṃ
deva + āna(ṃ) > devāna
Phonetic Change i > e
English Cognate divine, divinity, divination, diviner
Sanskrit devānām
Sanskrit Root √div 4 (play)

saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyya,
dajjā appam'pi yācito,
etehi tīhi ṭhānehi,
gacche devāna santike.

DHP 224 kodhavaggo
devānamāgata

adj. come from the gods [devānaṃ + āgata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning come from the gods
Construction devānaṃ + āgata
devānaminda

masc. lord of the gods; epithet of Sakka [devānaṃ + inda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning lord of the gods; epithet of Sakka
Construction devānaṃ + inda
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (devānaṃ + inda)
Sanskrit devānām + indra

addasā kho, bhikkhave, vepacitti asur'indo sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ. disvāna sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ etadavoca, tikiccha maṃ devānam'indā'ti

SN 11.23 sambarimāyāsuttaṃ

sace, mārisā, dev'āsurasaṅgāme samupabyūḷhe asurā jineyyuṃ devā parājineyyuṃ, yena naṃ sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā mama santike āneyyātha asurapuran'ti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
devānubhāva

masc. divine power ✗
devānumodanti

sandhi. the gods rejoice; the deities appreciate [devā + anumodanti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + pr
Meaning the gods rejoice; the deities appreciate
Construction devā + anumodanti
Commentary (SNPa) sabbe devā'ti ākāsaṭṭhā ca bhūmaṭṭhā ca
Sanskrit devāḥ + anumodanti

tassa te nāga nāgassa,
mahāvīrassa bhāsato,
sabbe dev'ānumodanti,
ubho nāradapabbatā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
devāpi

sandhi. even the gods [devā + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + ind
Meaning even the gods
Construction devā + api
Sanskrit devāḥ + api

yaṃ manussā namassanti,
sabbadhammāna pāraguṃ,
devā'pi taṃ namassanti,
iti me arahato sutaṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā

ye jhānapasutā dhīrā,
nekkhamm'ūpasame ratā,
devā'pi tesaṃ pihayanti,
sambuddhānaṃ satīmataṃ.

DHP 181 buddhavaggo
devābhinandī

adj. who delights in the gods; who relishes the gods; who is very happy with the gods [deva + abhinandī] ✓

Sanskrit deva + abhinandin

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtapasaṃsakā bhūt'ābhinandino, devapasaṃsakā dev'ābhinandino, pajāpatipasaṃsakā pajāpat'ābhinandino, brahmapasaṃsakā brahm'ābhinandino, te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

English Cognate divine, divinity, divination, diviner

DN 17.4 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca, atthi nu kho te, mallike, koc'añño attanā piyataro'ti?

kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.

desanāsutta

desayati

pr. preaches (to); teaches (to); explains (to) [√dis] ✗

Construction desaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change i > e
Synonym desenta
Sanskrit deśayat
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

sutam'eva pure āsi,
dhammo cakkhumat'ānubuddho,
s'āhaṃ dāni sakkhi jānāmi,
munino desayato sugatassa.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ

pajjotakaro ativijjha,
sabbaṭṭhitīnaṃ atikkamamaddasa,
ñatvā ca sacchikatvā ca,
aggaṃ so desayi das'addhānaṃ.

SN 8.8 parosahassasuttaṃ
desassu

imp. (+acc) you yourself must preach; you yourself must teach; you yourself must explain [√dis + *e + ssu] ✓

Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + ssu > desassu
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant desetu
Notes misspelling for desessu
Sanskrit deśayasva
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke,
desassu bhagavā dhammaṃ,
aññātāro bhavissantī'ti.

desāpeti

pr. makes teach or expound; makes assign; makes tell or confess [√dis] ✗

Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *āpe (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *āpe > desāpe (caus)
Construction desāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit diś
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

ñattidutiyena kammena kuṭivatthuṃ na desāpetvā, āyāmato vā vitthārato vā antamaso kes'aggamattam'pi atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge payoge dukkaṭaṃ. ekaṃ piṇḍaṃ anāgate āpatti thullaccayassa. tasmiṃ piṇḍe āgate āpatti saṅghādisesassa.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

ñattidutiyena kammena vihāravatthuṃ na desāpetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. ekaṃ piṇḍaṃ anāgate, āpatti thullaccayassa. tasmiṃ piṇḍe āgate, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.

saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā,
māy'ūpamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ,
desita-ādiccabandhunā.

imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.

Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke.

ITI 49 diṭṭhigatasuttaṃ

aññassa bhagavā buddho,
dhammaṃ desesi cakkhumā,
dhamme desiyamānamhi,
sotam'odhesim'atthiko,
taṃ me amoghaṃ savanaṃ,
vimutto'mhi anāsavo.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
desetabba 1

ptp. should be preached (to); should be taught (to); should be explained (to); lit. to be caused to point out [√dis + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of deseti, caus
Meaning should be preached (to); should be taught (to); should be explained (to); lit. to be caused to point out
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit deśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

na kho, ānanda, sukaraṃ paresaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ. paresaṃ, ānanda, dhammaṃ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo. katame pañca?

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ

na chamāyaṃ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca chamāyaṃ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

Sanskrit deśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

kārāpeyyā'ti karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena bhinditvā pācittiyaṃ desetabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.9.4 sūcigharasikkhāpadaṃ
desetabba 3

ptp. (+instr) should be appointed (by); should be indicated (by); should be designated (by); lit. to be caused to point out [√dis + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of deseti, caus (+instr)
Meaning should be appointed (by); should be indicated (by); should be designated (by); lit. to be caused to point out
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit deśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

VIN PAT SA 6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

VIN PAT SA 7 vihārakārasikkhāpadaṃ
desetar

masc. (+acc and +dat) teacher; who preaches (to) [√dis + *e + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from deseti, caus (+acc and +dat)
Meaning teacher; who preaches (to)
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change i > e
Notes agent noun used verbally see Perniola §292
Sanskrit √diś
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, aggivessana, anekasatāya parisāya dhammaṃ desetā. apissu maṃ ekam'eko evaṃ maññati, mam'ev'ārabbha samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ desetī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
deseti 1

pr. (+acc and +dat) preach (to); teaches (to); explains (to) [√dis + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of disati, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning preach (to); teaches (to); explains (to)
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (SNa) desetī'ti dasseti. (ANa) desessāmī'ti ... pakāsayissāmi.
Sanskrit deśayati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

bhārañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi bhārahārañ'ca bhār'ādānañ'ca bhāranikkhepanañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhāro?

SN 22.22 bhārasuttaṃ

ussādanañ'ca jaññā, apasādanañ'ca jaññā, ussādanañ'ca ñatvā apasādanañ'ca ñatvā n'ev'ussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammam'eva deseyya.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
deseti 2

pr. (+acc and +dat or +loc) (vinaya) confesses (to); admits (to) [√dis + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of disati, trans (+acc and +dat or +loc)
Meaning (vinaya) confesses (to); admits (to)
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit deśayati
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ yā c'eva āyasmantānaṃ āpatti, yā ca attano āpatti, āyasmantānañc'eva atthāya, attano ca atthāya, saṅghamajjhe tiṇ'avatthārakena deseyyaṃ, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan'ti.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
desetuṃ

inf. (+acc and +dat) to preach (to); to teach (to); to explain (to) [√dis + *e + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of deseti, caus, trans (+acc and +dat)
Meaning to preach (to); to teach (to); to explain (to)
Root Family √dis
Root √dis･1 *e (point out, explain)
Base √dis + *e > dese (caus)
Construction dese + tuṃ
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (SNa) desetun'ti pakāsetuṃ.
Sanskrit deṣṭum
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

sakkā evam'evaṃ viññāṇam'p'idaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññāpetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ iti'p'idaṃ viññāṇaṃ anattā'ti.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ

na kho, ānanda, sukaraṃ paresaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ. paresaṃ, ānanda, dhammaṃ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo. katame pañca?

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'c'āpi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

missaṃ bālehi paṇḍitaṃ,
bhāsamānañ'ca jānanti,
desentaṃ amataṃ padaṃ.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ

so suṇāti tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā sabbesaṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhāna-adhiṭṭhāna-pariyuṭṭhāna-abhinivesa-anusayānaṃ samugghātāya sabbasaṅkhārasamathāya sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammaṃ desentassa.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

aññassa bhagavā buddho,
dhammaṃ desesi cakkhumā,
dhamme desiyamānamhi,
sotam'odhesim'atthiko,
taṃ me amoghaṃ savanaṃ,
vimutto'mhi anāsavo.

na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigiṃse,
desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena,
adassanaṃ'y'eva tadajjhagamā'ti.

aham'asmi, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇo yācayogo sadā payatapāṇi antimadehadharo anuttaro bhisakko sallakatto.

kimhi tattha manaṃ nivesaye.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
dehī

masc. that which has a body, creature ✗
doṇa 1

nt. measure of volume; bucket; trough; vat ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning measure of volume; bucket; trough; vat
Notes 4 āḷhaka = 1 doṇa 4 tumba = 1 doṇa
Sanskrit droṇa

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo doṇapākakuraṃ bhuñjati. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhuttāvī mah'assāsī yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ

andhabālo'si, mahārāja, kiñ'c'āpi mahābhakkho'si, anekasūpabyañjanavikatikaṃ doṇapākaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasi, dvīsu raṭṭhesu rajjaṃ kāresi, paññā pana te mandā'ti

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
doṇa 2

masc. name of a Brahman [doṇa] ✗
doṇapāka

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo doṇapākakuraṃ bhuñjati. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhuttāvī mah'assāsī yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

andhabālo'si, mahārāja, kiñ'c'āpi mahābhakkho'si, anekasūpabyañjanavikatikaṃ doṇapākaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasi, dvīsu raṭṭhesu rajjaṃ kāresi, paññā pana te mandā'ti

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
doṇapākakura

nt. bucketful of boiled rice; trough-full of cooked rice; large quantities of cooked rice [doṇa + pāka + kura] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bucketful of boiled rice; trough-full of cooked rice; large quantities of cooked rice

Variant doṇapākasudaṃ, doṇapākaṃ sudaṃ
Commentary (SNa) doṇapākakuran'ti doṇapākaṃ kuraṃ, doṇassa taṇḍulānaṃ pakkabhattaṃ tadūpiyañ'ca sūpabyañjanaṃ bhuñjatī'ti attho.

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo doṇapākakuraṃ bhuñjati. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhuttāvī mah'assāsī yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
doṇapākasutta

doṇamite sukhadukkhe pariyantakate saṃsāre, n'atthi hāyanavaḍḍhane, n'atthi ukkaṃs'āvakaṃse.

DN 2.5 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
doṇasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.36 (AN4.36) ✗
doṇi 1

fem. wooden bucket; wooden tub; wooden trough [doṇa + i] ✓

Grammar fem, from doṇa
Meaning wooden bucket; wooden tub; wooden trough
Construction doṇa + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Sanskrit droṇī

santi, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa oḷārikā upakkilesā paṃsuvālukā sakkharakaṭhalā. tam'enaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovak'antevāsī vā doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
doṇi 2

fem. (of a veena) soundbox; body; lit. wooden bucket [doṇa + i] ✓

Grammar fem, from doṇa
Meaning (of a veena) soundbox; body; lit. wooden bucket
Construction doṇa + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Sanskrit droṇī

anekehi sambhārehi samāraddhā vadati, seyyath'idaṃ, doṇiñ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca daṇḍañ'ca paṭicca upadhāraṇe ca paṭicca tantiyo ca paṭicca koṇañ'ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjaṃ vāyāmaṃ paṭicca ev'āyaṃ, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
doṇi 3

fem. feed-trough; manger [doṇa + i] ✓

Grammar fem, from doṇa
Meaning feed-trough; manger
Construction doṇa + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Commentary (ANa) doṇiyā baddho'ti yavasassadoṇiyā samīpe baddho.
Sanskrit droṇī

assakhaḷuṅko hi, sandha, doṇiyā baddho, yavasaṃ yavasan'ti jhāyati. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi, sandha, assakhaḷuṅkassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṃ hoti, kiṃ nu kho maṃ ajja assadammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāressati, kim'ass'āhaṃ paṭikaromī'ti.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
doṇi 4

fem. boat, canoe [doṇa] ✗
doṇi 5

fem. measure of volume (16 nāḷi = 1 doṇi) [doṇa] ✗
doṇikā

fem. boat, canoe, trough ✗
doṇī 1

fem. wooden trough or tub; trough [doṇa] ✗
doṇī 2

fem. body or belly of a veena [doṇa] ✗
domanassa

nt. (mental) suffering; distress; dissatisfaction; dejection; depression; grief; negative state of mind [dur + √man + as + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from manas
Meaning (mental) suffering; distress; dissatisfaction; dejection; depression; grief; negative state of mind
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction dur > do + √man + as + *ya
dummanas + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym somanassa
Sanskrit daurmanasya
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā

DN 22.1 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

pahānaṃ kāmacchandānaṃ,
domanassāna c'ūbhayaṃ,
thinassa ca panūdanaṃ,
kukkuccānaṃ nivāraṇaṃ.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13
domanassaṭṭhāniya

adj. being a cause of dejection ✗
domanassaṭṭhānīya

adj. productive of distress; which supports unhappiness; serving as a basis for dissatisfaction [domanassa + ṭhānīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning productive of distress; which supports unhappiness; serving as a basis for dissatisfaction
Construction domanassa + ṭhānīya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (domanassaṃ + ṭhānīya)
Sanskrit daurmanasya + sthānīya

aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā somanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, domanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, upekkhāṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
domanassadhātu

fem. state of mental pain [domanassa + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of mental pain
Construction domanassa + dhātu
domanassavedaniya

adj. depressing; distressing; lit. to be felt as mental suffering [domanassa + vedaniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning depressing; distressing; lit. to be felt as mental suffering
Construction domanassa + vedaniya
Sanskrit daurmanasya + vedanīya
domanassindriya

nt. mental suffering; faculty of distress; unhappiness [domanassa + indriya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mental suffering; faculty of distress; unhappiness
Construction domanassa + indriya
Commentary (PMa) domanassayogato duṭṭhu mano assā'ti, hīnavedanattā vā kucchitaṃ mano assā'ti dummano, dummanassa bhāvo domanassaṃ, cetasikaasātalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretī'ti indriyaṃ, domanassam'eva indriyaṃ domanass'indriyaṃ.
Sanskrit daurmanasya + indriya

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, domanass'indriyaṃ? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ, cetasikaṃ asātaṃ, manosamphassajaṃ dukkhaṃ asātaṃ vedayitaṃ

SN 48.38 tatiyavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

jīvit'indriyaṃ, sukh'indriyaṃ, dukkh'indriyaṃ, somanass'indriyaṃ, domanass'indriyaṃ, upekkh'indriyaṃ

Abhi Vibh 5.1 vipassanā-bhūmi-pāṭho
domanassindriyanirodha

masc. ending of mental suffering; cessation of the faculty of distress [domanassindriya + nirodha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of mental suffering; cessation of the faculty of distress
Construction domanassindriya + nirodha
domanassindriyasamudaya

masc. appearance of mental suffering; arising of the faculty of distress [domanassindriya + samudaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning appearance of mental suffering; arising of the faculty of distress
Construction domanassindriya + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (domanassindriyassa + samudaya)
domanassupavicārā

fem. exploration with mental dissatisfaction [domanassa + upavicārā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning exploration with mental dissatisfaction
Construction domanassa + upavicārā
domanassūpavicāra

masc. exploration with sorrow; probing with distress [domanassa + upavicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning exploration with sorrow; probing with distress
Construction domanassa + upavicāra
Phonetic Change u > ū
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (domanassena + upavicāra)
Sanskrit daurmanasya + upavicāra

iti cha somanass'ūpavicārā, cha domanass'ūpavicārā, cha upekkh'ūpavicārā, aṭṭhārasa mano'pavicārā veditabbā'ti, iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dovacassakaraṇa

adj. which make one hard to talk to; causing obstinance; making one obdurate; lit. making hard to talk to state [dovacassa + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which make one hard to talk to; causing obstinance; making one obdurate; lit. making hard to talk to state
Construction dovacassa + karaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dovacassaṃ + karaṇa)
Commentary (VINa) dovacassakaraṇehī'ti dubbacabhāvakaraṇīyehi, ye dhammā dubbacaṃ puggalaṃ karonti, tehi samannāgato'ti attho. (MNa) dovacassakaraṇehī'ti dubbacabhāvakārakehi upari āgatehi soḷasahi dhammehi.
Sanskrit daurvacasya (bsk) + karaṇa

bhikkhū pan'eva dubbacajātiko hotī'ti dubbaco hoti dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato akkhamo appadakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ.

VIN 1.2.12 dubbacasikkhāpadaṃ

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu att'ukkaṃsako hoti paravambhī. yam'p'āvuso, bhikkhu att'ukkaṃsako hoti paravambhī, ayam'pi dhammo dovacassakaraṇo.

MN 15 anumānasuttaṃ
dovacassatā

fem. resistance to admonition [√vac] ✗
dovacassatāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.115 (AN6.115) ✗
dovārika

masc. doorman; gatekeeper; bouncer [√dvar + *a + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from dvāra
Meaning doorman; gatekeeper; bouncer
Root Family √dvar
Root √dvar×1 a (obstruct, prohibit)
Construction √dvar > dvār + *a > dovāra + *ika
dvāra + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change v > ov
Sanskrit dauvārika
Sanskrit Root √dvṛ 1 (obstruct)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhu, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ daḷh'uddhāpaṃ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṃ chadvāraṃ. tatr'assa dovāriko paṇḍito byatto medhāvī, aññātānaṃ nivāretā, ñātānaṃ pavesetā.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

dovārikaṃ āmantesi, ajja't'agge, samma dovārika, āvarāmi dvāraṃ nigaṇṭhānaṃ nigaṇṭhīnaṃ, anāvaṭaṃ dvāraṃ bhagavato bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ upāsakānaṃ upāsikānaṃ.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
dosa 1

masc. aversion; ill-will; hate; hatred [√dus + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from dussati
Meaning aversion; ill-will; hate; hatred
Root Family √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (hate, dislike)
Construction √dus > dos + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym adosa, pema
Commentary (SNa) dussanalakkhaṇo doso
Sanskrit dveṣa
Sanskrit Root √dviṣ 2, 6 (hate)

lobho akusalamūlaṃ doso akusalamūlaṃ moho akusalamūlaṃ idaṃ vuccat'āvuso akusalamūlaṃ.

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
dosa 2

masc. fault; wrong; error [√dus + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from dussati
Meaning fault; wrong; error
Root Family √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (be angry, corrupt)
Construction √dus > dos + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit doṣa
Sanskrit Root √duṣ 4 (spoil)

ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ

nārado sabbaṃ taṃ pavattiṃ ācikkhitvā iminā kāraṇena ahaṃ iminā abhisapito, ath'āhaṃ, mayhaṃ doso n'atthi, yassa doso atthi, tass'eva upari abhisapo patatū'ti vatvā abhisapiṃ

DHPa 1.1.3 tissatthera vatthu

Construction √dus > dos + *a

Sanskrit doṣa
Sanskrit Root √duṣ 4 (spoil)

imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṃ samaṇadosānaṃ samaṇakasaṭānaṃ āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānaṃ duggativedaniyānaṃ appahānā, na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno'ti vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

pañcadosavivajjitan'ti, pañc'ime caṅkamadosā nāma, thaddhavisamatā, antorukkhatā, gahanacchannatā, atisambādhatā, ativisālatā'ti.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
dosa 4

adj. angry; wrathful; malicious; upset [√dus + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from dussati
Meaning angry; wrathful; malicious; upset
Root Family √dus
Root √dus･3 ya (be angry, corrupt)
Construction √dus > dos + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (VIN 1.2.8) duṭṭho doso'ti kupito anattamano anabhiraddho āhatacitto khilajāto.
Sanskrit dveṣa
Sanskrit Root √duṣ 4 (spoil)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti

VIN PAT SA 8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñcidesaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti

Commentary (MNa) abhidosakālaṅkato'ti aḍḍharatte kālaṅkato.
Sanskrit doṣā
Sanskrit Root √duṣ 4 (spoil)

atha kho maṃ, bhikkhave, devatā upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca, abhidosakālaṅkato, bhante, udako rāmaputto'ti. ñāṇañca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi, abhidosakālaṅkato udako rāmaputto'ti.

dosakkhaya

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dosassa + khaya)

tassa tiṭṭhant'eva pañc'indriyāni yesaṃ avighātattā manāp'āmanāpaṃ paccanubhoti, sukhadukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. tassa yo rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saupādisesā nibbānadhātu.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, pariññā? rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, pariññā

SN 22.106 pariññeyyasuttaṃ
dosagata

masc. state of aversion [dosa + gata] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning state of aversion
Construction dosa + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dosaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit dveṣa + gata

saddañ'ca sutvā dubhayaṃ piy'āppiyaṃ,
piyamhi sadde na samucchito siyā,
atho'ppiye dosagataṃ vinodaye,
na c'āppiyaṃ me'ti manaṃ padosaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
dosagaru

adj. with heavy hatred; with intense ill-will [dosa + garu] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with heavy hatred; with intense ill-will
Construction dosa + garu
Compound kammadhāraya (dosa + garu)
Commentary (SNa) dosagarū'ti dosaṃ garuṃ katvā ādāya viharanto.
Sanskrit dveṣa + guru

accayaṃ desayantīnaṃ,
yo ce na paṭigaṇhati,
kop'antaro dosagaru,
sa veraṃ paṭimuñcatī'ti.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ
dosagāmitā

fem. state of being motivated by hate; state of being driven by ill-will; lit. going by hatred state [dosa + gāmī + tā] ~

Meaning state of being motivated by hate; state of being driven by ill-will; lit. going by hatred state
Construction dosa + gāmī + tā
dosagāmī + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (VINa) chandagāmitā … bhayagāmitā pāpentī'ti ete chandagāmino ca … bhayagāmino cā'ti evaṃ chandagāmitāya'pi … bhayagāmitāya'pi pāpenti, yojentī'ti attho.
Sanskrit dveṣa + gāmin +
dosagāmī

adj. motivated by hate; driven by ill-will; lit. going by hatred [dosa + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning motivated by hate; driven by ill-will; lit. going by hatred
Construction dosa + gāmī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dosena + gāmī)
Sanskrit dveṣa + gāmin

chandagāmino ca bhikkhū, dosagāmino ca bhikkhū, mohagāmino ca bhikkhū, bhayagāmino ca bhikkhū t'ādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti, ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti.

VIN PAT SA 13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
dosaggi

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire of hatred; fire of ill-will
Construction dosa + agni

kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi.

SN 35.28 ādittasuttaṃ
dosaja

adj. born from hatred; produced by ill-will [dosa + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from hatred; produced by ill-will
Construction dosa + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (dosamhā + ja)
Sanskrit dveṣa + ja

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, kumāra, api nu tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā uppajjeyyuṃ dosajā pariḷāhā kāyikā vā cetasikā vā yehi so dosajehi pariḷāhehi pariḍayhamāno dukkhaṃ sayeyyā'ti?

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

dosaṃ vineyya viharanto na dosajaṃ kammaṃ karissasi kāyena vācāya manasā. mohaṃ vineyya viharāhi. mohaṃ vineyya viharanto na mohajaṃ kammaṃ karissasi kāyena vācāya manasā.

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ

dosadosa

adj. ruined by hatred; spoiled by ill-will; corrupted by aversion [dosa + dosa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ruined by hatred; spoiled by ill-will; corrupted by aversion

tiṇadosāni khettāni,
dosadosā ayaṃ pajā,
tasmā hi vītadosesu,
dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ.

DHP 357 taṇhāvaggo
dosadhamma

masc. state of aversion; characteristic of hatred [dosa + dhamma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning state of aversion; characteristic of hatred
Construction dosa + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (dosa + dhamma)
Sanskrit dveṣa + dharman

sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho uccākulīnatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, kosu nāma me dhammo ajjhattaṃ appahīno yena me ekadā lobhadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, dosadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, mohadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhantī'ti.

adj. producing ill-will or hostility; causing anger ✗
dosantara

adj. bearing anger; with aversion; lit. anger inside [dosa + antara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bearing anger; with aversion; lit. anger inside
Construction dosa + antara
Compound kammadhāraya (dosa + antara)
Antonym mettacitta
Sanskrit dveṣa + antara

kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṃhitena, mettacitto vakkhāmi, no dos'antaro'ti, ime pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbā

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

tatr'āpi te, phagguna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na c'eva me cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ bhavissati, na ca pāpikaṃ vācaṃ nicchāressāmi, hit'ānukampī ca viharissāmi mettacitto, na dos'antaro'ti.

nt. Itivuttaka 10 (ITI 10) ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning removing and ending ill-will
Construction dosa + vinaya + pariyosāna
Commentary (SNa) idāni'ssa niddosabhāvañ'c'eva saṅgāma-vijaya-bhāvañ'ca dassento rāgavinayapariyosānā'ti-ādim'āha. tattha rāgaṃ vinayamānā pariyosāpeti pariyosānaṃ gacchati nipphajjatī'ti rāgavinayapariyosānā. esa nayo sabbattha.

Meaning like hatred; equal to aversion

Sanskrit dveṣa + sama

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo kali,
n'atthi khandhasamā dukkhā,
n'atthi santiparaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 202 sukhavaggo

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo gaho,
n'atthi mohasamaṃ jālaṃ,
n'atthi taṇhāsamā nadī.

dosasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 2 (ITI 2) ✗
dosahetuka

adj. because of hatred; based on ill-will [dosa + hetuka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning because of hatred; based on ill-will
Construction dosa + hetuka
Compound kammadhāraya (dosa + hetuka)
Sanskrit dveṣa + hetuka

adinn'ādānam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, tividhaṃ vadāmi, lobhahetukam'pi, dosahetukam'pi, mohahetukam'pi.

dvaya 1

adj. twofold; dual; double [dvi + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from dvi
Meaning twofold; dual; double

Phonetic Change i > ay
Antonym advaya
Synonym dvāya
Sanskrit dvaya

na h'eva saccāni bahūni nānā,
aññatra saññāya niccāni loke,
takkañ'ca diṭṭhīsu pakappayitvā,
saccaṃ musā'ti dvayadhammam'āhu.

aṭṭhakavaggo 12

so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena sampādeti, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.

yadā dvayesu dhammesu,
pāragū hoti brāhmaṇo,
ath'assa sabbe saṃyogā,
atthaṃ gacchanti jānato.

Construction dvādasa + vassa + uddesika

Phonetic Change a > ā
English Cognate door
Sanskrit dvāra

apārutā tesaṃ amatassa dvārā,
ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṃ,
vihiṃsasaññī paguṇaṃ na bhāsiṃ,
dhammaṃ paṇītaṃ manujesu brahme'ti.

Construction dvi + yojana + satika
Compound kammadhāraya (dvi + yojanasatika)
Sanskrit dvi + yojana + śatika

hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde yojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, dviyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, tiyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti, catuyojanasatikāni'pi udakāni ogacchanti

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
dvirāvaṭṭa

adj. with a see-saw; turning between two things; (comm) turning between eternalism and annihilationism; lit. two turnings [dvi + āvaṭṭa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a see-saw; turning between two things; (comm) turning between eternalism and annihilationism; lit. two turnings
Construction dvi + [r] + āvaṭṭa
Phonetic Change +r
Compound kammadhāraya (dvi + āvaṭṭā)
Commentary (SNa) dvīhi sassatucchedadiṭṭhīhi āvaṭṭatī'ti dvi'r'āvaṭṭā. (SNt) tattha yā bhavataṇhā, sā sassatadiṭṭhivasena āvaṭṭati parivattati, vibhavataṇhā ucchedadiṭṭhivasena, evaṃ dvi'r'āvaṭṭaṃ.
Notes Then there is the term 'dvirāvaṭṭaṃ', 'double-turning' or 'turning between two things'. These too we can understand through Salla Sutta (SN 36.6) ... Because he doesn't see an exit from painful feeling other than a recourse to sensual pleasures, the ordinary worldling keeps on turning back and forth between pain and pleasure. That is why we call it a see-sawing between these two extremes due to ignorance about the neither painful nor pleasant (neutral) feeling at the middle.
Sanskrit dvi + āvarta

ekamūlaṃ dvi'r'āvaṭṭaṃ,
timalaṃ pañcapattharaṃ,
samuddaṃ dvādas'āvaṭṭaṃ,
pātālaṃ atarī isī'ti.

SN 1.44 ekamūlasuttaṃ
dvisalla

masc. two arrows [dvi + salla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning two arrows
Construction dvi + salla
Compound digu (dve + sallā)
Sanskrit dvi + śalya

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, purisaṃ sallena vijjheyya. tam'enaṃ dutiyena sallena anuvedhaṃ vijjheyya. evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, puriso dvisallena vedanaṃ vedayati.

Construction dvi + sahassa + ī
dvisahassa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Commentary (ANa) dvisahassī majjhimikā lokadhātū'ti ayaṃ sahassacakkavāḷāni sahassabhāgena gaṇetvā dasasatasahassacakkavāḷaparimāṇā dvisahassī majjhimikā nāma lokadhātu. ayaṃ sāvakānaṃ avisayo, buddhānam'eva visayo. ettake'pi hi ṭhāne tathāgatā andhakāraṃ vidhametvā sarīrobhāsaṃ dassetvā sarena viññāpetuṃ sakkontī'ti dīpeti. ettakena buddhānaṃ jātikkhettaṃ nāma dassitaṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
dvīhitika

adj. hard to keep going in; hard to survive in; difficult to live in; lit. bad striving [dur + √īh + ita + ika] ~

Grammar adj, from īhita
Meaning hard to keep going in; hard to survive in; difficult to live in; lit. bad striving
Root Family √īh
Root √īh･1 a (strive)
Construction dur + √īh + ita + ika
dvīhita + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (VINa) tattha dvīhitikā'ti dvidhā pavattaīhitikā. īhitaṃ nāma iriyā dvidhā pavattā, cittairiyā, cittaīhā. ettha lacchāma nu kho kiñci bhikkhamānā na lacchāmā'ti, jīvituṃ vā sakkhissāma nu kho no'ti ayam'ettha adhippāyo. (VINa) atha vā dvīhitikā'ti dujjīvikā, īhitaṃ īhā iriyanaṃ pavattanaṃ jīvitan'tiādīni padāni ekatthāni. tasmā dukkhena īhitaṃ ettha pavattatī'ti dvīhitikāti ayam'ettha pad'attho.
Sanskrit Root √īh 1 (be eager)

dūpadhāritenāti

dūpadhāritena + iti
dūrampi

dūra + api
dūraṃ + api
dūratopi

dūrato + api
dūratova

dūrato + eva
dūrato + iva
dūravihāravuttino

dūra + vihāra + vuttino
dūreti

dūre + iti
dūrevime

dūra + eva + ime
dūre + eva + ime
dūsessantīti

dūsessanti + iti
dūsesuñca

dūsesuṃ + ca
dūsesīti

dūsesi + iti
dūsethāti

dūsetha + iti
dūsetunti

dūsetuṃ + iti
dūseyyunti

dūseyyuṃ + iti
dūsitāti

dūsita + iti
dūsitā + iti
dūtavacanaṃ

dūta + vacanaṃ
dūta + avacanaṃ
dūtayuganti

dūtayugaṃ + iti
dūtenapi

dūtena + api
dūteyyakammesu

dūteyya + kammesu
dūteyya + akammesu
dūteyyaṃ + akammesu
dūteyyañca

dūteyyaṃ + ca
